loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg 5E Group

texts.en:
Champa, a enterprising women from the Koraput district in Odisha are looking to supplement her family income by starting micro-enterprises. Champa currently works as daily wage laborers in agriculture, which is very seasonal and does not generate sufficient income to support her family. Champa, standing right in the photo, wants to weave saris from silk threads. Her husband is a farmer and does paddy cultivation.
 
Champa, along with her group is seeking a loan of 36,000 INR from which Champa will use her portion to buy the raw materials essential to start her business. Having her own micro-enterprise will give her a source of steady income currently unavailable to her and provide for her children's educational expenses. With the supplemental and steady income generated by her business, she plans to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy silk threads to make saris

loans.name: Mukaramahon

texts.ru: Эту молодую девушку зовут Мукарамахон. Ей 25 летняя мать одного 3 летного ребенка. Мукарамахон развелась с мужем, она живет вместе с мамой и ребенком. После развода Мукарама начала зарабатывать самостоятельно, чтобы обеспечить семью. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Ей помогает ее тетя, потому что она тоже мастерица. Мукарамахон 3 года занимается любой работой. Она хочет улучшить и расширить швейную деятельность. Мукарамахон просит кредит для купли ткани и другие швейные принадлежности. Вы можете поддержать Мукарамахон сейчас!

loans.use: Для купли ткани и другие швейные принадлежности.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa runs a small market out of the front of her home. She started her business off by only selling fruits and vegetables with only $20 in capital. She still sells these products but now also includes other items such as sugar, oil and cleaning products. She is requesting this loan because she wants to invest in baby products and more food items. She has a very stable client base and she has noticed that they are in demand for many of these new items.

Narcisa is a single mother of two. She moved to Guayaquil from Portoviejo because her husband was abusive and was not supportive of the family. She completely relies on her business in order to feed and educate her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in more items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds

loans.name: Dunya

texts.en: I. Dunya is 47. She is married and has 2 children. She has lived in  Bilasuvar since 1993 , and she is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh. From her small savings, she purchased a calf and 4 sheep. Now she is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy 1 cow and 1 more calf.

loans.use: purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Wainaina N. is a 42-year-old man, married with four children. Apart from his children, N. supports his aged parents and also takes care of HIV infected and affected people in his community by providing foodstuffs to the affected homes on a weekly basis.

Wainaina started his business in March 2007, his dream come true since he had had a passion to start up a kerosene pump business. Wainaina can be described as a very hardworking man. He previously had set up a small dry cleaning business, which was financed by his benefits from a Nairobi transport provider, Kenya Bus Service Company, after he was laid off. This business was operational from 1998 to 2002. Apart from his business, N. is also a community worker within Kayole where he resides. He runs a small community based organization by the name of AIDS Link, and he is sometimes hired by NGOs and social work groups to assist in matters affecting his community.

Through his hard work, and from the payments he received from the transport company, N. managed to save up Ksh 95,000 (US$ 1440), which he used to start off his kerosene-selling business. He has undergone several business management training courses and has gained a lot of experience, both from the dry cleaning business that he used to run and also from the kerosene business that he is currently operating.

N. wishes to expand his business. His vision for the business is to become able to sell on a wholesale scale in his area. His only difficulty is finances necessary to stock more kerosene, which is the main fuel used for cooking within his community. He is requesting a loan of US$ 800, which will be repayable within 12 months. The loan will enable him to expand his kerosene business and attract more customers, since he will have enough kerosene to meet the needs within his community. This will also enable him to make his prices more reasonable, a great advantage to his customers. The additional stock will also require him to employ 2-3 people from his community, to assist him in serving the customers. The additional loan will enable him to increase his income, hence improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase 5 empty metal drums and 1000 litres of kerosene

loans.name: Ni Putu Yasi

texts.id:
The lives of three children who now sit on a school bench represent an important matter for Ni Putu Yasi, especially as her husband is only a farmer without expansive fields, which inevitably means low earnings. The house in which she lives is very simple and still in a semi-permanent state, although they own it free and clear. For everyday expenses Putu Yasi needs Rp.20,000. In order to get on top of these issues, Putu Yasi diligently began a pig breeding business three years ago. With starting capital of only Rp.800,000, Putu Yasi bought one sow. Every four months the sow gives birth to a litter of between five and eleven piglets, and after the piglets are two months old they are ready to be sold. One piglets sells for Rp.200,000, so the earnings of the sale can reach Rp.2,200,000 (@200,000 x 11). From that sale, profits can be up to Rp.700,000 every six months, after subtracting for the feed (Rp.1,500,000 every six months). These profits are used by Putu Yasi to pay her children's school fees as well as to add to her house. Putu Yasi is very pleased with the loan from Dinari, because with it, she can add to her business. Now Putu Yasi has begun to fatten up two pigs, and the loan of Rp.1,300,000 will be used to puchase pig feed with the hope that the profits will be good and Putu Yasi's children can attend school through a higher grade level.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Menghidupi 3 orang anak yang kini sudah duduk dibangku sekolah merupakan hal yang berat bagi Ni Putu Yasi, apalagi suaminya hanyalah seorang petani yang ladangnya tidak begitu luas,otomatis penghasilannya pun tidak banyak.Rumah yang ditempatipun sangat sederhana dan masih dalam tingkat semipermanen,tetapi sudah menjadi milik sendiri. Sedang untuk keperluan sehari-hari Putu Yasi harus mengeluarkan uang sebesar Rp.20.000. Supaya masalah ini bisa diatasi maka sejak 3 tahun yang lalu Putu Yasi mulai menekuni usaha berternak babi.Modal awal hanya Rp.800.000,Putu Yasi membeli 1 ekor penginduk. Setiap 4 bulan sekali babi penginduk ini melahirkan anak bisanya 5 sampai 11ekor,dan selang 2 bulan kemudian anak-anak babi ini sudah bisa dijual.Satu ekor dijual seharga Rp. 200.000 ,jadi hasil penjulan semuanya sebesar Rp.2.200.000 ( @ 200.000 x 11 ). Dari penjualan ini keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.700.000 per 6 bulan ,setelah dikurangi biaya pakan sebesar Rp.1.500.000 selama 6 bulan.Keuntungan ini dipakai oleh Putu Yasi untuk biaya sekolah anak-anaknya juga untuk mencukupi keperluan rumah tangga. Putu Yasi sangat senang dengan adanya pinjaman dari Dinari,karena dengan adanya pinjaman ini Putu Yasi dapat mengembangkan usahanya karena sekarang Putu Yasi mulai memelihara babi penggemukan 2 ekor,dan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.300.000 dipakai untuk membeli pakan ternak dengan harapan keuntungan yang didapat lebih banyak dan anak-anak Putu Yasi bisa sekolah ketingkat yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: Purchase feed -- Membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is 55 years old, a widow with three (3) children and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to people living in her community. She has 5 years' experience in this business and has been a LAPO member for 4 yrs. She is in need of 325 dollars to enable her to buy more provision, foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en: Lanuola is not new to the SPBD programme and her business is a plantation and she fishes in addition to that. She would like to buy some new tools for her business and that is what she would use the funds for. She said she is happy with SPBD’s help and will welcome the opportunity for another loan in future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and for home improvement

loans.name: Kamuli A3 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Olivia is 43 years old and married with six children. She makes and sells snacks. She intends to use the extra business profits to pay schol fees for the children. Annet and Harriet sell raw foods. Robinah has a salon business and wants to use the loan to buy hair driers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women woulg like to increase their businesses.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She started the business practically from the scratch, but thanks to MicroInvest loans she improved her business situation. Now she rents a trade outlet in the flea market selling shoes and materials. She has a good assortment. Now she's applying for a loan to import new shoe models.

loans.use: Importing new shoes models

loans.name: Laura Manuelita

texts.es:
Laura belongs to the Santa Bárbara Community Bank group, located at #121 Psj. Mariano Cárdenas, in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 59 and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a salesperson. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the sales of furniture.

Now she has a furniture store which opens at 7 am. She works there with the help of her children until 9 at night, carrying out the duties of running the store.

With this loan of 3000 soles, which she will pay back in 5 months, she be able to purchase furniture, tables, beds, desks, pantries, varnish, laquer, etc.

Laura is very happy. Her business is growing and her sales are increasing. All of her strength and hard-work is for the investment in the education of her children, so she can proviD. them with a better future, thanks to her job.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Psj. Mariano Cárdenas No 121, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 59 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertirlo en la venta D. muebles. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una tienda D. venta D. muebles, para lo cual abre su negocio a las 7 am., y lo atienD. hasta 9 pm, junto con el apoyo D. sus hijos sacan adelante el negocio. Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. muebles, mesas, camas, escritorios, reposteros, triplays, barniz, laca, etc. Laura esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para invertir en la educación D. sus hijos y así poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro gracias a su trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture to sell

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mr. Phal P. is a 49-year-old fisherman who makes about $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Phin Thon, is a vegetable seller who makes about $3 per day. They live with their three children in Chykreng District, Siem Reap Province. One of their children is married, one is a construction worker, and another sells groceries. They are requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more grocery stock and purchase a motorcycle to transport vegetables to sell at the market. This loan will help to expand their business and increase family income. (Photo is P.'s wife)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and buy more grocery stock

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Señora Dolores belongs to the Communal Bank of Women with a Future, located at Jr. Apurimac 409, in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department. She is 62 years old and is the mother of 11 children. Her income did not serve to maintain her family. Thus, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest at the start in the purchase of a delivery bike.

Now one of her children works driving the bike, and it has generated good income. With future loans, she wants to buy another bike order to continue working with the family and to be by the side of her dearest ones.

With this loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in maintenance and buy a few things that the delivery bike needs. Dolores has worked from a very young age in order to improve her family's lives. She has educated her children and now they are helping their mother and are progressing forward together.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dolores pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac 409, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 11 hijos, su esposo es pescador, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Dolores con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la inicial para la compra de un motocarro. En la actualidad uno de sus hijos es el encargado de manejar su motocarro, que le ha generado buenos ingresos económicos, y con los prestamos siguientes quiere comprar otro motocarro, para seguir trabajando en familia y estar a lado de sus seres queridos. Con este préstamo de S/.2,400 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento y compra de algunos repuestos que necesitaba su motocarro. Dolores, desde muy joven siempre trabajo, para sacar su familia adelante, les dio educación a sus hijos, ahora ellos están ayudando a su madre y juntos están progresando.

loans.use: The loan will be used to maintain a delivery bike

loans.name: Antonia Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina is a young entrepreneur who wanted to continue with her studies, but upon observing her family’s financial situation, which was challenging, she decided to pursue a job that would not take too much time away from her and that would generate the income needed for her education. This is why she decided to sell clothing 3 years ago. She has managed to increase her client base little by little. Her profits allow her to not only pay for her studies, but also help with the household expenses.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase merchandise and offer her customers a wider selection of apparel. With your help, Alvina will keep making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alvina es una joven emprendedora, que deseaba seguir estudiando pero al ver la situación económica de su familia, la cual era muy dificil, ella decidió dedicarse a alguna actividad económica que no le quitara mucho tiempo y que le generara ingresos para poder seguir estudiando,fue asi que deicidio dedicarse a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, y logro así, poco a poco ir creando sus clientes, sus ganancias ahora le permiten no solo pagar sus estudios sino contribuir con el gasto de su familia.

Ella necesita de un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y tener mas variedad que ofrecerla a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Alvina seguira progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Marina

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” domiciliada en el Jr: Francisco de Orellana Nº 139 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 25 años, no tiene ni hijos ni esposo. Desde los 18 años es independiente, trabaja en sitios eventuales es por eso que no tiene estabilidad económica. Con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la compra y venta de productos medicinales y productos de belleza. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio en su propio domicilio María se levanta muy temprano para organizarse y aprovechar mejor el tiempo dado que también es promotora de ventas de pasajes, todo el día esta fuera visitando, ofreciendo sus productos regresando a su casa a descansar a las 10 pm. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses. Invertirá en la compra de 5 potes de productos medicinales, 10 frascos de té, 25 formularios y 30 carpetas para implementar para la venta de pasajes. La experiencia de la vida hace de María una joven muy comprometida y responsable. Se siente segura por el inmenso respaldo brindado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Maria belongs to the Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” located in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 25 years old and is neither married nor does she have children. Since she was 18 she has been independent and has worked in many jobs, leading to her economic instability. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the buying and selling of medicinal and beauty products. The business is currently in her own home. Maria gets up very early to organize herself and make best use of her time given that she is also working as a promoter to sell tickets and also selling her other products meaning that she does not return home until 10pm. With her most recent loan from Manuela Ramos of 1500 soles, which will be paid in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of 5 pots of medicinal products, 10 bottles of tea, 25 forms, and 30 folders to implement the sale of tickets. Maria’s life experiences make her a very committed and responsible person. She feels very confident for the immense support given by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal products. Purchase of forms and folders

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S., age 57, lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 1998, she and her husband, Bun Sophat, age 56, have been vendors selling a variety of vegetables to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$2 of profit per day. Before this business, the couple used to be farmers, but they stopped because there was no irrigation system in their village and farming depended a lot on the weather. According to the couple, “I cannot collect more output unless the weather condition is good.”  Due to difficulties such as bad weather, they have changed their work to selling vegetables instead. Together, the couple has two children and all of them have different work to support themselves. The oldest son is a taxi-driver and the daughter works as a housekeeper in Malaysia, making US$6 per day.

Mrs. Chan is seeking a loan of US$1,000 to build a new stand that is bigger to sell vegetables, as the old one was unreliable and too small. The money will also increase their inventory so they can meet their customers' demand for vegetables. (Mrs. Chan S. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To replace an unreliable stand and diversify the products to meet the customers' demand.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Расулов Джамшед житель района Хуросон. Возраст 21 год, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается бизнесом. Привозит из города Душанбе стройматериалы и продает их у себя на рынке. Решил получить кредит и использовать его для того , чтобы закупить замки , дверные ручки и другие принадлежности. Это поможет удовлетворить спрос населения , а так же получить прибыль. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Jamshed R. lives in Khuroson. He is 21 years old, married, and has one child. He works in business. He brings in building materials from the city of Dushanbe and sells them at the market. He has decided to take out a loan to buy locks, door handles, and other accessories. This will satisfy local demand and make a profit. He plans to pay off the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia O. R., a member of the community bank, Minka, lives in Ayacucho with her 3 daughters who are 10, 13, and 15 years old. With the help from her oldest daughter she runs a restaurant in Ayacucho which also has a photocopy machine, which is convenient for her customers. She does all the cooking and works every day of the week. She specializes in local dishes including puca picante, a dish that includes potatoes, pork and a special sauce. 

With her loan she will invest in her restaurant by purchasing refreshments, tables, trout and ingredients for puca picante. She has been saving to build a second floor onto her house and dreams of improving and building her business. Additionally, she would love to have her restaurant included on a guided tourist trail so foreigners can get a true taste of Ayacuchan dishes.

loans.use: Invest in her restaurant by purchasing refreshments, tables, trout and ingredients for puca picante.

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Choek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group in the Andoung Russey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province consists of 8 people who all plan to use their loan share for different purposes. Mrs. Pov C., 29 years old, is widowed and has two children, both of whom attend a local school. She is the president of the loan group and earns income breeding pigs. Her business is going well, and she would like to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Pov C. is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets for her business, thereby hopefully increasing her income. 
This is a village bank loan, mainly consisting of end-of-term (EoT) loans. Five members of the group have EoT loans, while the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product, because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets for breeding

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria nasceu em inhambane, tem 55 anos de idade não teve a oportunidade de ir a escola devido a falta de condicoes dos seus progenitores.é casada  e mae de 8 filhos com idades compriendida entre os 25 aos 45 anos de idade todos eles são casados. 

Maria sai de inhambane a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia                                                   com seu esposo em emisao de servico, este que era policia civil. Chegado a namaacha comeca a trabalhar em macuacua uma localidade do mesmo distrito, entao ela decide criar galinhas do mato  pois a zona era muito adequada para pratica dessa actividade e revendia-os na vila. com o fundo colectado e com ajuda do seu esposo compram um carro que os permitiu mais ainda expandir o seu negocio, para alem dos frangos passa tambem a vender carvao na cidade de maputo. Mas devido a guerra maria perde todos seus bens e muda se para a vila onde continua com a sua actividade  mais com muita dificuldade. Hoje cria galinhas cafriais em sua casa tem comprado no maximo 2x100 caixas de pintos a 14.000.00mt e revende cada a 85.00mt tem tido um lucro de 3.000.00mt mensalmente e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00mt porque tem que pagar dispesas dos seus netos que emcontram se a estudar.

Este e o segundo emprestimo de maria na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva.o primeiro de 8.000.00mt usou para comprar pintos, conseguiu pagar sem nenhuma dificuldade e pede este segundo de 10.000.00mt para reforcar o eu negocio. Esta cofiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo e pedir outro emprestimo para reabilitar a sua barraca
texts.en:
Maria was born in Inhambane. She's 55 years old and didn't have the opportunity to go to school because her parents could not afford it. She is married and the mother of eight children between 25 and 45 years old, all married. Maria left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the frontier with Swaziland, with her husband who was in the service of the civil police. Once in Namaacha, she started working in Macuacua, a place in the same district. She decided to raise guinea fowl, as this is an appropriate zone for this activity, and to sell them in town. With the funds she made, and with the help of her husband, they bought a car, which allowed them to expand their business even further. Besides chickens, they also began to sell charcoal in the city of Maputo. But because of the war, Maria lost all her goods and moved to town, where she continues her enterprise, but with a lot of difficulty. Today she raises chickens at home. She has bought at most 2 x 100 cases of chicks at 14000 meticais and resold each at 85 meticais. She has had a profit of 3000 meticais monthly and manages to save 1000 per month, because she has to pay the expenses of her grandchildren, who are in school. This is the second of Maria's loans with Hluvuku, and the first with Kiva. The first, of 8000 meticais, she used to buy chicks. She was able to repay it without a single difficulty and now is applying for this second one of 10000 meticais to strengthen her business. She's confident that she will repay ahead of time and request another loan to renovate her stall.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Chron

texts.en:
Mrs. Chron A. was born in 1984 and lives in Angkokie Village in Takeo Province. She has two children, who are eight months and three years old. She is also a farmer who cultivates rice on her plot of land for a living. 

She is pictured with her husband, Mr. Koem Nat, who sells knives.  Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more knives for him to re-sell in the local village.

loans.use: to buy more knives to re-sell

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun T., 39, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She is able to make about US$8 in revenue everyday by working as a weaver from her home. Her husband, Pich Sarenthorn, 37, is a policeman, earning US$5 a day. This couple have four school-aged children. Mrs. Bun T. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan Q. is a 27 year old man who owns his own store where he rents and sells DVDs.  He started his business in 1998 when his father retired and passed the business on to him. 

Elkhan is a very polite and friendly young man who is always ready to satisfy his clients needs, which is why his store is so popular and always full of customers. 

Elkhan is also a photographer and he would like to open, in the same store, a photography studio and combine both DVD selling and photo making in one store.  He needs $1200 to continue his efforts.

loans.use: Open a photography studio and increase the number of DVDs

loans.name: Tumen-Ulziy

texts.en:
Tumen-Ulziy D., 54, is married to a welder. They have one son, a university student. They live in the town of Baganuur, located 200 kilometers from the capital city of Mongolia, Ulaanbaatar.

Tumen-Ulziy has been working as a hairdresser in the White Mountain hair salon for the last 25 years. For the first 15 years she was an employee, but over the last 10 years, she has been renting a space at the salon and working for herself.

Because of her long experience, she has developed many repeat customers over the last five years who keep coming especially to see her. With this loan, she is planning to replenish her hair-cutting supplies. She will buy scissors, combs, a blow dryer, a curling iron, etc. Tumen-Ulziy's dream is to see her son become a successful person.

loans.use: To buy hair-cutting supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca vive en anticretico con su hija en la calle Poopo de la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un puesto de jugos de fruta en la zona de Sopocachi, con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia y puede cubrir sus necesidades primordiales. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más variedad de frutas y leche y poder mantener estable su negocio ya que la competencia le hizo bajar sus ventas, pero espera recuperarse en el menor tiempo posible.

El historial de la señora en Impro es muy bueno, además ya fue parte de Kiva durante el año 2008 y su historial de pagos fue muy bueno. Esto hace que pueda acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Francisca lives in Calle Poopo in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She has a fruit juice stand in the Sopocachi neighborhood. With this activity, she maintains her family and is able to pay for her basic needs. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital, to buy a larger variety of fruits and milk, and to stabilize her business because the competition has caused her sales to go down. She hopes to recover from this quickly.

She has a very good history with Impro. In addition, she had a previous loan with Kiva during 2008, and her repayment history was very good. This has allowed her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ramon Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of fruits and milk for her fruit jiuce business

loans.name: Emily Judith Akoth

texts.en:
Emily Judith Akoth O. is a 24-year-old mother of three children: Verna, Joy and Britton. Her husband works in Nairobi.

Emily is asking for 20,000 KSH that she will use to pay school fees for the 15 orphans she takes care of.

loans.use: To pay school fees for the 15 orphans she takes care of

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothing material for tailoring and also for sale

loans.name: Lomer

texts.en: Lomer H. is 37 years of age, presently residing at Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. He has seven children, all in school. His source of income is his variety store. His wife is helping him as a housewife, taking care of the house as well as the children. Lomer is determined to reach his goal, which is to let all his kids finish their studies. He knows that it seems so hard to fulfill but Lomer, being the head of the family, is doing his best to let his store bring in more income for his family. He's requesting a loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mahkamboy

texts.ru: Ахмедов Махкамбой парень 24 лет , который занимается вместе с матерью продажей сухофруктов, арахиса , миндаля, фисташек. Он привозит из оптового рынка, по оптовой цене. В основном торгует его мать , т.к. он часто ездит за товаром. Махкамбой  следующий кредит хочет использовать на расширение ассортимента товара. Он планирует привезти арахис высшего сорта, он выглядит крупнее и вкуснее обычного, и пользуется большим спросом.В день мониторинга он был в отъезде за товаром, поэтому на снимке его мать.
texts.en:
Mahkamboy A. is a 24-year-old guy who works with his mother (pictured) selling dried fruit, peanuts, almonds, and pistachios. He buys them at a wholesale market for wholesale prices. Basically, his mother does most of the selling since he is often going out to purchase their goods. Mahkamboy wants to use this loan to expand the variety of goods they offer. He plans on bringing in a premium peanut which is larger and tastier than regular peanuts and is in great demand.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for buying peanuts

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old. She lives in Barangay Binarzang of Quiino, Isabela. She is married to Remigio who works as a farmer. They are blessed with five children: two already graduated from college and three are still studying.  Because of her good service to her community and to God, she still remains as one of the councilors in their respective place. Julieta loves serving in her simple ways. 

Julieta is again requesting for a loan of PHP4,000 for the maintenance of her hog raising business. She will use the loan to purchase feed supply and to buy one piglet. Hog raising has become of great help to her family. Julieta is hoping that the business will work longer through patience and assistance of Kiva lenders. Julieta also dreams to become successful in life for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and a piglet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivation of maize

loans.name: Namasa Dyphine

texts.en:
Namasa is the married mother of four children ages 7, 9, 13, and 17. She runs a mobile salon with which she goes to her customers to offer her services. She also has a small shop where they can come to her.

Some of the challenges that Namasa faces in her business are paying the expensive transportation costs and having enough equipment to serve all the clients that come to her. She would like to use her loan to buy more equipment for her salon, including a blow dryer and an extra sit-down hair dryer.

Namasa also raises poultry on the side, and would like to buy some more chickens. Eventually, she would like to be a wholesaler of beauty products and also grow her poultry business. Mostly, she wants to save enough money to pay for her children’s school fees. Her eldest son is entering high school soon, and that implies increased costs for her. She says that her children’s education is the most important thing to her.

loans.use: To buy a blow-dryer and a hairdryer for her salon

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра Турапова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 42 года. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Гулчехра живет с 2 детьми. Она более 10 лет занимается бизнесом, т.е. торговлей на рынке. В основном торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента и увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Gulchehra T. lives in the Rumy region. She is 42 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She lives with her two children. She has been doing business for more than ten years selling on the market. She sells mostly clothing. She is asking for a loan to buy a new assortment and increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new assortment

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 25-year-old businessman who sells second-hand shoes in the Mukuru slums. He has been in this business for the past nine years.

Joseph is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 to add to his stock of shoes. A father of one, Joseph hopes to educate his son and become a shoe supplier one day. He describes himself as hardworking and social.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
N. Joyce is a creative businesswoman, fifty-two years old who has two children. She deals in agricultural produce, especially tomatoes and has been doing this business for six years.

Joyce is utilizing the loan to add capital to her business for purchasing agricultural produce such as tomatoes. She collects tomatoes from the village and supplies to the markets in the town. She has obtained a plot of land on her own and built a house on it with her business profits.

Joyce’s aim is to expand the business to a large extent and to built some rental houses for extra daily income.

loans.use: To add capital to her business and purchase produce such as tomatoes

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es una alegre mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo Fernando de 40 y su hijo Daniel de 13. Desde hace algunos años ha venido trabajando independientemente para poder generarse ingresos extras al sueldo de su esposo. Es así que vende artículos por temporada, como ropa, comida, postres, etc., actualmente se encuentra ofreciendo turrones, ya que en el mes de octubre se acostumbra realizar la procesión de la imagen de “El Señor de los Milagros”, evento religioso muy típico peruano y este postre es tradicional en esta fecha, por lo que también es muy rentable. Es por ello que Edith quiere aumentar su mercadería para poder ofrecerla a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos de la zona en la que vive, la cual por ser alejada y de difícil acceso es muy propicia para el negocio, pues todos prefieren comprar algo que tienen cerca a viajar una hora o más para adquirir estos productos.
Es el quinto préstamo de Edith con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde considera que el trabajo con su grupo es muy bueno, pues todas son muy buenas amigas y muy responsables también. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de turrones para comercializarlos en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Edith is a happy 33 year-old woman who lives with her 40 year-old husband, Fernando, and her 13 year-old son, Daniel. She has worked independently the past few years to generate extra income to support her husband's salary. She sells different items each season, such as clothes, food, cake, etc. Currently, she is selling nougat candies since it is a traditional sweet for the procession of "The Man of Miracles," a typical Peruvian religious event that takes place every October, and is very profitable. Edith wants to increase her merchandise so she can offer it to family members, friends, and neighbors in her area. Because the area where they live is remote and hard to get to it is favorable to her business, since otherwise her customers would have to travel an hour or more to buy similar products. This is Edith's fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She thinks their work is very good since all the members are both good friends and responsible. She will use the loan to buy a larger amount of nougat candy to sell this season.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying candy to sell

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina S. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Fasitoo Uta. She is married and has five school-aged children. Sina owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 350 WST a month. In 2008, Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Sina is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. Sina is not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 29th September 2009. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D., 36 ans, mariée,05 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" depuis un an et demi. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer sa cantine en marchandises, elle vend du tissu. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Fatou D. 36 years old, she is married and has 5 children in her care. She has been a member of the "Montagne Sud" Community Bank for the past year and a half. With this loan she plants to purchase merchandise to restock her store; she sells fabrics. The revenues will help her improve the living conditions of her family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yenis Gezabel

texts.es:
la sra. Yenis Gezabel L. V. tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y se dedica a la venta de refrescos de cola, tiene poco tiempo de haber inicado con su negocio, Yenis no tiene mucho capital para comprar los refrescos y esta comprando poco producto, el carro que reparte los refrescos solo pasa una vez a la semana ya que vive en un lugar retirado de la ciudad, por eso es que necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos y asi tener producto siempre ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas. Yenis L. vive en la aldea Tapones y este lugar es muy caliente.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz y que de ahora en adelante todo le va a salir bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yenis Gezabel L. V. is 39 years old, married, and she sells cola soft drinks for a living. She started her business a short time ago. Yenis does not have much capital to buy the pops and she is buying small amounts. The pop distributing vehicle only comes by once a week as she lives far from the city and therefore she needs the loan to buy more soft drinks and always carry stock as her customers are very demanding. Yenis Laines lives in the village Tapones, a place with a very hot climate. She comments to us that she is very happy and that from now things are going to go well.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks.

loans.name: Jacinta Enma

texts.es:
Nuestra socia JACINTA es una madre D. familia, tiene 69 años D. edad, es viuda, tiene siete hijos. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” D. la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio D. venta D. comestibles. Ella tiene una stand en el mercado “Vino Canchon” del distrito D. San Jerónimo. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JACINTA, 69, is a widow and mother of 7 children. They all live in the imperial city of Cusco and she is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank. She alternates her household chores with a small grocery sales business. She has a stand in the San Jerónimo district's "Vino Canchon" market. She has been in this line of work for several years and does well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who succeeds in getting her family ahead in life. She needs funding to increase her working capital buying food items like rice, sugar, pasta and vegetables. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food stock items.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde niña ha aprendido todo lo necesario para dedicarse al cultivo de los diversos productos oriundos de su zona; tales como la papa, el maíz, la oca, las habas, entre otros. En la época de siembra sus actividades son más intensas, por lo que cada miembro de su familia participa en la preparación de la tierra, y regresan juntos para descansar en casa; y continuar al día siguiente. 
Esto mantiene contenta a Florencia, ver que todos trabajan unidos y por eso planifica su futuro, mejorando en cada año sus cosechas.

Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy comprometida en su grupo y seguirá trabajando por el bienestar de todos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono e insecticida para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Florencia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. Since she was a girl, she learned all about the cultivation of various crops native to her area, such as potato, corn, oca, broad beans, and others. During the planting season, she and her family work hard; everyone works in the field and returns home together to rest, day after day. Florencia is content because everyone works together; she plans to improve the harvest each year. This is the third time she is requesting a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very committed to her group and continues to work for the good of everyone. This loan will be invested in sacks of fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim O., 54, is married and her husband died several years ago. She now has a single daughter who helps her with the making of traditional pans and cookers to sale. She learned from her grandparents, who were died many years ago, the skill of making cookware. Kim buys clay in bulk for making her pans and cookers and stores it in her home. She makes and saves up many sets of products before selling to buyers. Kim O. plans to build a new house but the constructiO. process has not started due to the lack of funds to buy constructiO. material. In order to start building a new house, Kim O. has requested a loan to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
B. Gulsara is 49 years old. She and her husband have raised 5 children. For 15 years already, Gulsara has been working in the local market of the city. She sells rice, green grams, buckwheat, and peas. These legumes are very popular in Tajikistan. They can be cooked in soups and as cereals; all are very nourishing, healthy, and tasty.

The business is very stable and generates the main income for the family as Gulsara's husband is currently unemployed. Today she requests 700 US Dollars as a loan to be used to increase her inventory by purchasing rice, green grams, buckwheat, and peas to sell. Gulsara thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing green grams, buckwheat, and peas for her inventory

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en:
Rolan O. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old. Rolan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rolan owns & operates a  "trisikad" transportation service to local community members. A trisikad is a bicycle connected to a passenger coach that is used to transport passengers within the village. Rolan has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rolan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Rolan's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria De Jesús tiene la edad de 33 años. Esta no es la primera experiencia con los financiamientos pues ha logrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. La actividad económica de ella es la venta de mercadería en general,  ya que tiene mucha experiencia con sus diferentes clientes. Hace más de 11 años que posee este negocio ella es una muy buena hija pues ayuda a su Mama, ya que tiene un negocio, además imparte clases en algunos centros de estudios. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de mochilas, bolsos, cosméticos y ropa en general. Su mayor sueño seguir siempre adelante.
texts.en:
Maria De Jesús is 33 years old. This is not her first experience working with loans since she completed the payments from her previous loans in a timely fashion. Maria sells general merchandise and has plenty of experience working with different customers. Her business has been in operation for more than 11 years. Maria demonstrates that she is a good daughter by helping out her mother, who also owns a business and teaches school. Over time she has been able to increase her inventory using what little earnings her business was able to generate.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase backpacks, handbags, cosmetics, and clothing. Her greatest wish is to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase backpacks, handbags, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Modou Gadiaga

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou Gadiaga N. est un homme marié et père de 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 25 ans et le plus petit 4 mois.  Agé de 45 ans, Monsieur Modou Gadaiga  N.  est en charge de sa famille et de ses demi-sœurs.  Son activité principale est le commerce qu’il a embrassé depuis 10 ans.
Cependant il a une activité secondaire le maraîchage (culture de légumes) une activité très développée à  Notto  de par sa position dans la zone des Niayes au Sénégal. Une zone constituée d’un milieu assez original caractérisé par des dunes et des dépressions souvent inondées par l’affleurement de la nappe phréatique et par un climat assez favorable. Ce milieu n’a pas manqué d’attirer la population et de donner également à la région toute sa vocation agronomique.
  Monsieur N. a pratiqué le maraîchage depuis 20 ans sous l’influence de son père qui s’y activait.  En fait Monsieur N. aidait son père dès  son jeune âge aux travaux de maraîchage jusqu’au moment  où il prit l’initiative de développer sa propre activité le commerce.  Cette activité, dit-il,  lui a permis de tisser des relations avec le monde extérieur.
 C’est ainsi en 2009 lorsqu’U-IMCEC a ouvert une mutuelle pour mieux aider les producteurs de cette zone que Monsieur N. est devenu membre et sollicite pour la première fois un prêt de 50 000 FCFA. Il veut acheter avec le crédit des sacs de légumes (pomme de terre….) qu’il va revendre sur le marché. Avec ce crédit  il va constater son revenu augmenté.
texts.en:
Monsieur Modou Gadiaga N. est un homme marié et père de 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 25 ans et le plus petit 4 mois. Agé de 45 ans, Monsieur Modou Gadaiga N. est en charge de sa famille et de ses demi-sœurs. Son activité principale est le commerce qu’il a embrassé depuis 10 ans. Cependant il a une activité secondaire le maraîchage (culture de légumes) une activité très développée à Notto de par sa position dans la zone des Niayes au Sénégal. Une zone constituée d’un milieu assez original caractérisé par des dunes et des dépressions souvent inondées par l’affleurement de la nappe phréatique et par un climat assez favorable. Ce milieu n’a pas manqué d’attirer la population et de donner également à la région toute sa vocation agronomique. Monsieur N. a pratiqué le maraîchage depuis 20 ans sous l’influence de son père qui s’y activait. En fait Monsieur N. aidait son père dès son jeune âge aux travaux de maraîchage jusqu’au moment où il prit l’initiative de développer sa propre activité le commerce. Cette activité, dit-il, lui a permis de tisser des relations avec le monde extérieur. C’est ainsi en 2009 lorsqu’U-IMCEC a ouvert une mutuelle pour mieux aider les producteurs de cette zone que Monsieur N. est devenu membre et sollicite pour la première fois un prêt de 50 000 FCFA. Il veut acheter avec le crédit des sacs de légumes (pomme de terre….) qu’il va revendre sur le marché. Avec ce crédit il va constater son revenu augmenté.

Translated from French by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: s'approvisionner en légumes destinés à la vente

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua N. is a happily married woman with five dependents. She has no formal educational background. She sells dough-nuts at Jukwa market, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a driver. Ekua uses her income to help her husband in taking care of the needs of her children and other needs that may arise. Ekua will use the loan she will be getting to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to make dough-nuts in larger quantities, to be able to meet the demands of her customers. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: Ekua will use the loan she will be getting to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to make dough-nuts in larger quantity.

loans.name: Blessed Mary Group

texts.en:
Cecelia K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Blessed Mary. She is 44 years old, married and has 8 children who range in age from 8 to 26 years. She also cares for two nephews and a niece. She could not continue her education through 11th grade due to poverty.
For 6 years Cecelia has been selling used clothes at the Vai Town market close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia. 
She started selling with 7,000 Liberia dollars she received from her brother, as working capital.
Cecelia sells good looking used clothing to customers and encourages them to continue buying from her.
Cecelia plans to use her 7,500 Liberian dollar portion of this 37,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy used bed spreads and used rugs. Her dream is to become an international business woman, build more houses and to educate her children to the highest level. 


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Cecelia is the one holding the sign. And Evelyn is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy used bed spreads and used rugs.

loans.name: Rocio Melisa

texts.es:
Rocio es socia del Banco Comunal Belen.
Rocio es soltera y tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres, Rocio tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones en su casa, además trabaja en un taller de confecciones.
Rocio necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago para comprar una maquina.
Rocio sueña con tener un taller grande con todas las maquinas y constituir una empresa de confección de polos.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of Belen Community Bank.   Rocio is single, 23 years old and lives with her parents. Rocio has a small sewing shop in her home and also works at a sewing workshop.   Rocio needs a loan of 750 soles to be invested as part of a payment to buy a sewing machine.   Rocio dreams of having a large workshop, with all the equipment, and building a clothing company.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: Née le 12 Juin 1952 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Léonie vit depuis environs quarante ans au quartier Vodjè à Cotonou. Léonie est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés, mais qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Léonie vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Léonie mène comme activité, depuis vingt ans, la vente de jus de bissaps, de yahourt, de jus de citron, etc. à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Léonie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Léonie voudrait élever davantage le niveau de son activité et faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on June 12, 1952 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, A. Léonie has been living in the Vodjè neighborhood in Cotonou for about 40 years. Léonie is a widow with three children, all of them having attended school, who are no longer her responsibility. She lives alone and supports herself. In order to do so, Léonie has been selling hibiscus-flower juice, yogurt, lemon juice, etc. out of her home and on foot in the neighborhoods. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Bénin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé, who has already received three loans which have all been correctly reimbursed. Léonie would like to further expand her business so as to cope with the ever-increasing demand of her clientele. This is the reason she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of milk, sugar, hibiscus flowers, etc. for the production of fruit juice and yogurt

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. prepares tea and fried eggs for sale in the mornings and evenings at Abura. She sets up her table in the morning around 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. and comes back in the evening around 6 p.m. and closes around 10 p.m.

Esi has received senior high education. She is a single parent and has two children. She responsibly takes care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more bread, eggs and provisions to prepare and sell. She hopes to use the new revenues from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more bread, eggs and provisions to prepare and sell

loans.name: Mujeres Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
LA SRTA. JHEYNI SOFIA, TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA Y HACE 5 MESES FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES SIN FRONTERAS", FORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE BELAUNDE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS, SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON RECIENTEMENTE COMO SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE UN AÑO SE DEDICA A LA ATENCIÓN DE SU BODEGA DE NOMBRE "BODEGA P.", QUE ESTÁ INSTALADO EN UN ESPACIO DE LA CASA DE UN FAMILIAR. INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO COLOCANDO UNA MESITA EN LA PUERTA DE LA CASA DONDE FUNCIONA SU BODEGA, DONDE COLOCABA UN POCO DE GOLOSINAS. HOY EN DÍA ES UNA BODEGA SURTIDA, Y CON SU TRABAJO HA IDO AMPLIANDO MAS EL NEGOCIO HA PODIDO CONTRATAR PERSONAL DE APOYO Y SOBRETOD APOYAR A SU ABUELITO.
UNA DE SUS METAS ES TENER UN MINIMARKET, PARA LO CUAL SE ESFUERZA Y TRABAJA MUCHO.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE UN TELEVISOR PARA SU BODEGA, PARA QUE SUS CLIENTES PUEDAN PASAR UN BUEN RATO EN LA BODEGA MIENTRAS CONSUME LOS PRODUCTOS OFRECIDOS POR JHEYNI.
texts.en:
Jheyni Sofia is 27 years old. She is single and has been a member of the group "Mujeres Sin Fronteras" for 5 months. The group is made up of 9 members who live in the Belaunde area of the Comas district. The other members recently elected her secretary of the group's board of directors. A year ago she began working in her store called "BODEGA P.", which is set up in a space in the house of a relative. She started her business with a table in the door of the house where her store is. She sold candies from it. Today it is a store with a variety of products and with her work she has expanded the business and been able to hire support staff and above all support her grandfather. One of her goals is to have a minimart, and for that she is working very hard. The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying a television for her store, so that her clients can spend awhile in the store while the consume the products offered by Jheyni.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a television for her store

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Don Hermes tiene 50 años, está casado y tiene 5 hijos.
 Se dedica al tambo (venta de leche) y venta de leña para chiperia, posee una clientela formada a quienes en forma diaria les hace entrega la leche de acuerdo a la necesidad de cada cliente, por otro lado clientes que se dedican a la chapería a quienes les provee leña para el horneado de sus chipas.
 Esta actividad es la fuente con el cual crio a sus hijos, con que cubre los gastos básicos de la familia y también en algunos casos cubre los gastos del colegio de sus hijos que aún están en etapa de colegio.
Solicita el  préstamo para la compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar la cantidad de leche que ofrece.
texts.en:
Don Hermes is 50 years old, married, and has five children. He operates a dairy and also sells firewood to bakeries. Hermes has an established clientele to whom he delivers milk on a daily basis according to the needs of each customer. There are other customers for whom he provides firewood in order to power their ovens for making “chipas” (cheese bread).

This business is the means by which he is able to support his children and cover basic family expenses. It also helps him to cover the educational expenses of his children who are still in high school. He is requesting a loan to buy another dairy cow so that he can increase the quantity of milk that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
Ismoil supports his family with a small business selling men’s and women’s clothing. He operates from a little space at the central market in Penjikent, Tajikistan, where he maintains a nice variety of clothing to choose from. Ismoil has been in business for 6 years. With good quality products and affordable prices, he has developed a solid customer base, and his business continues to grow. Ismoil has requested a loan to increase his working capital and allow him to purchase new inventory. This loan will help Ismoil maximize his profits and provide for his family.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for selling

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma A. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 40 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Wilma owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals. In 2007, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Thank God Group

texts.en:
Yarie S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Thank God. Yarie is 35 years old, married and has three children who are between two and nine years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For three years, she has been selling cold water and charcoal on Peace Island outside Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of cold water and charcoal to sell. 

She describes herself as a determined woman. Her goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cold water and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando M. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 33 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services to the community. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Armando has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Armando joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. Armando is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his transportation vehicle. This loan will be his third from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair transportation vehicle

loans.name: Bokk Jom 2 Group

texts.fr: Bokk jomm 2 est  un groupe de 5 femmes issues de la même localité de  Bambilor. Il est dirigé par madame Gnagna  S.. Madame Gnagna S. est la dame qui est vêtue  en bleu sur la photo de groupe. C’est dans le but de soutenir leurs maris quelles ont optées pour l’activité de commerce. Par  conséquent elles évoluent depuis plus de 10 ans dans l’achat et la vente de marchandises diverses telles que légumes, vêtements etc.  Elles sont membres de la caisse depuis juillet 2010.Le groupe  sollicite un prêt de 500 000 f  qui sera  destiné  a  l’achat de produits pour  renforcer leur  stock. L’accroissement  des bénéfices que leur génère leur activité les aide à satisfaire leur quelques besoins personnels et à participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne dans leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
Bokk Jom 2 is a group of 5 women from the town of Bambilor. The group is headed buy Gnagna S., the woman dressed in blue in the photo. They all started running businesses in order to support their husbands. That’s why, for over 10 years, they have sold various items, like vegetables, clothes, etc. They have been members of the communal bank since July 2010. The group is requesting a 500,000 XOF loan to buy products to build up their stock. The profits generated by their businesses help them to cover some personal expenses and to participate in managing day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: Nguyễn Thị H.'s main source of income comes from providing general clothing services in her community. She is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two small children. Nguyễn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, Nguyễn joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Nguyễn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Nguyễn is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. Nguyễn plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. No. 20213030037. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== Nguyễn Thị H. (20213030037) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ. Để kiếm sống, Nguyễn Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nguyễn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyễn kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, Nguyễn đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nguyễn đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Nguyễn dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old and married. She has six children, the younger of whom still go to school. To make a living, Tessie raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Tessie works hard to sustain her children's education.

Tessie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: David Amuyunzu

texts.en:
David Amuyunzu N. is 38 years old, married to Jemima Mungafu who is a business lady and is also a source of additional income for the family. 

They have three school-going children ages eight, six, and two.  He operates a retail shop in Eldoret Town, and has been in this business for five years, earning a monthly profit of Ksh.15,000.

David learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area.  He is applying for a third loan from KADET LTD  for Kshs 65,000, which he plans to use to buy six boxes of cooking oil, five bags of sugar, and any other stock that needed to be added.  He plans to expand his shop with the anticipated profits.  

In the future, David wishes to have a lorry to use for transportation. His deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, and other stock for resale.

loans.name: Deolanda

texts.es:
Deolanda es una madre D. familia D. 63 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en el caserío Boca Chica del distrito agrícola D. Olmos, una zona ubicada en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace cinco años a la comercialización y venta D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. uso diario D. buena calidad y con una buena atención. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija que siempre acuD. a su negocio a consumir los productos que ofrece.

Deolanda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles con los que piensa lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Deolanda is a 63 year old mother who lives with her family in the Boca Chica settlement in the agricultural district of Olmos. This zone is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past five years she has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a market located in her home. There she offers her clients diverse high-quality products for daily use and excellent attention. Because she has been working at this for so long, she currently counts on a established clientele that always come to her business to buy the products she sells.
