Deolanda would like to expand her business by buying more products to offer to her clientele. That is why she has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternative, with which she hopes to achieve her goal. She is very dedicated to her family and has a strong desire to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy basic products and groceries in order to expand the market she runs from her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kikarara Minyeto Twimukye Bee Keepers Group

texts.en: T. Charles is 40 and married with eight children. Six of them are still in school and the rest are already working. He is a farmer in Nyakatemba A call in Rukungiri, and he is the leader of Kikara Minyeto group. He has been in the farming business for more than 10 years, growing food crops for sale. Working closely with his wife, he is able to make an average of 40,000 UGX profit a week. Charles also has a retail shop that helps to bring in more income. He is a good man and very hard working, and he needs a loan to be able to improve on his farming activities buying manure for his plantations. He hopes to be able to build a good house for his family.

loans.use: To buy manure to improve plantation productivity

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married with eight children who are between the ages of eight and 33. Two of her children are currently attending school. For the past 32 years, Josephine has been practicing mixed farming and she employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, and she produces maize, millet, milk, tea and nappier grass which she sells locally. Farming is her main source of income.

Josephine is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Josephine’s primary business challenges have been poor weather conditions, pests and diseases, and fluctuation in the market prices of her farm products. In the future, Josephine plans to expand her farm and purchase a posho mill to grind flour to supplement her income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright, 31 years old, is a hard-working married man with two children. The family lives in their own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Bright has been selling firewood for four years now, and with this business he has been able to provide the basics for his family. Bright is requesting a loan to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Estrellas Sc Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ESTRELLAS SC, porque quieren llegar a ser personas exitosas. Está ubicado en Puebla en Mexico. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes, Marisela A. M. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 35 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria, es fabricante y tiene 3 hijos; 2 mujeres y 1 varon. Ella se dedica a la elaboracion de block, que inició hace 9 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cemento y cacahuatillo. Sus clientes se sienten muy a gusto con la puntualidad para entregar los pedidos además de la calidad. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con mucho entusiasmo y muy feliz por poder solicitar un crédito para poder terminar el dormitorio para sus hijos y tener un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Estrellas SC” (Stars SC) because the members want to become successful individuals. The group is located in Puebla, Mexico, and consists of nine members.

Marisela A.M. is the president of the group. She is 35 years old, has a third grade education, and earns her living by making construction materials. Marisela has three children, two daughters and a son. She has a business making blocks that she started nine years ago. Marisela is requesting a loan to buy cement and “cachuatillo” (red volcanic rock). Her customers are satisfied with the punctuality with which she delivers her orders as well as the quality of her products. Upon requesting her loan, Marisela felt enthusiastic and happy to be accessing these funds because she would be able to finish the bedroom for her children and build up a good inheritance for them.

loans.use: Purchase cement & volcanic rocks for making construction blocks

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en:
For 10 years, Muniratu M. has been running a provision store in Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. 
Married with one child, her income from this business helps pay for their child’s education and also contributes to some of the household expenses. Her goal is to save up enough to buy a piece of land, and she intends to do this by growing her business. 
The loan will allow her to buy more varieties of products to sell in her provision store, which will boost her sales and increase her customers.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of products to sell in her provisions store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children.  She sells vegetables and fruits to earn a living.  She has seen a lot of improvement in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because she previously used a loan from Faulu Kenya to boost her business.  She is looking forward to stabilizing her business, and she has requested another loan of 20,000 kes to buy potatoes and onions.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and onions

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with two children. One attends school while the other is still young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

Binti has operated a green grocery business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.

In addition she also operates a café business that is her other source of livelihood. Binti faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a cereal shop in the future. 

Binti decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business in the future. With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil and purchase building stones and cement to renovate her stall.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil and to purchase building stones and cement to renovate her stall

loans.name: Agnes Katunge

texts.en:
Agnes is a widowed 43 year-old lady. She sells food to the locals of Katingani, in Emali town.  She has been doing this for two years. 

Agnes has applied for a business loan so that she can expand her business by adding more stock to her food stall. 

She is hopeful that from the profits of her trade, she will be able to give her children a better education. She believes that if her business grows, she will be able to be economically self-reliant .

loans.use: to add more food items to her stall

loans.name: Celiz Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra Celiz tiene la actividad económica de pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio pues ella no tenía un medio de ingreso para sustentar a su familia. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable, siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios, pues siempre está esforzándose para mejorar su calidad de vida.   Este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita por lo que es así que su negocio ha podido mejorar así podrá comprar golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, detergentes, sopas y granos básicos. Ella desea ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Alexandra Celiz has a small grocery store. She has been doing this for nine years; before that, she didn't have a way to earn income to support her family. She has always been a very responsible woman, and has always worried about giving her family the necessary income. She is always working hard to improve their quality of life. This is not the first loan that she has asked for, and through this financing she has been able to improve her business. She will be able to buy snacks, natural sodas, juices, detergent, soups and basic grains. She wants to increase the size of her business to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy snacks, natural sodas, juices, detergent, soups and basic grains

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Erasmo, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, se dedica a  la siembra de granos básicos maíz, frijol y maicillo, él tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un nieto de 16 años de edad, Don Erasmo siembra tres manzanas de terreno, todos los años prepara la tierra para la época de invierno.
Él invertirá en fertilizantes, semilla y equipo de sistema de riego, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra el gasto y le permita realizar el trabajo, esta inversión le ayudara para aumentar la producción.
Su aspiración es instalar en su propiedad, un sistema de riego para tener una mejor condición en su producción y en un futuro trabajar con dinero propio, ser independiente.
texts.en:
Erasmo lives in Osicala, in Morazán department.  He grows basic grains, corn, beans and sorghum.  He is 59 years old and lives with his wife and a 16 year-old grandson.  Erasmo sows three 'manzanas' of land (one manzana = 1.68 acres).  Every year he prepares his land for the winter season.

Erasmo will invest in fertilizers, seeds and irrigation equipment.  He is requesting a loan that will cover this expense and allow him to carry out his work.  This investment will help him to increase his production.

Erasmo's dream is to set up an irrigation system on his property so that he has better conditions for his production.  In the future, he would like to work with his own money and be independent.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizers, seeds and irrigation equipment

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 25 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area.  She is single and has two children, only one of them attends school.

Naomi has been involved in the sales of frozen chickens for the past five years.  She’s requesting a loan to purchase some cartons of chickens and used clothing.  She plans to work hard and earn more money and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and used clothing to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with 4 girls, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past 7 years, Mercy has been operating a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. In addition, she also operates a boutique and a cosmetics shop as another source of income.  Mercy faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a business premise in the future. 

With this loan for Kshs 60,000, Mercy wants to purchase bundles of ladies clothes, fabrics and cosmetics. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy ladies clothes, fabrics and cosmetics

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor José Alejandro es una persona trabajador y emprendedor quien es contador público de una empresa desde hace 10 años. Él es casado, tiene cuatro hijos por los cuales vela y su mayor sueño es que sean profesionales.
El crédito de José es personal el cual utilizara para gastos de estudio de sus hijos y reparaciones del hogar en especial en el techo que tiene muchas goteras.
texts.en:
José Alejandro is a hard working, enterprising person.  He has been a Public Accountant in a firm for 10 years.  He’s married and has four children that he watches over and his greatest wish is that they become professionals.

José’s loan is personal.  He will use it to pay for his children’s educational expenses and to do some home repairs, especially the roof which has a lot of leaks.

loans.use: to pay his children's educational expenses and to repair his house's roof.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch is a 29-year-old village man who has had a job as a fisherman since he was single. He fishes on the lakes and rivers next to his community. He started this business ten years ago and is earning approximately  $3 a day. His wife is a fish seller. This humble couple has two young children who are not yet enroll in school.   

For this upcoming fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but the family is lacking tools to fish with. Therefore, Uch is applying for a loan to purchase a new boat with a machine to help him catch more fish.

loans.use: buy a new boat

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad is 45 years old. He is married with two children. He raises and sells cattle at the market. This is a very profitable business, especially during the summer season, the season of weddings and other celebrations. He has been in this business since 2004.  He usually sells dairy products such as milk and yoghurt to the local people and cattle in the livestock bazaar. His monthly profit is about 400 USD. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cows and feed for them. This is especially important to his family, because this business is their only financial source. Farkhad applied for a loan of 1,700 AZN to purchase more cattle and cows.

loans.use: to purchase four cattle, two pregnant cows and one milk cow

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora  Fátima, es habitante del municipio de Masaya, junto a su esposo e hijos, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace varios años se dedica a trabajos campos, especialmente al cultivo de yuca, la mayor afectación  que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder realizar la inversión y sobre todo el mantenimiento que requiere, el préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de madera de yuca, arado, fertilizantes, etc. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de fonda Kiva ya que sin estos programas no fuese posible la inversión ya que estos fondos se obtienen muchos beneficios por sus intereses bajos.
texts.en:
Fátima lives in the town of Masaya together with her husband and children.  Her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions.  Fátima has been farming for several years.  In particular, she grows cassava.  The biggest problem that she faces is that she doesn't have enough capital to be able to invest in her business and provide her crops with the care they need.

Fátima will invest this loan in buying tree cassava, a plow, fertilizers, etc.  She is grateful for the support that Afodenic are providing through their Kiva fund as, without these programs, it wouldn't be possible for her to make this investment as these funds provide a lot of benefits as a result of their low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama owns the grocery store we see here. She is married to a farmer and the mother of seven children. The items she sells in her store include soap, spaghetti, cooking oil and milk. Ama started her business three years ago, and she and her husband combine their incomes to support their family.  She is applying for this loan to expand her business and buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers..

loans.name: Ana Eugenia

texts.es: La señora  Ana es cliente antiguo desde el año 2009, esta en su  quinta secuencia de su crédito individual, la cliente vive en la zona el tejar, la Sra.  Ana  se dedica  ala venta de artefactos y  víveres  que da a crédito, tiene  aproximadamente 50 clientes en la mayoría son choferes de varios sindicatos de la ciudad de la Paz. El crédito  invertirá en la compra de canastones para el fin de año. La Sra. Ana es casada y tiene dos hijos  que ella sola se encarga de su educación y su esposo Jorge es costurero que se encuentra en Argentina y  llega a Bolivia  dos veces al año, envía dinero a su familia, pero lo que la Sra. Ana desea es tener de vuelta a su familia.
texts.en: Ana has been a client since 2009 and this is her fifth personal loan cycle.  She lives in el Tejar region and sells appliances and food supplies on credit.  She has about 50 customers: the majority are drivers from different unions in La Paz.  She will use the loan to buy baskets for New Year’s.  Ana is married and has two children and she is in charge of their education.  Her husband, Jorge, is a dressmaker and is in Argentina.  He comes back to Bolivia twice a year and sends money to his family, but Ana wants him to return to be with his family.

loans.use: to buy baskets

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 35 years old and married with two children between the ages of three months and seven years. For the past four years, he has operated a shop where he sells items such as soap and unga (flour). Amos describes himself as a go-getter who never gives up. His biggest business challenge is competition.

Amos is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy more merchandise and expand his business. This will be his third loan with SMEP. In the future, Amos hopes that he will have a wholesale distribution business.

loans.use: to buy store merchandise

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor is 47 years old and lives with her children in a ger, Mongolian yurt in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She is widowed and a single mother. Her one child is a college student, another one works at Ulaanbaatar city and the other one is a student at the local job training center. Her children also work during the summer time and help with the business.

Tserendolgor started her business in 2002 by selling meat at the local market. She has 9 years of meat-selling experience. She also has many regular suppliers and consumers. Now the demand for meat is increasing due to the rising prices and season. She took two previous loans from XacBank and used the loans to successfully expand her business. She plans to develop her business in the future. Tserendolgor is a diligent and hardworking woman who says "I want to create and build a good life for me and for my children. This is my goal." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat from the countryside and to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase more meat from the countryside

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-five-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the textile business for ten years. He got the initial capital from his previous employment, started a retail shop, and later transformed it into a textiles shop. His hardship comes from debtors who take long to pay. His vision is to grow into a large-scale textiles shop and to have a poverty-free educated family. Joseph needs the loan facility to buy textiles for sale.

loans.use: to buy textiles for sale

loans.name: Miguel Ernesto

texts.es:
Miguel, necesita un préstamo para comprar herbicidas para las plagas, semilla y abono para que sus cosechas sean abundantes y estén libres de plagas, este es el oficio que diariamente realiza Miguel y del cual sostiene el hogar.
El prestamo anterior le ayudo muchisimo para realizar la siembra anterior, actualmente prepara nuevamente la tierra para iniciar su nuevo cultivo.
texts.en: Miguel needs a loan to buy herbicides for the pests, seeds and manure so that his harvests will be abundant and free of pests.  This is Miguel’s daily work to support his home.  His prior loan helped him quite a bit to carry out the previous planting and he’s currently preparing the soil to start his next crops.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide and seeds.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Rosario has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 21,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rosario has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Grace Wanja

texts.en: Grace is married Kenyan lady. She is married to a businessman and they have a 3-year-old son whom they hope to give good education to the university level. She runs a salon located at a strategic location known as Maasai Lodge area in Ongata Rongai. She has been in this business for 5 years and has hired two employees. The business is profitable and the major challenge she has is high cost of electricity. She will use the loan of KES 50,000 to buy salon equipment to grow her business. Her goal is to have the best salon at the Masaai lodge area in the future. Grace is patient and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y deseosa de progresar. Esta separada desde hace 10 años, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 31 y 15 años de edad , y sus dos nietos a los que quiere mucho y por ello esta contenta de tenerlos cerca. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Angélica es la venta de comida, para lo cual cuenta con un restaurante que abrió en su propia casa, que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación lo monto hace 5 años. Y esto fue gracias al primer crédito que tuvo con MFP, y desde entonces ha logrado captar clientes. En ocasiones su hijo la apoya en el trabajo, pero generalmente hay una chica a la que ha contrato para que lo ayude en los trabajos fuerte de la cocina. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un negocio propio y tener un ingreso económico para ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Además le gusta sentirse productiva. Su anhelo es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, como colocar piso de cemento,  así logrará dar mayor comidad a su clientela. Este será el préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de tener un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar en su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, arreglará el piso de su restaurante tanto el salón principal como en la cocina, hacerlo de material noble, para esto comprará cementos y arena y otros.
texts.en:
Angélica, 44, is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead. She has been separated for ten years, and lives with her two children, ages 31 and 15, and her two grandchildren who she loves dearly; that's why she is happy to have them near. They live together in their own house. 

Angela sells meals, and has a restaurant that she opened in her own home, that she set up five years ago through a lot of effort and dedication. That was thanks to the first loan that she had with MFP, and since then, she has succeeded in attracting customers. Sometimes her son helps with the work, but normally there is a girl who she has hired to help her with the hard work in the kitchen. 

What she likes about her work is having her own business, and an income to help with the household expenses. In addition, she likes to feel productive.

Her goal is to improve the infrastructure of her business by installing a cement floor; this way she will manage to provide more comfort for her customers. 

This will be her 14th loan with MFP. She feels happy to have this financial support, as this way she will feel sure of moving forward in her business. Moreover, she is committed once again to making her instalment payments. 

With the amount applied for, she will repair the floor in the restaurant, in the main room, and in the kitchen. She will do this with high quality materials.  For this she will buy cement, sand, and other materials.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Jenny Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Jenny a sus 21 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 5 años, ella se dedica desde hace varios años y en compañía de su esposo al cultivo de maíz. Debido a la temporada invernal que ha afectado su cultivo, la señora Jenny requiere de la compra de insumos para su cultivo como riegos y abonos para fortalecerlo. Con lo anterior, la señora Jenny podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y esposo.  A futuro la señora Jenny sueña con tener su propia finca y ver crecer a su hijo en un ambiente sano y lleno de amor.
texts.en: Jenny, 21, has a 5-year old son.  For some years she and her husband have planted corn.  The winter weather affected the plants and Jenny needs to buy supplies for them such as fertilizer and irrigation equipment  to strengthen the crop.   Jenny used the previous loan to give her husband and son a better quality of life.  She dreams of having her own farm in the future and to see her son grow up healthy and full of love.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer and irrigation equipment for the corn crop

loans.name: Makhzuna

texts.ru: Махзуна замужем и любящая мать четырех детей. Её муж нигде не работает, она сама содержит семью и ей тяжело одной обеспечить четверых детей. Она занимается купле- продажей скота более 10 лет. В целях улучшения финансового состояния она хочет купить 10 голов овец, чтобы расширить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи. На полученную прибыль она планирует купить дойную корову. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони. Она очень надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за поддержку.
texts.en: Makhzuna is married and a loving mother of four children. Her husband can't work and she supports the family all by herself. It is very hard for Makhzuna to provide for four children on her own but she has been maintaining a livestock business for the last ten years. To improve her financial situation Makhzuna wants to buy 10 more sheep and she plans to use the profits from future sales of those animals to buy a milk cow. For this reason Makhzuna is requesting a loan of 4000 somoni and she hopes for your help and is thanking in advance for the support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable sellers in the area. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions, potatoes, and cabbages for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions, potatoes, and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo, de 24 años, es un joven padre de familia muy amable, sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su conviviente Mariela de 18 años y su querido hijo Ken de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Gustavo consiste en la compra y venta de pescado. Desde hace mucho tiempo viene realizando esta actividad que le permite ser su fuente económica y así puede mantener a su familia con la tranquilidad de que no le falte nada en su casa. su constante animo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocido, ya que él vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es un vendedor muy alegre, que siempre recibe a sus clientes una sonrisa. Además alquila un vehiculo el cual le proporciona un ingreso adicional, al principio le fue muy complicado, pero con el pasar del tiempo empezó a consolidarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que sale de los pescados, ya que se impregna en la ropa. Espera tener en el futuro un vehiculo acondicionado que le permita transportar sus productos sin que se malogren. Este será el tercer préstamo con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará mas productos para seguir vendiendo, a parte de dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo comprándole algunas piezas y pagando al mecánico que le haga el trabajo.
texts.en:
Gustavo, age 24, is a young father who is very kind, unassuming, and hard-working.  He lives in his parents’ house with his common-law wife, 18 year old Mariela, and his beloved three year old son, Ken.  He wants to give them a better quality of life.

Gustavo buys and sells fish.  He has been doing this for a long time, and it is his source of income.  This is the way he manages to support his family with the peace of mind that they lack for nothing at home.  His constant motivation to excel led him to enter this business and he has made himself very well-known over time because he sells the freshest and most delicious fish at the market.  He is a pleasant salesman who always greets his customers with a smile. 

He also rents a vehicle, which provides him with additional income.  At first it was very complicated for him, but in time he became more capable.  

What he likes the most about his work is talking with his customers.  He has been doing this business activity for four years.  He considers the most difficult part to be putting up with the intense smell of the fish because it permeates his clothes.  He hopes in the future to have a vehicle that is set up to allow him to transport his products without the bad odor.  

This will be his third loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he will have financial support.  That way he will feel certain that his business will advance.  He pledges, once again, to make his payments on time as he did with the previous loans that he had.  He will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy more products in order to keep selling.   He will also have maintenance performed on his vehicle.  He will buy some parts and pay a mechanic to do the work.

loans.use: to buy more fish in order to stock his stand and to provide maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Stephen Kamande

texts.en:
Stephen Kamande is 25 years old and married with a child. For the past five years, he has been selling clothes in Voi and he is doing great. Stephen was recently introduced to KADET.

Stephen is requesting his first loan to purchase more bales of shirts, trousers, and skirts to sell to the residents of Voi. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to purchase his own plot of land and build a business premises. Stephen hopes to have a more profitable business and thus be able to live a happier, comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, trousers, and skirts

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana sells sweet potatoes at Asebu Ekroful. She is single and has two children. Diana has been selling sweet potatoes for five years. She uses her income to feeds and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of sweet potatoes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sweet potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children all of  whom attend school. She lives at her own  house that has piped water but no electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his bicycle repair business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kukuya would like to buy 6 steer to restock her farm

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is married and has a one year old son. He used to work in a factory, but they let him go four years ago. Since money was tight and he had mouths to feed, Juan opened up his own business, which has become a local favorite in Guayaquil. In fact, whenever the Mifex team visits Ecuador, Juan (or “Nene” as he likes to be called) serves up the best dishes around.

He and his wife work seven days a week managing their restaurant which sells rice & beans, beef, chicken, and chorizo. His wife Betty is the cook, and Nene attends to the clients. It wasn’t easy to start the restaurant because they didn’t have much capital. However, like many other Ecuadorian businesses, they started out by working from home in order to save money. Through perseverance, things have gone pretty well over the past four years. They have received such high demand that they had to build an extension to their home just to make space for more tables. Not only are customers coming from the local neighborhood, but from all around Guayaquil. Nene and Betty run the restaurant from 6:30 pm until 2:00 am.

Juan and Betty have made great progress with their business over the last several months with the help of a Mifex loan. The chairs and tables they bought were good investments as they allowed their customers to be more comfortable. They also used part of their money to buy meats in bulk. Their business has done so great that they are now offering lunch during the day as well. Juan and Betty's only problem now is that there is too much work and their kitchen and equipment cannot handle the load. They plan on using their next loan in order to purchase an industrial kitchen and continue making physical improvements to their restaurant.

loans.use: Buy an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 35, is married with five children, two in secondary school and the rest in primary school. She runs a shop in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam’s-and perhaps Tanzania’s- biggest trading area. She deals in cosmetics, decorations, children's toys, and stationery. She has been in this business for the past four years and is both a wholesaler and retailer.

She currently faces a lot of competition and as such, has decided to attract more customers by increasing the variety of stock for her shop. She is also planning to open up another shop, outside the city center. Joyce recently obtained a loan of USD 1,000 which she paid back in full. She is now in need of USD 1,200 to help her buy more stock and expand her business.

loans.use: Buy Stock, expand bussines

loans.name: Irada

texts.en: Irada is 35 years old and lives in Khaladj village  in the Salyan region with her husband and fthree children. She has run her own farm for the past 4 years.  Irada has requested a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Mr. Marcelo C. lives in his own house in the Villa Mercedes zone of El Alto city. He lives with his wife and two kids and works as a caretaker in a school in the city of La Paz. His wife works at a kiosk in the same location. With the five credits they received before from IMPRO Marcelo and his wife were able to accomplish the hard construction of six rooms, all with a cement structure and brick walls. They also finished two other rooms - the ones that they actually live in. The loan Marcelo requests will be directed towards the construction of the four rooms that remain to be completed. This is the sixth time that he is requesting credit and based on a socioeconomic analysis he favorably qualifies and is able to repay a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Marcelo C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Mercedes de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y su dos hijos; el señor Marcelo trabaja como portero en una escuela de la ciudad de La Paz, y la esposa atiende un kiosco en la misma unidad educativa. Con los cinco créditos anteriores concedidos por IMPRO, Marcelo y su esposa realizaron la construcción de seis habitaciones en obra gruesa, es decir estructura de cemento y muros de ladrillo, y concluyó dos habitaciones en obra fina, las que actualmente ocupan. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de las cuatro habitaciones restantes. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To complete the finished work of 4 rooms in order to live better

loans.name: Amelia Rosmeri

texts.es:
Amelia Rosmeri is 28-years-old and only studied through 5th grade. She has two children who still depend on her. She lives in El Porvenir district in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad. Previously, Amelia worked in a shop making shoes, but when she got pregnant, she couldn't continue working. This is why she began to sell food at the entrance of her house. She saved a little money, and with that and the first loan of 300 nuevos soles she received from her communal bank Semillitas Creativas (Little Creative Seeds), she had the capital she needed to sell soft drinks and cookies in addition to food. She saved her profits and, little by little, with the other credits she received, she started a business of selling cleaning products.

With this loan of 1300 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy products like wax and brooms to keep supplying her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Amelia Rosmeri tiene 28 años de edad, sólo estudió hasta el quinto grado de secundaria y tiene dos niños que dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Anteriormente la señora Amelia trabajaba alistando calzado en un taller, pero cuando salió embarazada no pudo continuar trabajando, así es que empezó a vender comida en la puerta de su casa y así fue ahorrando un poco de dinero y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Semillitas Creativas” completó el capital para vender, a parte de comida, gaseosas y galletas. Fue guardando sus ganancias y poco a poco con los otros créditos que ha recibido ha ido implementando un negocio de venta de productos de limpieza.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,300.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará productos como ceras y escobas para continuar implementando su nuevo negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products

loans.name: Akuyo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akuyo G. is 33 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has owned this business for 2 years and has set up her store in the big market of Kpalimé. The profits from the sales allow her to meet her needs and to partly provide for the household expenses. With this loan she would like to buy 5 bags of candy, 5 boxes of cookies, 10 bags of rice, 5 boxes of sugar, 7 boxes of canned goods. This would increase the size of her store in order to meet the demand of her ever-increasing number of customers. Thus she would improve her living conditions with the profits she would gain from the sales.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, madame Akuyo G. est âgée de 33 ans et détient ce commerce depuis 02 ans et a installé sa boutique au grand marché de Kpalimé. Les profits issus de ses ventes lui permettent de répondre à ses besoins et de supporter en partie les dépenses du foyer. Par ce crédit, elle souhaite acheter 05 sachets de bonbons, 05 cartons de biscuits, 10 sacs de riz,05 cartons de sucres , 07 cartons de boîtes de conserves afin d’augmenter la capacité de sa boutique pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croître et par là améliorer sa condition de vie avec les bénéfices qu’elle réalisera sur ses ventes.

loans.use: With this loan she would like to buy buy 5 bags of candy, 5 boxes of cookies, 10 bags of rice, 5 boxes of sugar, 7 boxes of canned goods. This would increase the size of her store in order to meet the demand of her ever-increasing number of customers.  Thus she would improve her living conditions with the profits.

loans.name: Tumiani Group

texts.en:
The Tumiani Group is a group of male entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Kamutu B. is the leader of the group, and he runs a tea cafe that sells beverages and common Tanzanian snack food. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

Note: YOSEFO utilizes a group lending method. Clients receive individual loans for their respective businesses as a part of a larger group. The group method provides solidarity for lenders and increases repayment rate.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Margarita Del Rosari

texts.es:
Mrs Margarita A. B. is a young mother who comes from Cinco Pinos in the Chinandega Department. For five years she has worked in a community education institute selling food such as biscuits, churritos embolsados, sweets and soft drinks.

It must be pointed out that Mrs A. is a good example, given that despite her sad economic crisis she has been successful in lookng after the needs of her young daughter who today, more than ever, needs the care and protection of her mother, as she is so young.

In order to carry out her food sales, Mrs A. needs to purchase raw materials to make her products. This is why she is seeking support from Ceprodel with the aim of obtaining economic resources which will allow her to purchase produce and continue to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Margarita A. B. es una joven madre originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos del departamento de Chinandega. Ha trabajado desde hace 5 años en un instituto escolar de la comunidad vendiendo comestibles como galletas, churritos embolsados, caramelos y refrescos.

Es de mucho necesidad destacar que la señora A. es digna de imitar por el hecho de que a pesar de su lamentable crisis económica ha logrado suplir la necesidad de su pequeña hija que hoy mas que nunca necesita del cuido y la protección de su madre por ser de muy corta edad.

Para llevar a cabo sus ventas de comestibles, la señora A. necesita adquirir su materia prima para preparar los productos. Es por este motivo que busca apoyo en Ceprodel con el fin de adquirir recursos económicos que le permitan comprar sus productos y de esta manera continuar manteniendo su hogar.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to create her food products

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima K. lives in Vahdat. She is 36 years old, married with 1 child. She has a community college degree. She does not have job but sells perfume and other small household goods. She has a small shop at the market in Vahdat. The business makes some profit but it is not sufficient to cover the family needs. Fotima has thus decided to add new products to her inventory, which will help increase sales and profits. She really needs the loan to succeed. She plans to repay it in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Кайнарова Фотима проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 36 лет, замужем и имеет 1ребенка. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает. Но занимается торговлей парфюмерией и другими промышленными товарами. Имеет небольшой магазин на рынке города Вахдат.Получает неплохой доход ,но все равно ей не хватает на жизнь. Поэтому она решила увеличить ассртимент товара, что поможет ей увеличить объем продаж и увеличить доход.Ей необходимо получить кредит , который поможет ей добится успеха. А погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To add new products to inventory

loans.name: Ni Komang Rani

texts.id:
Living in a city encourages Komang Rani to start the kiosk business in front of her house. She runs the business to support her husband who works a truck driver because her husband's income is not enough to cover the family's life expenses. With the initial capital of Rp. 1,000,000, Rani filled her kiosk with various kinds of merchandises such as food, drink, staples, snack, etc. Rani opens the kiosk in the morning from 6 am until 6 pm. Everyday, Rani goes to the market to buy the supplies at around 5 am as her house is quite near to the state market. Her profit is about Rp. 50,000 per day. She uses the profit to cover her daily expenses. As the price of staples is getting higher and higher nowadays, Rani feels that she needs to save some money for the future since her children are all married and live with their hussbands. She uses the loan from Dinari for adding her business capital so that she can offer more merchandise and she can expand the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup dikota membuat Komang Rani membuka usaha warung didepan rumahnya. Untuk membantu suaminya , Nengah Jasa, yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk ke Jawa . Karena Penghasilannya sebagai sopir tidak mencukupi untuk kebutuhan ekonominya. Maka Rani membantu dengan membuka warung di rumahnya.Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Rani melengkapi isi warungnya dengan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan, minuman,sembako ,snak,dan lain-lain. Rani membuka warungnya pada pagi hari jam 6 pagi sampai sore jam 6 sore. Setiap pagi Rani juga pergi ke pasar untuk membeli keperluan dagangannya,sekitar pukul 5 pagi,karena rumahnya dekat dengan pasar negara. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari, Rani bisa mempergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya sehari-hari ,karena kebutuhan sembako harganya sangat mahal sekarang ini,maka Rani juga harus bisa menabung untuk masa depannya,karena anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah dan tinggal bersama suaminya. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya agar dagangannya semakin banyak dan berkembang.

loans.use: To add capital for buying more kiosk materials

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.en:
Carmen, Sabina and Beatriz are all members of the Village Bank Marcela.

Carmen is 26 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has one daughter who is just one year old. Sabina is 30 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has three children. Beatriz is 25 years old, lives with her boyfriend, and has one new baby of three months.

These three women all have different businesses for which they use their loans from FINCA. Carmen has a business of selling meat in the market, which she has been doing for about a year. Sabina has a business of selling fruit in the market Magdalena, which she has been doing for one year. Beatriz has a store where she sells all different sorts of things including food and drink – she has had this business for about four years.

Sabina, Beatriz and Carmen need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles, and 600 soles, respectively, with which they will buy more products (fruit, food and drink, and meat) to add to their businesses.

Sabina dreams of succeeding at her business and building her own house one day; Beatriz dreams of expanding her business; and Carmen dreams of having a big house and a store in which she can sell her meat.

loans.use: To buy more products (fruit, food and drink, and meat) to add to their businesses.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Her daily work, says Sadith, is to provide good customer service and to offer products at prices that suit every pocketbook. Sadith sells fruit, bananas, cassava and fish. She is 36 years old and the mother of two. Her sons are in school and are her motivation for getting ahead. Her partner Artur, who works as a sharpener at a sawmill, always looks out for Sadith and her sons, especially when it comes to business decisions that Sadith proposes. Her wish now is to continue to build her business. Let’s help this hard-working mother to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Su labor diaria es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y sobre todo ver que sus productos estén al alcance de sus bolsillos, nos cuenta la señora Sadith, quien vende fruta, plátano, yuca y pescado. A sus 36 años es madre de 2 hijos que estudian y son su motivo de salir adelante, su pareja, el señor Artur, trabaja en un aserradero, es afilador y siempre está al pendiente de ella y de sus hijos, sobre todo con las decisiones de negocio que se propone la señora Sadith. Su deseo ahora es seguir creciendo en su negocio, ampliar e implementar. Apoyemos a esta madre que trabaja duro por salir adelante.

loans.use: Expand her business in food sales

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sokhom is a 38-year-old farmer, living in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. She lives with her husband and their five children, all of whom are young and attending school. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Chheang, is also farmer, and is a head of family. Sokhom has been growing rice crops since 1990 and works hard everyday to support her family.

Because of her family's increasing expenses, she needs to expand her farming business to increase her income. She requests a loan of KHR 1,000,000 ($250 USD) to purchase a plot of farmland to use for growing rice. Sokhom's husband is pictured because Sokhom is not available.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to use for growing rice

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: This is the second time that Mrs. Kim C. V. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity. She lives in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Cheap Sarin, helps her with the business. Mrs. Kim C. V. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to study. Previously, Mrs. Kim C. V. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She has succeeded in paying the loan off.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.fr: Evelyne T. est revendeuse de pagnes depuis plus de 5 ans à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Evelyne désire par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV acheter des pagnes et des tissus pour mieux satisfaire aux demandes de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
Evelyne T. has been a retailer of "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) for over five years in Danyi, a village located about 175 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five. Evelyne would like to use this second FECECAV loan to buy pagnes and fabrics to better satisfy the demands of her ever-growing customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes and fabrics

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina R. is 46 years old and lives in Dar es Salaam. She is married and has a child who is 25. Since 2002, Amina has been earning income running a mama lishe, a local restaurant or café in Tanzania that serves food such as ugali (hot, sticky dough made from maize flour) and plantains (cooked savoury banana), served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.
Amina works 9 to 12 hours a day. Currently, she needs a loan of US$250 in order to purchase additional supplies for her restaurant, including mchele (uncooked rice) and maharage (beans). Amina thanks everyone for their support.

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for a restaurant

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N., 44, and her husband, Mr. Savat Miech, 46, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have three sons. One of their children is learning tailoring, another son attends school, and the youngest son is still at home.

Mom and her husband have been selling grocery items for two years. They buy them from Koki market for resale at their house. Mom is requesting a loan of $ 1000 to purchase grocery items for resale and to buy a sewing machine for her son.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
Nasim is 47 years of age. He lives with his wife and two children, 14 and 10 years old. Nasim has been breeding livestock 2 years. Thanks to this activity, he can cover his living expenses. He goes out every morning to graze his animals. He enjoys caring for his animals, and he is grateful that this work puts food on the table for his children. Nasim’s family is his greatest love, and they are the biggest motivators in his life. He will use the loan to purchase young cattle, which will revitalize his herd and help him become the best breeder in his area. With your help this will be possible.

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan has a rich and varied history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and an outpost of Alexander the Great's domain. From this region sprang great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex amalgam of Islamic, Soviet, and modern Western influences as well as Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan's independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Rok

texts.en: Rok S., 33, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a professional tailor who is able to earn about $3 every day. Her husband (pictured), Nut Sarat, 35, is a motor-taxi driver. On average, he earns $5 a day. This couple has one little child. Mrs. Rok S. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband's motorbike so he can transport goods and people.

loans.use: Purchase trailer to attach to a motorbike to transport goods and people

loans.name: Madhu Maliti

texts.en:
Madhu Maliti M. lives in Khokhana, which is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with father-in-law, husband, and two children. Her husband, Mr. Gan Bahadur, works in a government office in a lower post. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is in grade 12 and her son is in grade 9.

Mrs. M. is a farmer who grows seasonal vegetables, especially green vegetables. She sells her vegetables in the  local market in the morning and evening daily.

Mrs. M. is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 ($400 USD) to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is a 39-year-old mother of six. She is married to a farmer; the land they cultivate was inherited from her parents. Gloria and her husband grow rice and vegetables to support the basic needs of their family.

She has applied for a loan to buy certified seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. She hopes to increase production through these materials. If the harvest is good, she hopes to save enough money to be able to buy farming materials on her own next time, without the use of a loan.

She hopes to send her children to school and eventually to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working in agriculture since 2007. Ahmad plants bananas and lemons.

Ahmad requests a loan of $1500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business and rent an apartment. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his business and rent an apartment.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is a 47-year-old mother of eight children. She also takes care of additional children who are orphans. Her husband is a farmer. Esther sells peanuts and second-hand clothes to supplement the family income. She says that her largest challenges right now are inadequate finances, few customers and a diminishing supply of groundnuts. She is asking for 10,000 KES (US$150) to increase her food stock.

loans.use: To purchase food.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба- женщина в возрасте 30 лет. замужем имеет двоих детей.Муж на заработках в России.Сама Матлюба нигде не работает, т.к.дети пока маленькие.Поэтому три года как Матлюба занимается своим маленьким бизнесом, торговлей в маленьком магазинчике возле своего дома.Она проживает в 13 микрорайоне города Худжанда, который расположен на окраине города,и торговых точек там мало.Из-за чего и идёт торговля Матлюбы за счёт покупки соседей по дому.У неё в магазине в основном все прдовольственные товары первой необходимости для дома, а также получив кредит она хочет добавитьв свою продажу включив мороженое.Перед её магазином есть небольшая площадка , которую Матлюба хорошо отремонтировала и сделала навес.И теперь в летнее время она поставив пластмассовые столики и стулья будет обслуживать покупателей, мороженым  и напитков. Для начала она решила получить небольшую сумму кредита, а в дальнейшем будет кредитоваться согласно своим планам.
texts.en:
Matluba is a 30-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. Her husband has gone to Russia to find work. Matluba does not work outside the home as her children are still little, so for the past three years she has run a business trading out of a small shop near the house. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Khujand in micro-district 13, and retail outlets there are scarce. Matluba's customers are her neighbors, and her shop stocks staples for the home. Once she has received the loan, she would like to start selling ice cream. There's a small space in front of her shop that Matluba has remodeled and where she has installed an awning, so that in the summertime she can put out plastic tables and chairs to serve her customers ice cream and beverages. She decided to take out a small loan to get started, and in the future will obtain financing to carry out her plans.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of groceries

loans.name: Rubina Asif Masih Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 14 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Rubina baji's husband works in animal sales. He buys animals from markets and sells them to butchers. He has 3 years of experience in this business. Rubina baji, a very responsible and sensitive soul, is a tailor. She wants to keep her family happy and labors for them. She is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats) to increase the profit of her husband’s animal selling business.

Rubina baji leads a group that includes four other women from her locality. Suraiya baji, Razia baji, and Shakeela Parveen baji each want loans to buy donkey carts for loading. Zainab Ilahi baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to resell

loans.name: Nushaba

texts.en:
Nushaba was born in 1978. She is married and has 2 children. This woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan town of Fuzuli. She has settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Bala Bahmanli.

Nushaba has run a butcher shop business for 8 years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy meat to improve her business.

Nushaba's relative is pictured.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Marry Ann

texts.en: Marry Ann A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 32 years old, married, and has four infant children. Marry Ann owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2001, Marry Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Marry Ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 12th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Los Cusis Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Cusis” esta representado por la señora Leticia y conformado por 14 miembros dentro D. los cuales se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre la señora Leticia y su hermana la señora Sarah Milena, ambas cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no representa un riego para el grupo. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. productos como la comida, cosméticos, artesanías libros, ropa, llantas D. repuesto y abarrotes. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Los Cusis" is represented by Mrs. Leticia and comprised of 14 members, including Leticia's sister Sarah Milena. Both have individual incomes, and as such bear no risk to the group. The majority of the group's members sell products such as food, cosmetics, handicrafts, books, clothing, and groceries. The business competition is quite high, however, the group's dedication and inspiration to work help them superseD. the competition. The group is requesting financing to buy new merchandise and materials in order to expand their sales posts and generate higher revenue, which will allow the members to improve their families' quality of life. In general, all of the group members have experience, thanks to previous financing from similar organizations like Agrocapital Foundation, who know about the responsibility and compromise required to receive economic support for businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Djénéba

texts.fr:
Madame Djénéba  S. est âgée  de 61 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants dans le quartier Pélengana  Sébénikoro de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à  l’école par refus de ses parents qui voyaient en l’école une porte de déperdition des filles, elle commença  très tôt les activités de petits commerces. Elle mena plusieurs activités mais fini par se spécialiser, après son mariage, dans la grillade de l’arachide. Cette  activité, elle l’exerce depuis 11 ans au marché château de Ségou et dans les différentes foires (lundi de Ségou et jeudi de Banankoro). Parallèlement à cette vente d’arachide grillée, elle vend également au marché château du mil  acheté les jours de foire du village de Banankoro.
C’est pour pérenniser son activité, qu’elle décida de  faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 44 mois, après 4 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés. 
Elle est à sa  4ème demande de prêt individuel,  qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter,  3 sacs d’arachide et 10 sacs de mils. Elle s’approvisionne en arachide à Ségou et mil à Banankoro.
Madame  Djénéba  S. vend toujours  au comptant   à   une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA, ce qui  lui permettra de faire face à des dépenses familiales (achat de savons, d’habits pour les enfants etc.) et de participer à des événements sociaux (mariage, baptême et funérailles).
Son ambition est d’avoir un montant plus élevé avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son commerce qui lui est cher.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djénéba S. is 61 years old and lives with her husband and their 6 children in the neighborhood of Pélengana Sébénikoro in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having not being to school, due to the refusal of her parents who saw schooling as a road to perdition for girls, she began working in small-scale commerce. She did several businesses, but after her marriage, she stopped those in order to specialize in grilled peanuts. She has done this business for 11 years in the market of Ségou and in other markets (Monday in Ségou and Thursday in Banankoro). Alongside selling roasted peanuts, she also sells in the smaller markets the millet she purchases on the market days in Banankoro.

In order to continue her business, she decided to join the the microfinance group Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with this group for 44 months; she has completed 4 group loans and 3 individual loans - each has been fully and properly repaid. She is now on her 4th request for an individual loan. She will use this loan to purchase 3 bags of peanuts and 10 bags of millet. She gets her peanut supplies from Ségou and her millet from Banankoro.

Mrs. Djénéba S. always sells for cash to a clientele composed of men and women. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which will enable her pay for her family's expenses (to buy soap, clothes for her children etc.) and to participate in social events (marriage, baptism and funerals). Her ambition is to borrow a greater amount with Soro Yiriwaso in order to run her business well, which is very important to her.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of peanuts and millet

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
M. Farogat is 44 years old. She and her husband have three children. To improve her family position and support her husband with family expenses, Farogat started her business 9 years ago. She is baking “lepeshka” at home. Having the customers, Farogat is selling the majority of her products just from her place.

Farogat is doing all the best to ensure her children have the best future. Now she requests $1,200 USD that she is planning to spend on the purchase of flour at wholesale as required for her business. Farogat is grateful for all who are supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the flour as a wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Remely

texts.en:
Remely is a persevering mother who patiently manages a small store in their rural village of Barangay Kinacao Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Despite the hardship of life, she remains strong and determined to fight against poverty. She also pursued her college studies until she is able to earn a degree in college. She is married to Edwin T. and they are blessed with two children. They have a great ambition to their children hence, they are striving hard to support their education.  
	Remely wanted to borrow loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7, 000 as additional business capital for her store. She hopes her store become progressive and be able to become successful in her chosen business through the amount she hopes to avail. According to her, the business is of big help in supporting the needs of her family especially her children. She has an estimated weekly income of PHP1, 000 which she utilized to pay the tuition fees and allowances of their children and also to pay her weekly amortization. She aims that someday, she can able to convert her humble store into a grocery store with the continuous support of Kiva loans.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: N. Mariam is a hardworking business lady, 29 years old. She has a hardware business, mainly selling cement. She has been in this business for four years. Her husband is also in business, and they have two children. She is using this loan to bring in more cement for the shop to fill her customers’ orders. Her main goal is to educate her children in good institutions.

loans.use: To bring in more cement

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 37 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su pequeña de 3 años. Su anhelo es de prosperar mediante sus cultivos, por ello madruga trabajando desde las 4 de la mañana hasta el medio día, sacando todos los arbustos de sus chacras de achotes y café. Él siembra estos dos productos porque le son muy rentables en distintas épocas del año; el café, en abril y mayo y los achotes, en setiembre. De ese modo guarda sus provisiones para el resto de los meses, siempre trabajando en común acuerdo con su esposa. Afortunadamente, cuenta con un comprador estable del café que produce, que es una de las empresas acopiadoras de su zona. Adicionalmente, Jaime fabrica zampoñas (instrumento musical de viento) de artesanía de diversos tamaños y los vende a los colegios y escuelas de su localidad, así obtiene ingresos adicionales para su hogar.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siendo un cliente muy responsable y ejerciendo el cargo de presidente de su banco comunal, por lo que se ha ganado el aprecio de todos sus compañeros. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos y materiales para la elaboración de sus zampoñas.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline M. is 31 years old and is married with two children aged between 9 and 2 years. She lives in Nyakabanda sector in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Jacqueline has had a shop selling mixed shoes for a period of three months. Her very new business is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Jacqueline is a true entrepreneur and very hopeful for her future success.  She is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more shoes for sale as well as by providing a needed working-capital cushion.

With the profits from her expanded business, Jacqueline hopes to improve her life situation and support her family.

loans.use: To buy more variety of shoes

loans.name: Ndiémé

texts.fr: Ndiémé D. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Depuis un an et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" et y a reçu 3 prêts qu'elle a remboursés sans difficulté. Elle est vendeuse de tissu et de vêtement pour et hommes et dames. Elle soutien son mari pour la prise en charge de leur famille à partir des bénéfices qu'elle obtient de son commerce.
texts.en:
Ndiémé D. is a 52-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children. For 1½ years, she has been a member Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" and has received three loans from it that she repaid without difficulty. She is a seller of fabrics and clothing for men and women. She supports her husband in meeting family expenses by the profits she obtains from her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her commercial work

loans.name: Super Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Super Plus » est une banque communautaire qui est solidairement composée par 25 membres dont José K. est dirigeante.
José K. 51 ans, vend des sucrés depuis 2005. Elle exerce son activité dans un quartier montagneux localisé au Sud-est de la ville de Kinshasa. Elle a acquit une expérience dans la gestion de son activité qui lui génère un bénéfice de $ 40 par semaine. José compte avec le prêt qu’elle recevra renforcer son capital en achetant 5 casiers de sucrés. Elle est cliente fidèle qui a obtenu 3 crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a tous remboursés. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour, un dépôt des boissons à vendre dans son milieu. Elle est veuve et mère d’un seul enfant âgé de 24 ans.
texts.en:
"Super Plus" is a community bank which is established in solidarity by 25 members, including the leader, Josée K., aged 51, who has been selling soft drinks since 2005. She operates in a mountainous district located southwest of the city of Kinshasa. She has acquired management experience from her work, which generates a profit of $40 a week for her. With this loan she’ll receive, she plans to boost her capital by buying five cases of soft drinks. She is a loyal HOPE RDC client who had three loans, and she repaid all of them. Her ambition is to open a beverages outlet one day for making sales in her area. Josée is a widow and the mother of just one child who is 24 years old.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 cases of soft drinks to sell to grow her profits

loans.name: Albaro

texts.es:
Albaro, de 29 años, es un joven muy alegre y sencillo. Vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es brindarles una vejez tranquila.

Desde muy temprano por la mañana comienza con la confección de sus tejidos artesanales, los cuales lleva a vender a su puesto en el Mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Su trabajo es muy bueno es por eso que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus compradores.
Lo que más le gusta a Albaro es tejer, ya que es una actividad que aprendió de su madre, lleva 10 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día para cumplir sus pedidos. 
Para el futuro, espera poder comprar más máquinas de tejer, para así poder contratar a una persona que le ayude con los pedidos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Albaro con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro préstamo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más lana para confeccionar más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Albaro, 29, is a very cheerful and unassuming young man. He lives with his parents and his greatest wish is to provide them with a comfortable old-age. From very early in the morning he begins to make his woven creations which he will sell in his stand in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). His work is very good so there is high demand for it from buyers. What Albaro most likes is to weave, a skill he learned from his mother and has been doing for 10 years. He considers the most difficult part of his work having to work all day to be able to fill his orders. For the future, he would like to buy more looms so that he can hire an assistant to help him with his work load.
