This is Albaro's third loan with MFP and he knows that he must repay on time if he wants future loans. He is a very active and polite member of his communal bank. The 1000 soles requested will be used to buy more wool with which to make his artesanal creations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Frevisminda

texts.en:
Frevisminda O. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 47 years old. Frevisminda is separated from her spouse and has three adult children. To make a living, Frevisminda sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $56 a month from this activity. In 2009, Frevisminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for a business of pig-fattening.

Frevisminda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her current business of selling daily use products. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorn C. is 52 years old and lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo Province. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are farmers while the other two attend the local public school.
Chhorn is a farmer who owns a 2.9-hectare piece of land for cultivating rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and it is far from an irrigation system. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, a water machine and, with the rest of the loan, she needs to buy fuel.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, a water machine and fuel

loans.name: Oimunos

texts.en:
Vegetable farming is a traditional occupation for many people living in Tajikistan.  Having a fairly large amount of land surrounding Oimunos'  house, this mother of four decided to growing vegetables.  Neither she nor her husband have been able to find steady employment.  Oimunos has experience growing and selling produce and wants to do more to generate more income for her family.  She requests a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds so she can grow her business.  Oimunos sincerely thank you for your generous heart.   
--------------------------------------------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy C. is from the village of Dicayas. She is 27 years old. Mary Joy is married and has 2 children. The elder is school-aged and the other one is an infant. To make a living, Mary Joy plants and harvests a variety of vegetables, raises pigs, and also provides "motorcycle for hire" transportation services to local community members. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly average from these activities.

In 2006, Mary Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets and construction materials for housing repair. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be Mary Joy's 8th loan from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and save for future needs. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Mercedes Matilde

texts.es: La señora Mercedes Matilde tiene 43 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en sus comarcas, madre de 1 hija una niña de 7 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una finca ubicada en las afueras como obrero. Mercedes tiene 3 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos a la gente del campo ya que ellos son sus principales clientes. Debido a esto ella decide realizar un financiamiento con el fin de comprar materia prima necesaria. Sus deseos son seguir apoyando a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes Matilde is 43 years old and sells clothing as a traveling merchant in her neighborhood. She has a seven year old daughter. Her husband works as a field laborer on a farm located on the outskirts of town.

Mercedes has three years of experience in this business. She sells her products to residents of the rural areas, since they are her main customers. To keep her business going, Mercedes decided to request financing in order to purchase necessary materials. Her wish is to continue supporting her daughter with her education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her clothing business

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal Laureles.
Carmela es casada, tiene 47 años y 7 hijos, Carmela vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria cerca de un terminal terrestre, además Carmela compra y vende quesos.
Carmela necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y frutas.
Los sueños de Carmela son mejorar su casa y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Laureles communal bank. She is 47 years old and has seven children. Carmela sells snacks on foot, near a terminal. She also buys and sells cheeses. She needs a loan of 1,750 PEN ($625) that she will use to buy snacks and fruit. She hopes to someday be able to improve her home and diversify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de golosinas y frutas.

loans.name: Álvaro José

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro José M. es trabajador de Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como operario de Limpieza, es acompañado,  tiene un hijo y solicito el crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

El señor Álvaro José M. lleva ya 7 años trabajando con ceprodel y ha demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Álvaro José M. works as a cleaner for the municipality of Chinandega. He has a live-in partner and one child. He is requesting this loan in order to improve the family's living conditions. Álvaro José M. has had previous loans with Ceprodel during the past 7 years, and he has shown himself to be a hard-working person who is very responsible with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wood, nails and zinc sheets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used shoes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hard-working mother of five children. She is 44 years old and married. She grows pigs for a living. She also makes candies that she sells around her neighborhood. She said that sometimes it is hard to sell her pigs and candies because of competition but she is happy to share that she has regular customers. She hopes for her ventures to grow.

Lilibeth has been a member of CEVI for more than a few years now. She says that because of the financial support that she gained for her business, she was able to have 3 of her children finish high school. She dreams for all five of her children to finish college. She recently applied for a loan of PHP15,000 that she will use to buy additional piglets and feed, and also ingredients that she uses to make candies. She also wants to buy chickens that she could raise.

loans.use: To purchase feed and supplements.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa T. D. Z. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San salvador. Ella posee una venta D. productos varios, tales como: jugos enlatados, sodas, dulces, juguetes plásticos, pegamentos, billetes D. lotería y saldo para recargar a celulares. Ella tiene 15 años D. experiencia como comerciante, lo que le permite conocer cuáles son los productos que más se venden en el lugar que posee su venta, la cual es en la avenida Cuscatlán, una zona con mucha afluencia D. personas y varios negocio y bancos a su alrededor. Nicolasa siempre ha trabajado al lado D. su esposo, por el bienestar D. su hogar y D. su hijo D. 18 años D. edad, el cual se decía a estudiar, ella ha sabido ser una madre muy cuidadosa con su hijo y así mismo una madre muy responsable quien trabaja a diario por su único hijo. Nicolasa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tarjetas para recargar saldo a celulares, así mismo recargas electrónicas, ya que este es un negocio muy bien remunerado, ya que posee gran demanda en la actualidad. Con esto Nicolasa alberga la esperanza D. poder contribuir más con su hogar y poder contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Nicolasa T. D. Z., 60, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department. She has a general store where she sells such items as: canned juices, soft drinks, candies, plastic toys, adhesives, lottery tickets and cellular phone recharging cards. She has 15 years experience as a merchant which permits her to know what products sell best in her location, which is Cuscatlán Avenue, an area with a lot of foot traffic with several stores and banks nearby. Nicolasa has always worked alongsiD. her husband for the good of her home and her 18-year-old son, who is a student. She has known how to be a careful mother with her son as well as a responsible mother who works daily for her only son. Nicolasa is asking for funds to buy cell phone recharging prepaid cards as well as electronic chargers because this is a very profitable business due to current very high demand. Nicolasa hopes to contribute more to her home this way and to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prepaid cell phone service cards.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
EL grupo del que vamos a platicar se llama “Alegria”, el cual las integrantes de identifican mucho con este nombre por que son muy alegres, sus intregrantes son: Senorina Dávila, Guiumar, Josefa reina, Maria Lourdes, Liliana, francisca faustina todas ella se dedican a la elaboración de dulce típico (alegrias, palanquetas y obleas)

    La Sra. Senorina desde hace 10 años de dedica a la venta de dulce típico cuenta con 42 años de edad, actualmente vive con su esposo el Sr. Antonio B. Vidal el es originario de huazulco cuando regresaron a vivir a esta comunidad fue entonces cuando ambos y  junto con sus hijos que son 3 iniciaron la venta de este dulces, el mayor se llama Alexci B. Dávila de 22 años de edad (soltero), Alexander B. Dávila de 20 años(soltero) y el pequeño Kevin de 15 años actualmente estudia la preparatoria cursa el 1er grado.

La Sra. Senorina junto con su familia han salido adelante con su negocio de hecho han llegado a tener pedidos grandes y que proveen al estado de puebla, sus hijos le son de gran ayuda, ella tiene 4 años trabajando con Fundacion Realidad y le ha ido muy bien con los créditos que a obtenido y a p adquirir su maquinaria y herramienta para poder trabajar.

El sueño de ella es poder acondicionar bien su taller, donde elabora su dulce, ella quiere agradecer a la Fundacion y a kiva por los créditos que le han otorgado, gracias a ellos a logrado lo que hasta la fecha tiene, y sugiere que haya crédito individuales.
texts.en:
The Group we will discuss is called “Alegria” (Happiness). Its members identify with this name because they are very happy. They are Senorina Dávila, Guiumar, Josefa Reina, Maria Lourdes, Liliana, and Francisca Faustina. All of them manufacture typical sweets (“alegrias, panquetas, and obleas”). Senorina is 42 years old and has been selling sweets for the ten years. She lives with her husband, Antonio, who is originally from Huazulco. When they returned to live in this community, they and their three children began selling sweets. The oldest is named Alexander, age 20 and single; the youngest is Kevin, age 15 and attending his first year of high school. Senorina and her family have come out ahead with their business. They have had large orders from around the state of Puebla and her children have been of great help. She has been working with Fundacion Realidad for four years and things have gone very well for her. She has used the money from past loans to buy tools and machinery that she needs for her work. She hopes to be able to equip her shop well and is very thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the loans which they have provided in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Maria De Cristo

texts.es:
La Sra. P. N. es una comerciante  que vende ropa usada y Huevos en su casa de habitación y ambulante, Ella habita en el municipio del Viejo, Departamento de Chinandega.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de pacas de ropa usada para revender y así crecer más en su negocio.

La Sra. P. N. vive sola en su casa de habitación ya que hace años se separo de su marido,  y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y viven fuera del país.

Actualmente la Sra. Lleva 25 créditos al día de hoy los cuales todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo record, y a la vez dice estar muy agradecida por todas las oportunidades que le ha brindado la Institución ya que ella siente y ve que su negocio ha crecido y mucho
texts.en:
Mrs. P. N. is a merchant who sells used clothes and eggs from home and door-to-door. She lives in Viejo, Chinandega department. She will use the funds to buy bundles of used clothing to resell in order to grow more in her business. Mrs. P. N. lives alone in her home since she has been separated from her husband for several years and all her children are adults living abroad. Currently she has had 25 loans all of which she has repaid in record time. She states that she is very grateful for the opportunities she has been granted by the institution because she feels and sees that her business has grown quite a bit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of used clothing and crates of eggs.

loans.name: San Juana Verónica

texts.es:
L. señora San Juana Verónica C. tiene ya más D. un año D. diciéndose a L. venta D. abarrotes.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad D. mercancía pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para L. inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio ya que es L. fuente D. ingreso D. su familia. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así poder comprar L. mercancía que le están pidiendo sus clientes que tenga a L. venta.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio.
texts.en:
San Juana Verónica C. has been selling groceries for over one year. She needs merchandise for her business, but at the moment she lacks the funds to purchase it. She does not want to take capital out of the business since it is the source of income for the family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy the merchandise that her clients are requesting that she carry. She plans to pay the loan with the earnings from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the business

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent, age 27, is a married man with three children, living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He grows tea, which he has sold for four years. He has an established tea garden but faces problems of prolonged droughts which hamper the expected growth of the tea crop. Like most Ugandans, Vicent dreams of building a permanent house and educating his children. He wants a loan to purchase  green tea leaf to add to what he gets from his garden for selling.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaf for reselling

loans.name: Mr. Sa Mon Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has eleven people who live in Chek village, Takeo province. Mr. Sa Mon P. is a village bank president who was born in 1960. He was selected by the other members, who will use their portion of their loan for different purposes. 

He and his wife, Mrs. Tem Koum, are farmers who own more than a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is a vice village chief, while his wife is a Khmer cake and congee seller. 

His problem is that his field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mr. Sa Mon P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. He is a father of four children, one of whom is a farmer, while the others are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras hace 10 años y lo que mas le agrada es la disciplina y las capacitaciones que recibe.
Filomena es viuda, tiene 7 hijos pero ahora vive solo con un N. que esta a su responsabilidad. Filomena viaja a las ferias D. donD. compra cereales, y luego los comercializa en un puesto del mercado mariscal Cáceres. Además Filomena se dedica a la agricultura D. papa, cereales en sus terrenos D. Matara. El deseo D. Filomena es ampliar su negocio.
Filomena necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quinua.
texts.en:
Filomena has been a member of the Communal Bank “Obreras” (Workers) for 10 years and what she likes most are the discipline of her group and the training that she receives. She is a widow with seven children, but now she lives alone with a grandson for whom she is responsible. Filomena travels to the fairs where she buys grains and later sells them at a stand at the Mariscal Cáceres Market. She also grows potatoes and grain on her land in Matara. Her wish is to expand her business.

Filomena needs a loan of 1000 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of quinoa.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Mrs. K., 37, is married with three young children. All of her children are no longer in school and have had different jobs. K. and her husband earn a living by cultivating crops on their own farmland. In addition to their farm work, K. also buys hair to resell to people who use it to decorate/highlight their hair. K. is requesting a loan to add to her personal savings to be able afford to buy a secondhand vehicle in order to make family transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand vehicle in order to make family transportation easier.

loans.name: Filadelfo Rigoberto

texts.es:
Filadelfo Rigoberto Barragán G. tiene 27 anos. Es soltero y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Filadelfo es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo.
Filadelfo se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos a su familia. Los cultivos que mas cultiva son el maíz, el frijol, el tomate y el trigo. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de San Pablo.  

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas. Con el apoyo del préstamo podra darles estudios a sus hijos. Su sueno para los proximo 5 anos es dar los estudios a sus hijos y comprar un terreno para construir una casa. Este ano, por el mal clima se enfermaron las plantas. Espera que el credito lo ayudara en recuperar este ano. 

Le gusta jugar el boli y salir de paseo con su familia.
texts.en:
Filadelfo Rigoberto Barragán G. is 27 years old, single, and lives in the San Miguel district in Bolívar province. He has two children. Filadelfo is a member of a group in the rural area of San Isidro, located an hour and a half from San Miguel. There are 10 group members and the majority of them work cultivating corn and wheat. Filadelfo works in agriculture to support his family. He mainly grows corn, beans, tomatoes and wheat. He buys and sells his produce in the San Pablo market.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the support of the loan he can give his children an education. His dream for next 5 years is to provide an education for his children and buy land to build a house. This year the weather harmed his crops. He hopes the loan will help him recover this year.

He likes to bowl and go out with his family.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary Q. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 32 years old. Rosemary is separated from her spouse and has one school-age child. To make a living, Rosemary owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community, like school supplies, spices, canned goods, noodles, first-aid medicine, simple beauty products, and snacks. Rosemary has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemary joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosemary is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosemary from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child who is not currently in school. Grace has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Grace hopes to build a house, and own a successful business.

Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge; el tiene 65 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la agricultura, el socio tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde siembran maíz, cebada, papa y habas y después lo vende en el mercado de Huancaro en la ciudad de Cusco, el socio quiere mejorar sus tierras de cultivo. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para las tierras de cultivo.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jorge, 65, is a member of the “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO” communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is single and has a son.  He’s a farmer.  He has a small plot where he grows corn, barley, potatoes and lima beans which he sells in the Huanaco Market in the city of Cusco.  

He wants to improve his lands and is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seed for his fields.

He thanks all those who are part of his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. is a widow  who lives in Common, Brgy. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Ocidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  selling coconut candy and a pig fattening business. She has 9 children who are 20 to 40 years old with 6 of her children having their own family while her other 3 children are working and helping out with some of the family needs.  

Elizabeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elizabeth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she could continue to save up for future house repairs and the family's needs. Elizabeth G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. is 30 years old and married to Ann. They have one child aged two years. John runs a small general store and a posho mill.He has been making good profits from both businesses and has plans for buying cereals and selling them at a profit.

John learned about Kadet through a friend and with this first loan he wants to buy an additional stock of cereals to ensure that his customers  needs are met especially during the festive season.

John plans to buy a car for taxi services to boost his income.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cereals

loans.name: Ntungamo Bakyara Tuhirirwe Group

texts.en:
B. Salvano is the leader of Ntungamo Bakyara Tuhirirwe in Ntungamo. He is 44 years old and married with five children.

Salvano is involved in the sale of vegetables, including dodo, tomatoes, eggplants and so on. He has been in this business for eight years. From this work, he is able to make a weekly profit of 80,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). (About $35 U.S. dollars a week.)

In addition, Salvano has a hotel business that contributes to his income. He was introduced to the business by a friend of his. Before this, he was only selling water for a living. 

Salvano is social and hardworking and he hopes to continue his children's education so that they may have a much brighter future. He needs a loan to be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetable gardens.

loans.use: Buying fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetable gardens.

loans.name: Víctor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo C. M. tiene 35 años, Es Soltero vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de  siembra de maíz, arroz.

Víctor Hugo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García en Zapotal y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una micro empresa.

Le gusta escuchar música y hacer deporte.
texts.en: Víctor Hugo C. M. is 35, single, and lives alone in the Ventanas Canton, in the Los Rios province. He has no children. The members of the community bank V.R.C. Nuevo Amanecer ["New Dawn"] are located in the San Luiz Zapotal district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This group of 12 members is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labours, sowing corn and rice. Victor Hugo works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He purchases his products in the Garcia Market in Zapotal and sells them in the same location. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for cultivation. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and climatic variability. His dream is to have a micro business. He enjoys listening to music and playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, seven of whom are in school. Teddy has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Teddy sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail.

Teddy has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more poultry feed and chicks. She also generates additional income through selling scrap. The main business challenge(s) for Teddy include thieves and transportation of chicken feed. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land where she can build more poultry houses. Teddy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and chicks.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre soltera D. 55 años D. edad que resiD. en el Sector LosAguilares; en el Distrito D. Pitipo, que pertenece a la Provincia D. Fereñafe, a menos D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la Región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en un puesto del mercado D. la zona donD. resiD.. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena sazón D. los platos que  prepara y a la buena atención que brinda. Con los ingresos obtenidos D. esta actividad, ella se encarga D. ayudar al sostenimiento económico D. su familia.

La creciente demanda ha hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio, queriendo adquirir mayor cantidad D. insumos que le permitan aumentar su capacidad D. producción. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles, con la finalidad D. satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is a 55 year old single mother who lives in the sector of Los Aguilares in the district of Pitipo, which is in the province of Fereñafe less than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the caiptal of the region of Lambayeque.  

She sells food at a stall in the market in the neighborhood where she lives.  The business is very well-received thanks to the good seasoning of the plates that she makes and the good service that she provides.  With the income from this activity, she helps to sustain her family economically. 

The growing demand has maD. her think about increasing her business, wanting to acquire greater quantities of ingredients that will allow her to increase her production capacity.   For this reason she thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles, with the end goal of satisfying her clients' demand.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Haja Saudatu

texts.en: Haja Saudatu is a 47 years old business woman. She is married, but has no children. In 1979, Haja Saudatu established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she believed the business could be a means of getting additional income for her family. She opens her business at 7am and closes by 6:30 pm every day. She makes about SLL 1,000,000 profit from her business every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Saudatu has a good credit history. She needs this loan to help her buy additional medical drugs for her pharmacy. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Haja Saudatu plans to open one or two outlets as a way of expanding her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Los Plata Group

texts.es:
El grupo los P. lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María Lourdes S. P. de 28 años quien desde muy pequeña junto con su mamá se dedica al comercio de candelas y veladoras por más de 12 años.   
Ella tiene la meta de terminar su carrera en Caja y Finanzas y poder terminar su cuarto por lo que ya compro los materiales pero necesita ahorrar para poder poner la mano de obra. 

Los otros integrantes son Reynaldo José P. de 70 años quien compra y vende ganado desde hace 36 años y Olga María P. quien vende de todo un poco.
texts.en:
The Los P. group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is María Lourdes S. P., who is 28 years old.  Since she was a young girl, she has worked with her mother selling candles.  She has been doing this for more than 12 years.  

Her goals are to finish her degree in finance and be able to finish her room.  She has already purchased the materials but now needs to save for the labor costs.  

The other members of the group are Reynaldo José P., who is 70 years old and has bought and sold cattle for 36 years, and Olga María Baltodano who sells a little of everything.

loans.use: To Purchase Candles

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly would like a loan to buy a plot of land.  She is a teacher by proffession and has been in service for three years .She has challenges of limited funds due to the high expenditure on rent and her dream is to build a house for residence and educate her children.

loans.use: Buying a plot of land

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes nació en la ciudad de Vilcabamba de la provincia de Convención del departamento del Cusco y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Lourdes vive en hermosa ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú) y se dedica a la venta de artesanía para turistas que visitan la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. Lourdes en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para una maquina tejedora para elabore mas chompas de lana de alpaca. 

Lourdes es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Lourdes was born in the city of Vilcabamba of the province of Convencion, Department of Cusco and is 38 years old. She is currently living in the beautiful Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru) and sells handicrafts to the tourists who visit the city. She has been doing this for 15 years with excellent results thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She is requesting the loan to buy a loom to make more alpaca woolen sweaters. Lourdes is a responsible person and is a member of the Communal Bank ‘Sumac Purisisun’ of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy a loom.

loans.name: Flor De Tuna Group

texts.es:
La señora Maribel Sánchez Pérez, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor  Moisés Estrada Estrada, con quien procreo cinco hijos de cuales dos ya estan casados y tres es tan bajo su responsabilidad.
   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  pollos de  granja para luego venderlo aliñado (destazado) en la misma localidad, con esta actividad lleva un años y cinco meses donde nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ello esta logrando solventar sus gastos generados en su hogar.
   Para iniciar esta actividad lo platico con su esposo para que juntos trabajen y  no se vean limitado con lo ingresos, así darle lo mas necesario  a sus tres hijos que están estudiando en secundaria y preparatoria, ella desea que terminen una carrera pra que tenga un mejor futuro.
   Lo que mas desea es que con el préstamo pueda apoyarse para incrementar más  su actividad y así estar trabajando hasta que dios le siga prestando vida. y sus dos compañeras mas son: Maria Guadalupe  quien invertira el prestamo en la compra de pollos para venderlo aliñado ( destazado), y la señora Carmela S. G. ella es la primera vez que solicita un prestamo y es para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
Maribel Sánchez Pérez lives in the state of Coapilla in Chiapas México.  She is married to Moisés Estrada Estrada, with whom she has five children, of which two are married and three are under her responsibility.

She requested a loan to invest in the purchase of farm chickens to later sell seasoned in cut up pieces in the same location.  This activity takes one year and five months.  She comments that this is fine as it covers her expenses generated at home.

She works together with her husband and their hopes are not limited to income.  The most important thing is that their three children, who are in middle school and high school, complete their schooling so that they have a better future.

Maribel's greatest wish is that the loan can help support them to further increase their activity and continue working, God willing.  Her two companions are: Maria Guadalupe, who will invest the loan to buy chickens to sell seasoned (cut up), and Carmela S. G., who is requesting a loan for the first time to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of chickens to later sell in cut up pieces and seasoned.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María  Estela López  M., es casada con el señor Jorge Amín López Velasco, con quien procreo  dos hijos Víctor Lenin  de doce años en sexto de primaria y Jennifer Jacqueline de  diez años en quinto de primaria.

      Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cosmético  de la marca  avon, en esta actividad lleva dos años  y seis meses, lo que nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ello también puede comprar materiales que la ayudan a elaborar piñatas ya que es con las dos actividades con laque se apoya para tener ingresos en su hogar.

      Su motivación a esta actividad es por la necesidad que hay en la economía de los gastos y desea apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos  a un que su familia es pequeña desea darle lo mejor.

      Su más grande deseo es que con sus dos actividades  sus ingresos sean cada día mas mejor, para apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y con ánimo puedan terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
María  Estela López  M. is married to Mr. Jorge Amín López Velasco with whom she has two children: Victor Lenin, 12 and in 6th grade and Jennifer Jacqueline, 10, in fifth grade.

She asked for the loan to invest in the purchase of Avon brand cosmetics.  She’s been in this line of work for two years and six months.  What she comments to us is that she does well because with it she can also buy supplies that help her make piñatas.  It is with both of these activities that she supports herself to have income for her home.

She was motivated into this activity because of economic need to cover expenses and she wants to help her husband with income.  Even though her family is small, she wants to give it the best.

Her greatest wish is that income from her two activities will be greater each day to support her children in their schooling with the aim of their finishing a career.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell in her community.

loans.name: Normaida

texts.es:
La señora Normaida,  vive en tecpatan estado de Chiapas México. Ella es casada  con el señor Luciano, con quien procreo seis hijos que  cuatro ya están casado y dos están siete años de edad.

   Ella es la segunda vez que solicita  el préstamo es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: aceite, carne, hoja de guineo, chile ancho  para la elaboración de tamales y luego venderlo en el mismo lugar. En esta actividad lleva  dos años y cuatro meses en donde comenta que la va bien ya que con ello está apoyando a sus hijos que están en la escuela.

   Para dedicarse a esta actividad  lo planeo con  su esposo para  que juntos trabajen  y les puedan dar lo más necesario a sus hijos  que aun están pequeños.

   Su más grande deseo  es salir adelante con su familia  y con su pequeña actividad.
texts.en:
Normaida lives in Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is married to Luciano, with whom she had six children; four are now married, and two are seven years of age.

This is the second time she requests a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as: cooking oil, meat, banana leaves, and chilies for making her tamales and selling them.  She has been carrying out this activity for two years and four months, and comments that things are going well as her business is helping her continue supporting her school-aged children.

She planned with her husband in order to dedicate herself to this business, so they could work together to provide for their children who are still young.

Her greatest wishes are to get ahead with her family and her business.

loans.use: buy the ingredients for making her tamales.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with seven children, 3 have graduated from school while 4 still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
 
For the past 7 years,  Mwanakombo has been operating a street food stall business.  She sells at the market to her neighbors  and passersby.  Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of owning a business premise in the future.

With this loan for 40,000 Kshs, Mwanakombo want to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour and rice

loans.name: Javier Coniglario

texts.es:
Javier Coniglario tiene 37 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Javier se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es terminar de educar a los hijos y aumentar la produccion.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del recinto y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Javier Coniglario is 37 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. They live in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

This communal bank is called Nuevo Horizonte (New Horizon). It is located in the Cachely Grande precinct, with belongs to the Ventanas canton. This communal bank is dedicated to agricultural work, with short term loans for planting corn, rice, and beans.

Javier works in agriculture, especially in planting corn, rice, and beans. He makes his purchases at Hermanos Olivos (Olivos Brothers) store every month and sells his products at the fair in the same town.

He is applying for the loan to buy seeds and compost for his fields. The loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He faces challenges such as diseases in his crops. His dream is to complete the education of his children and increase his production.

He likes to celebrate the fiestas of the district and play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost for his fields

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 32-year-old wife and the mother of three children. She has a full-time job as a school employee. Her husband, Bassam, found that she has artistic talent when it comes to arranging flowers and trees. He decided to work with her on developing this talent by encouraging her to start making flowers using plastic and metal materials. He is in charge of selling what she makes. Now Ibtisam and her husband have opened a flower shop that has been running successfully because of their hard work. Ibtisam has applied for this loan to add  natural flower arrangements to their shop.

Since Ibtisam is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: to buy natural flowers and plants for arrangements as a new service at their shop.

loans.name: Onabibi

texts.en:
Onabibi is very hardworking woman who tries to make money for her family by working hard everyday. About six years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This allows her to pay for the education of her three children, who have high hopes for the future. She raises young cattle and later sells them at the markets. She prepares them to be ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country. Since Onabibi aspires for a great future, she decided to expand her businesses with the sole purpose of improving her family's living conditions and to help pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase small cattle.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ciro; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de materiales de construcción, el vende cemento, arena y yeso, el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y también para comprar combustible para los carros que trasladan los materiales de construcción.
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ciro belongs to the Puntualito Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Ciro is 47 years old, has a life partner, and has three children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business of buying and selling construction materials.  He sells cement, sand, and plaster.  He works from 5:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  It is through this business that he gets his children ahead.  He wants to expand his business of selling construction materials.

He is requesting the loan to buy construction materials.  He will also buy fuel for the cars that transport the construction materials.

He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to buy fuel for the cars that transport the construction materials.

loans.name: Ines Cordero

texts.es:
Inés, tiene dos hijos de 26 y 31 años de edad, él administra una tienda, dicho negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, lo inicio junto a su esposa y juntos lo atienden todos los días de la semana de 7:00am a 3:00pm, este negocio lo tienen en el mercado municipal.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, arroz, frijoles, jabón y detergentes, su propósito es mejorar el negocio, surtirlo de productos que le ayuden a satisfacer la demanda y le provea mayores ingresos.
Su objetivo es mejorar la condición económica de su familia, cubriendo los gastos que se generan y encaminarse hacia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Inés has two children aged 26 and 31.  He manages a store, which he says is a business he has had for 10 years.  He started it with his wife, and together they serve in the store every day of the week from 7:00 am-3: 00pm.  This business is located in the municipal market.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of oil, rice, beans, soap and detergents.  His intent is to grow the business, stocking it with products that will help him to meet demand and provide greater income.

His goal is to improve economic conditions for his family, covering the expenses generated and to move towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 42 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y carismática, convive con su pareja, y con él tiene cuatro hijos, quienes ya son mayores de edad. Ahora solo vive ella y su pareja en casa de su madre. El trabajo de Vilma consiste en la venta de ropa, esta actividad lo hace en su casa y lleva ya trabajando así por casi un año, a veces espera a los clientes en su casa pero hay otras veces que sale a buscarlos entre sus vecinos y amigos. Trabaja sola, pues se siente mejor estar así sin tener que rendir cuentas a nadie, además el horario de trabajo lo elige ella, así administra su tiempo para realizar otras cosas. Hoy cuenta con muy buena cartera de clientes y espera por el momento mantenerse como hasta ahora. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta contenta con el grupo que conforma, ya que siempre se interesan por los demás. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para su posterior venta entre amigos, vecinos y familiares.
texts.en: Vilma is 42 years old and she is a happy, kind and charismatic woman. She live with her partner, and with him she has four children. Her children are all grown and she only lives with her partner now in her mother's house. Vilma's work consists of selling clothing, an activity she carries out from her house and she has been in business for almost a year. Sometimes she waits for clients in her house but other times she sets out to find them among her neighbors and friends. She works independently and she is more comfortable this way because she doesn't have to answer to anyone. She can also choose her own schedule, managing her time to do other things. Today she has a good roster of clients and she hopes to maintain it for the time being. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is happy with her group because they always show interest in others. with the funds requested she will purchase merchandise to later sell among her friend, neighbors, and family.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a hardworking businesswoman, age 27. She is married and blessed with one child. 

She has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to access financial resources, hence improving her business.  

In the next five years, she wants to become financially stable. Her dream is transform her business to wholesale. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar.

loans.use: To buy sugar for resale.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel lives comfortably in Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan with his wife and children. The couple was blessed with eight children. Three of them have their own families, and five are still attending school. With his children's eagerness and interest to study, it makes him work harder to provide them with a good education. Ariel has operated his motorcycle transportation business for almost 10 years. This is what occupies his daily schedule from 8am to 5pm. He usually earns about 300 PHP each day. 

He wants to improve his services, which is why he is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP. He will use the money to pay for franchise renewal and to purchase paint and side mirrors for his motorcycle. With the help of this loan, he will continue to operate the motorcycle in good condition. He would also ensure the safety of his passengers and himself.

Ariel would like to continue to provide an education for his children. He wants them to have successful lives and to pursue their chosen careers someday.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal, buy paint and side mirrors for his motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 27-year-old married man with two children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His major dream is to see all his children go through higher education. He sells used clothes, a business he has carried out for the last seven years. He complains of irregular sales due to the rainy season and his dream is to own a boutique. John needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Deysi Sofia

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz en el distrito de Paijan, una zona agrícola y ganadera que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares. También vende bebidas y golosinas para tener otro ingreso para su casa.

Deysi desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza, bebidas, golosinas y para cubrir algunos gastos personales y así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Deysi is 28 years old.  She is married, and lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has only electricity (no running water).  They live in the district of Paijan, which is an agricultaral and livestock area which is part of La Libertad department.

She works selling cosmetics from a catalog, which she sells to her friend and neighbors.  She strives daily to gain more customers as the more orders she places to the company she buys her products from, the more income she will earn.  Her business helps her to cover her costs and family necessities.  She also sells drinks and candies to earn more income for her household.

Deysi wants to expand her business by purchasing more beauty products, drinks, and candy, and being able to cover some personal expenses. In this way her customers will have products in their hands' reach, and won't have to wait for the end of the month which is when she delivers the orders.

To achieve this goal, she has seen fit to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 New Soles.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, drinks, and candy, and to cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Elvie has a shop that sells accessories, toys and clothing. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy stocks of accessories, toys and clothing. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of accessories, toys and clothing

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.He is 32-years-old, married and has two children.

Saddam has been the owner of a food market since 2000. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items.He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to repair and fix his market’s floor and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to repair and fix his market’s floor and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Andrea De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Andrea De Jesús tiene 59 años de edad, es Viuda y madre de 4 hijos que viven con ella, su actividad principal es la caficultura, lo que ha sido durante muchos años la fuente de ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos.
Doña Andrea de Jesús utilizara el credito para obtener su propio panel solar, ya no quiere seguir alumbrándose con candiles ni candelas que es de la única forma que se ha alumbrado toda su vida, tambien desea aprovechar mas las noches para realizar los que haceres de la casa, desea comprar un tv para tener entretenimiento y asi pasar mas tiempo juntos con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea De Jesús is 59 years old, widowed, and the mother of four children who live with her. Her main business activity is growing coffee. For many years this has been the source of income by which she is able to support her children.

Doña Andrea de Jesús will use this loan to obtain her own solar panel system. She does not want to continue using oil lamps and candles since these have been the only source of light that she has used her entire life. Andrea also wants to make the most of her evenings so that she can perform household chores. She also wants to buy a TV for entertainment and as a means of spending more time with her children.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel system.

loans.name: Amalfi

texts.es: Amalfi, de 59 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Su dedicación a la agricultura es sorprendente, todas las mañanas desde muy temprano cuida de sus cultivos de maíz, papa y alcachofa, le va muy bien en su trabajo. Sobre todo en sus cultivos de alcachofa, que son bien cotizados en el mercado, pues es uno de los alimentos que se exporta a otros países; asiendo que sus cosechas sean compradas mucho antes de ser cosechadas, eso le ayuda a tener la estabilidad económica que necesita. Además cuida de animales como ovejas y cuyes los cuales cría para luego vender a los carniceros, que la visitan su casa con frecuencia. Ahora ella desea juntar dinero para tener más terrenos agrícolas y así sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Amalfi de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias ovejas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Amalfi, 59, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children, who she cares for in her own home, located in Ataura. Her dedication to farming is surprising: very early every day, she cares for her crops of corn, potatoes and artichokes. Things are going very well for her in her work, especially with regards to her artichoke crops. Her artichokes are well sought-after in the market, since this is one of the foods that is exported to other countries. As a result, her harvests are purchased well before they are harvested which helps her have the financial stability that she needs.

Additionally, she cares for animals such as sheep and guinea pigs which she raises to sell to butchers, who visit her at her home frequently. Now she would like to raise some money to have more land for farming and, subsequently, plant more to obtain better results. She belongs to the “Hacienda” Communal Bank and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She appreciates the support of all of you because it makes it possible for her to continue with her work. She also promises to be punctual with her repayments, since she likes working with responsible, supportive people. When Amalfi receives the loan, she will invest the money requested in the purchase of several sheep for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 23 years old and single. She is the mother of one child who is five years old.
 
She has been in the tailoring business for the last three years and earns a monthly profit of KES 6,000.  

She has applied for her third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd. She plans to use the loan to buy a modern sewing machine.

The anticipated profits she will save and use to provide the basic needs of her family. Lucy hopes to grow her business and open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Savoeuy's Group

texts.en:
Savoeuy, 26, is married with one son who is in primary school. He is a peasant living in a rural village located in the Ratanak Mondul district. He plants red maize to make a living, and sometimes he works for others for additional income. 

After his first loan with VisionFund, Savoeuy and his group members (who have been with VisionFund from one to four years) are now applying for another loan. He wants to use this loan to pay for labor to harvest his maize. He hopes to increase his maize crop and also to sell it for a good price. He wants to generate a better income to improve his family's standard of living and also to keep his son in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest his maize

loans.name: Saira Eveling

texts.es:
Saira Eveling tiene 21 años es casada, vive con el eposo no tiene hijos. Vive en el Recinto América  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Saira se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 4 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Saira Eveling is 21 years old and married.  She lives with her husband, and has no children.  She lives in the América district, in the Ventanas canton.

The communal bank "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" ["United We Will Overcome"] is located in the América district, which is part of the Ventanas canton.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Saira has been working in agriculture growing corn for the last four years.  She purchases her supplies in Ventanas, and sells her products in the the market there.

The requested loan is for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The loan will help her to increase her income for use by her family  and for investment.  Her dream is to buy a home.

In her free time, she enjoys watching television and playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.

loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Oanh was born in 1976. She lives in Dan Di village. She is a member of Dan Di cluster. Her husband is a taxi driver. He has income. She has two children. Mrs Oanh has a restaurant. She sells breakfast. She has had this job for 4 years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2010. The last time she borrowed 5,886,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy chairs and a desk for her restaurant. She is the leader of 7-member group loan in SEDA. 
 about other borrowers in her group loan:
 Tinh is 53 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to buy cloths to make curtains.
 Huong is 2 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to small business.
 Ha is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to expand her mobile shop.
 Lu is 35 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to buy pictures to sell.
 Suot is 60 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to small business.
 Yen is 28 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy more grocery to sell.

loans.use: to buy chairs and a desk for her restaurant

loans.name: Mariecho

texts.en: Mariecho is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a food and retail shop (sari-sari store) where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Mariecho became a member of HSPFI this year, 2013. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ife De Houekehonou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE DE HOUEKEHONOU composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Colette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 28 ans. Colette est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Séraphin. Le couple a cinq enfants, scolarisés et à leur charge. Colette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Colette vend du pain dans sa région depuis dix ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Colette s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Colette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe IFE DE HOUEKEHONOU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du pain.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 38 years old. She is married and they are blessed with three children. Her business is selling clothes. She has been in the business for eight years. 

She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy clothes for selling.

She will use the profits from expanded business educate her children and invest back into the business to boost it.Her hopes and dreams are to be successful in her life.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She plans to buy more stock, especially soft drinks, cereals and other foodstuff

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif K. is 30. He is married and has 4 children. Since he is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorny-Karabakh, life is difficult for him. In 2001, he applied for a $1,200 loan. To cover needs, Mr. Kahlilov now wants to buy one additional cow and a calf.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Ndoh Vincent

texts.en:
Ndoh Vincent has been of great help to his family who look up to him as their provider. Even though he is unmarried and has no children of his own, his late younger brother left behind three children to care for. As an unemployed man, he found it difficult to provide for the children's basic needs so he sought help from GHAPE and was trained in business skills. He has already received loans up to $1,000 to pay for the children's education.

He is now requesting a loan of $1,200 with which he will buy and fatten pigs and goats to be sold for meat to restaurants. He plans to repay his loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, pig feed, goats

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Chuon learned to weave from her neighbor in 1987, and then she started her own business weaving silk at home.

Her husband is a director of the primary school in the community. He also plants vegetables in the village in his free time. They were married in 1978 and have 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she requests a loan of $700. She will use this money to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on her loom. She will use some of the money to buy pesticide fertilizer for her husband's farm.

loans.use: Purchase silk supplies, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Ms. Julia R. is 68 years old and living in a small house in the city of Mariano Roque Alonson with her daughter. Years ago, Julia took a class in party planning and decoration where she learned how to prepare for celebrations such as birthdays or weddings. She makes bags and wallets that are often used for large parties or festivals as prizes for various games and contests.

Julia learned to use recycled material such as, cardboard or magazines in addition to yarn, to make these items. Julia can make imitations of nearly any type of wallet. Often she lines her crafts with magazines pages that have pictures of famous people of Paraguay or other parts of the world. She uses the wallets that her daughter or she buys at the market as models for her own creations. She chooses the type of wallet that attracts the most attention and then designs them using paper. Later she gives them the form of their respective materials.

With the credit that she is asking, Julia, is preparing for a well-known Paraguayan holiday, the Festival of Caacupe which is on the 8th of December which takes place in the city of Caacupe.

loans.use: purchase material to make wallets and bags.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Sela is forty years of age from the village of Aele. She has eight children. Four on them are working at the time, and the other four are attending school. She works three days a week weeding the grass, and she sells her product once a week. She also receives remittances from her working children and some from her relatives overseas. This is her first loan and she is using it to maintain her plantation business. She is hard-working and her dream in the future is to be successful with the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her peanut plantation

loans.name: Consuelo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Consuelo del Carmen L. has worked for 6 years renting sanitary services in the market of Israel Lewites in Managua. She started her business because the income of her husband did not cover with the needs of the home, since they have three children and must provide for their health and education.

Upon arriving at the market Israel Lewites, she encountered a very disorderly location for which she requested the respective permissions to remodel the restrooms little by little. As of today she has completed loans with Ceprodel which have benefited her directly in that she has remodeled the locations, has bought new toilets, has bought liquids such as disinfectants and chlorine and at the same time has acquired small barrels to store water.

Her goal that has been presented is to continue working hard to achieve so that her three children can complete their studies and become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Consuelo del Carmen L. desde hace 6 años se dedica al alquiler de servicios sanitarios en el mercado de Israel Lewites en Managua. Inició su negocio debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no cubrían con las necesidades del hogar ya que tienen tres hijos a los que deben brindar salud y educación.

Al llegar al mercado Israel Lewites se encontró con un local muy desaseado por lo que solicitó los respectivos permisos para remodelar poco a poco los baños sanitarios. Hoy en día ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel los cuales le han beneficiado directamente por lo que ha remodelado el local, ha comprado nuevos inodoros, ha comprado líquidos tales como desinfectantes y cloro y a la vez ha adquirido pequeños barriles para almacenar agua.

Su meta que se ha planteado es seguir trabajando fuertemente para lograr que sus tres hijos puedan llegar a culminar sus estudios y ser profesionales de éxito.

loans.use: To buy toilet paper and disinfectants.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. is business oriented, she sells building & furniture materials in her locality. She has been operating her business since 1996. She solicits for the loan of $450 to buy more building & furniture materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more building & furniture materials for sale

loans.name: Sout

texts.en:
Mrs. Sout C., 37, works selling groceries at her house, earning around $13 a day in revenue. Her husband supports the family income as a mechanic (motorbike) and makes about $8 a day of income. They have four children, three of whom are students and one who stays at home.

To expand the business, this couple is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more grocery products and mechanic tools. (Her husband and the youngest daughter are pictured becuase Mrs. Sout C. was not available).

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and mechanic tools.

loans.name: Sada's Tusaidiane Group

texts.en:
Sada is 32 years old and is married with 3 children. Her children are 13, 9 and 7 years old. Sada is a charcoal seller. She started her business in 2002. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanahawa, who has a business dealing in market sales

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Her husband’s earnings as a construction laborer are insufficient to cover the family’s expenses. Therefore she also has to work. Her daily activity is being a massage therapist. She serves nearby patient or customers who frequents her services. As her place of providing her services is far, she has to get there. Currently she for constrained by transportation. Her plan is to use this loan overcome the transportation constrains and purchase massage supplies such as oils. Her family’s condition is healthy. Currently she lives with her husband and 3 children in Denpasar.
