Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Penghasilan suaminya sebagai buruh bangunan tidak cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Karena itu dia uga ikut bekerja. Kegiatan sehari-harinya adalah sebagai tukang pijat. Dia berkeliling kuntuk melayani pasien atau pelangggannya yang sering menggunakan jasanya. Karena tempat pelanggannya jauh, dia sulit untuk menjangkaunya. Saat ini dia terkemdala untuk transportasi. Rencananya pinjaman kali ini akan dipakai sebagai biaya transport dan beli bahan-bahan untuk pijat seperti minyak. Keadaan keluarganya sehat. Saat ini dia tingal bersama suami dan ketiga anaknya di Denpasar.

loans.use: For Commute and Purchase Massage Oils (Untuk Transport dan Membeli Minyak Pijat)

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is 32 years old and married. His business is located in his home in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, Sololá, Guatemala, and thanks to his efforts to get ahead and his positive attitude in the community he is now a well known and appreciated merchant in his area. Previously he had been a farm hand, working in the fields for different people, and with his hard work he was able to purchase land and cultivate bananas and coffee. Thanks to his harvests he's been able to start a small business buying and selling bananas and coffee, but he does not have the necessary capital at the moment to continue the business. For that reason he came to the offices of Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR to request a loan so he will be better able to serve his customers and differentiate from the competition. He only wants to continue growing his business and to be able to improve the quality of life for his family. His business currently employs two workers, so it can improve the quality of their families' lives as well.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don Manuel tiene actualmente 32 años de edad, es Casado, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en la Aldea Chuisanto Tomás, del municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, y gracias a sus esfuerzos para seguir adelante y su actitud positiva en la comunidad ahora ya es un comerciante muy conocido y apreciado en la Aldea, ya que antes era un jornalero para realizar trabajos de campo con diferentes personas en la aldea, y con sus esfuerzos para seguir adelante consiguió comprar terreno y los cultivó de banano y café, gracias a sus cosechas que recibe de parte de su terreno logró iniciar un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de banano y café, por tal razón que no cuenta con el capital necesario para seguir dicho negocio se vio en la necesidad de acudir en las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, para poder dar una mejor atención a la clientela y así poder hacer diferencia con la competencia, y solo así poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y poder dar mejores condiciones de vida para su familia. Actualmente cuenta con 2 empleados en su negocio de compra de banano y café la cual ha generado oportunidades de trabajo, como también a que la familias de los empleados tengan una mejor condición de vida.

loans.use: Buying and selling of bananas and coffee / Capital de trabajo, Compra y Venta de banano y café

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María is a humble housewife who dedicated her time to construction work, working without concern for how hard and tiring this activity is. She does this because one has to put everything else aside when you have a sick child in the house and must pay for their treatment and medicine. For María, the day that her son suffered an accident in her house was the start of many long days of concern and expensive treatments. Her son now requires a CT scan and for this María works hard to save enough money for her son's CT scan. María believes that this additional work will earn enough money to cover her son's treatment expenses. Support María so that her work is prosperous and makes the money that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Doña María es una humilde madre de familia que dedica su tiempo en obras de construcción, trabaja sin importarle lo duro y cansado que pueda ser esta actividad, y lo hace porque todo queda de lado cuando se tiene un niño enfermo en casa y hay que pagar los tratamientos y medicinas. Para María, el día en que su hijo sufrió un accidente en su propia casa fue el comienzo de muchos días llenos de preocupación y costosos tratamientos. Su hijo requiere ahora de una tomografía, por ello que María trabaja duramente para ahorrar el dinero suficiente para la tomografía de su hijo. María confía que son esta labor adicional pueda completar los gastos del tratamiento de su hijo. Apoya a María para que su actividad sea próspera y obtenga buenas ganancias, tan necesarias para ella.

loans.use: Capital investment to purchase clothing to sell in areas near her home

loans.name: Baroat

texts.en:
Baroat R. is 45 years old. She’s married with two children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 10 years she has been purchasing young cattle in the local market to fatten and sell in local markets.

Baroat is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home.

Baroat wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved mother. Thanks to this activity she is supporting her children with education.

Baroat wants to keep on educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves.

With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) with a term of 12 months to buy a calf in order to expand her business and to improve the living conditions of the family. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle to fatten and re-sell

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 15 and 4 years old. She has been a potato seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Arafa is now looking for a loan to buy more potatoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for her business

loans.name: Dina Laura

texts.es:
La señora Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Jr. Copaiba Mz. 6 Lt. 1, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años y es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja en el Poder Judicial, Dina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir con la venta de productos UNIQUE. 

En la actualidad ella continúa con el negocio de venta de UNIQUE, y trabaja como docente de la especialidad de matemática.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2.300, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá comprando productos de bellezas. 

Dina se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos y agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the “Juan Zaplana Belliza” Communal Bank, located at Jr. Copaiba Mz. 6 Lt. 1, Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali department. She is 24 years old, mother to 1 young child who is still dependent on her, she’s married, and her husband works in the judicial system. With her first loan Dina received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 she decided to invest in and sell UNIQUE products. Today she continues with her business selling UNIQUR, and works as a math teacher. With this loan for S/. 2.300, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in buying beauty products. Dina is very content for the opportunity provided by Manuela Ramos and thanks God for giving her life and health.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Eruchalu

texts.en: Eruchalu O.  sells upholstery materials. He says that this business is a lucrative one. O. is 27 years old and he is single. He travels to Onitsha's main market to purchase upholstery materials to sell in Benin City. He needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more upholstery materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more upholstery materials to sell

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun K. is a farmer in Neil village in TaK. Province.  She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.  

On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil, affects her crop badly.  In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive. 

Mrs. Moeun K. is a 49-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another is a worker, and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor R. was born in 1968 and lives in Phsar Leu Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the mother of four children. Two of her children attend the local school while the others stay at home because they are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Em Pao, is a motorbike taxi driver.  

Mrs. Sor R. sells fish at the market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to purchase more fish to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to re-sell

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn C. is a villager in Sras Pring village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Because her field is infertile, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and thereby increase her yield. Additionally, she would use the rest of the loan to dig a well for her family's use. Mrs. Hoeurn C. is 51 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a tractor driver, three are employed in a garment factory, and the youngest is a cook. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and dig a well.

loans.name: Ghislain

texts.fr: Mr A. Ghislain est né à Goumoukopé le 07/10/1977. Résidant à Kpémé, il est marié et père de quatre 04 enfants. En plus de ces derniers il à quatre 04 personnes à charge. M Ghyslain fait le commerce  de produits de premières nécessités depuis neuf (09) ans. Il dispose lui même d'une boutique et sa clientèle ne cesse d'augmenter. Pour faire face à la demande grandissante de sa clientèle, il sollicite un financement. Les revenus tirés de ce projet l’aideront à améliorer sa  situation familiale.
texts.en:
Mr Ghislain A. was born in Goumoukopé on October 7, 1977. Residing in Kpémé, he is married and the father of 4 children. Besides these, he has four other dependents as well. Ghislain has been selling staple goods for 9 years. He owns his own shop and his clientele is continuing to grow. To cope with the increasing demand from his customers, he is requesting a loan. The income from this increased capital will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staples

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna F. is a 30-year-old trader; she is single and the mother of two children. Both her children are in school. She resides at Bekwai in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

She is a very resourceful single mother whose hard effort brings livelihood for the family. Mamuna supports her kids through the sale of clothing and fried yams. She sells garment cloths and lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, Mamuna buys only a little stock of lace materials and garments cloth and sells through hawking. For this reason, she is requesting loan support for her business to make her business progress. She sells fried yams just in front of a store in the community where she lives.

She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of lace materials, garment cloths, and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Soyeya’ which means ‘Love’. She hopes to receive GHS 900 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk, yams, cooking oil, and fish etc.

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Amparo G. se dedica a su actividad de venta de comestibles como lo son galletas y confites siendo vendidos por ella misma a la intemperie y en ocasiones ambulantemente.

A pesar de que su actividad es muy agitada, ella siempre dedica su tiempo a trabajar arduamente y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel ya que requiere la compra de los productos y para ello ha solicitado un crédito para obtener dichos productos que requiere con urgencia.
texts.en:
In the city of Leon, Amparo Gonzalez operates a business selling, among other things, snacks and confectionery. She works in all kinds of weather, sometimes as a street vendor. Despite the hectic pace of the work, she always keeps at it, day and night. She's approached Ceprodel because she urgently needs to buy more products to sell and she's applied for a loan to get them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Pamela Atieno

texts.en:
Pamela Atieno O. is a 30-year-old mother of three children. The oldest is 14 while the twins are 8. She is married to a primary school teacher. She lives and works in Kasawino as a tailor.

This is her second loan, though her first with K-MET, and she is going to use it to buy more materials for her shop.

Pamela recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Tailoring materials

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Sarah has been a soap seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. She works at her business for 12 hours a day.
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap for resale. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.
Sarah is married, and has five children: ages 35, 30, 27, 25 and 16. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Nyambilila, who has her own small business selling fish in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more soap for resale

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es:
La señora María M. posee su propio negocio de venta de queso en su establecimiento en el Mercado Mayoreo donde ofrece el queso a sus clientes. 

Es de importancia destacar que ella es una dama que ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por medio de los créditos para el mejoramiento de su negocio y hoy en día una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito para la compra del queso y así continuar comercializándolo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. has her own business selling cheese at her stand in the Wholesale Market where she offers cheese to her customers. It is important to note that she is a woman who has been successful getting ahead thanks to the support Ceprodel has provided by means of loans to improve her business. Today she has come to Ceprodel to request a new loan for the purchase of cheese in order to continue selling it through her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: Osim

texts.ru:
MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


 Ахмедов Осим мужчина, занимающийся продажей мужской обуви. Он торгует на рынке Худжанда. Все свои кредиты он использует на увеличение ассортимента товаров. Он продаёт модную мужскую обувь. Для завоза летней мужской обуви он решил получить повторный кредит. Его удовлетворяют все условия организации «Арванд».
texts.en:
Osim A. is a man who sells mens shoes. He sells on the market of Khudjand. He uses all his loans to increase the variety of his inventory. The shoes which he sells are modern. To bring in summer shoes he decided to take out another loan. He is very satisfied with the terms of Arvand organization.

MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of mens shoes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Greetings from N. Jane, a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children aged 8, 5, 2 years old. She lives in Nyarugenge district in Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur has a stall selling paint in Kimironko sector; she is requesting her first loan of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company, the partner of World Vision Rwanda.

Jane has an experience of 7 years and employs one person in the business. Before getting the loan, Jane earned a monthly profit of $95 US and she hopes to have much profit after getting the loan because she will satisfy the needs of her customers. With the expected loan, this entrepreneur will buy more products and with the increased profit she will continue to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị S. (1303031067), a 56-year-old married mother of five adult-aged children, lives in the town of Hưng Nguyên where she owns and operates a business raising water buffalo for sale. Mrs. S. has been engaged in this activity for over 20 years, earning approximately 2000000 VND a month.

In 2002, Mrs. S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she is now requesting a new loan of 11000000 VND to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be Mrs. S.'s sixth from TYM Fund, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Grace Wambui

texts.en: Grace Wambui M. is 59 years old. She is married to Bernard M. and they have three children. Her business is located along Nangili centre in Eldoret Town. Grace has been in her business for the past eight years and was introduced to KADET by a group member. With the loan from KADET, she intends to buy more stock of cereals and tomatoes for her food store. She wants to grow her business to become a large wholesale store and to diversify. With increased income, she hopes to educate her children to higher levels. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To procure more cereals and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en:
Jumoke is 35 years old and married with three children. The family is based in Lagos.

Jumoke sells provisions and children’s wear and has been in this business for the past three years. Whatever her husband provides for the home she adds to from her profit to make sure it’s enough for the family to feed, clothe, pay house rent and look after aged parents.

Jumoke joined LAPO two years ago. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase children’s wear to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase children’s wear to sell

loans.name: Jerisa

texts.en:
Jerisa B., a 49-year-old woman, is widowed and has five children, all in school. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and firewood and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Eliah's Group

texts.en: W. Eliah is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 45 years old and married with 6 children and all still in school as he takes care of other orphans. She is a business man involved in the stone quarrying business in Katikolo for 4 years and able to make 25,000/= as profits a week. Eliah says that the main challenge with his business is the climate change, mostly the rainy season that deters him to work best. He has a plan of getting more capital to be able to buy another piece of land from where he can quarry more stones for sell. He hopes that with this expansion, he will be able to more than double his profits.

loans.use: Buying a land to be used for stone quarrying.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur N. is 21 years old. In spite of the fact that he does not yet have his own family, he is supporting his parents.

Teymur sells different kinds of foodstuffs and has been in this business already for four years. This activity generates the main income for the family.

As long as Teymur is very popular in the market by selling fresh and tasty pastries, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today, he requests 1607 AZN to increase the variety of goods that he sells.

With your help, Teymur will be able to make his business succeed and, in the nearest future, to have his own family.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods he sells

loans.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es: Maura del Socorro está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, trabaja como docente en la escuela Enmanuel Mongalo y Rubio, tiene 3 hijos la mayor se desempeña como docente, la otra estudia en la Universidad Uraccan y el niño menor que estudia su cuarto grado de educación primaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el cual es un hombre trabajador que apesar de la dura situacion economica siempre esta apoyando a su familia se desempeña como director de un colegio,Maura es una mujer responsable y trabajadora,se siente agradecida con l AFODENIC pues con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su vivienda, sueña con tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones y trabajo para así sacar a su familia adelante,,
texts.en:
Maura del Socorro is asking for her fifth loan to improve her house. She works as a teacher at the Enmanuel Mongalo y Rubio School. She has three children. The oldest works as a teacher, the other attends the Uraccan University, and the youngest is in the fourth grade. She has her husband’s support. In spite of the hard economic situation, he is a hard-working man who always supports his family. He is the principal of a school. Maura is a hard-working and responsible woman. She is grateful to AFODENIC. With the previous loans she has improved her house. She dreams of having a house in better condition and having work to get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in a floor and plaster the house

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.en: Elmaddin S. is a 27-year-old young entrepreneur who has been selling different kinds of food products in the grocery store for the last eight years. He is married and has two children. Elmaddin lives in one house with his parents and supports them financially. Being in this business for a long time, Elmaddin learned the market and his customers and he knows very well how to attract people to his store. Good location, friendly smile and accuracy on the shelves are the keys to a successful business.  Now Elmaddin requests 1606 AZN to enlarge his business and purchase more merchandise. We believe clear vision, experience and deep knowledge of the market will help Elmaddin to succeed in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina T. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Puleia. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Tina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Tina has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tina is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Tina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Perla's Group

texts.en:
Perla O. is from the village of La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Perla is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Perla is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Perla has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 80,000 PHP per crop for these activities.

In 2008, Perla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase some hogs to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise and sell

loans.name: Ispandiyar

texts.en:
Ispandiyar Q. is a responsible father of five children. From the time he was a young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales.

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Ispandiyar hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of four members who all live in Sarei Sambath village in Kandal Province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.
Mrs. Kosal S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She is a widow with one child who is enrolled in the local public school. Kosal is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In addition to this job, she is employed in a garment factory. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Kosal S. has applied for a loan to hire laborers to harvest her rice.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Wellingtone

texts.en: Wellingtone is a 25 year old single man.  He runs a printing and stationary shop named Tenark Enterprises in a very competitive environment.  He has one employee.  Previously, he was employed as a cashier in a hotel.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered and also has had an opportunity to interact with other business people and share business ideas.  He is requesting for a Kes. 50,000 loan from Faulu Kenya to buy a computer and a printer. He hopes to grow his business and create employment for other people.  He describes himself as humble and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en:
Nahashon is 26 years old.  He has been operating a boda-boda (transports people and light goods in town using a bicycle) in the town of Naivasha since 2004.  

He wants to start another business where he repairs broken bicycles and so a friend advised him to join an existing KADET loan group. This will be his first loan. 

His future plans is to increase his bicycle repair business, sell spare parts and also start selling both motorcycles and bicycles.

loans.use: To open a bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José tiene 44 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, además de hacer esto el ofrece el servicio de transporte de taxi, pero ayuda a ofrecer los productos. Por lo que su mayor interés es como padre responsable es ofrecer lo necesario para su familia. el ya ha tenido varios financiamientos con Fundación los que han sido de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su mayor deseo es ser el propietario de una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Francisco Jose is 44 years old. He sells general merchandise, and in addition to this he has a taxi that he uses to provide transportation services and also uses to sell his products. His interest as a responsible parent is to provide what is necessary for his family. He has already had various financings with the Fundación that have been a great help in getting his business to succeed. This financing will be used as working capital to buy products. His main wish is to be the owner of a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy products

loans.name: Josiah Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the J. Group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesswomen who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person. With the help of this loan, these small-scale businesswomen will be able to expand their businesses. Consequently, they can make more sales so that their living standard will improve.

The leader of this group is 34-year-old Isatu J.. Isatu, who was born in Magburaka, is married to a lorry driver and they have 3 children. Isatu makes a living through selling dried fish. She has been in this business for quite a number of years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy baskets full of dried fish.

loans.use: Buy baskets full of dried fish

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Antonio P., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como Vigilante, es casado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolares,  habita en el barrio La Florida.
	
El señor Roberto Antonio P., solicito el crédito para mejorar su casa ya que se acerca el invierno y desea asegurar a su familia para no mojarse.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Antonio P. works for the Chinandega mayor's office, as a security guard. He is married and has two school-aged children. The neighborhood where they live is called La Florida. He is requesting this loan in order to improve his house, since winter is approaching and he wishes to keep his family safe and dry.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement and cinder blocks, and to pay for manual labor

loans.name: We Are Blessed #2 Group

texts.en:
Tutu L. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called We Are Blessed #2 Group. She is 29 years old, is married, and has five children. She did not have the opportunity to go school. In the photo, she is the one holding the sign.

For nine years Tutu has been selling used clothes at the Pipelines community in Paynesville, Liberia. She renders good services to her customers which makes them keep returning. She started selling with a small amount of funds borrowed from her savings club but faces problems with having insufficient capital for her business which gives her a small problem.

Tutu plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used clothes to sell. Her goal is to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita T. is from the village of Annafunan West, Tuguegarao City. She is 47 years old. Agapita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Agapita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Agapita is just starting this business.

Agapita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agapita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Agapita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jewelie

texts.en:
Jewelie is an expert baker, with over 13 years of experience in the trade. In particular, everyone loves her gluten-free Brazilian cheese bread (“pao de quijo”), which she learned to make as a high school exchange student in Brazil.  After years of urging from friends and family, Jewelie finally decided to start a business to sell her famous bread.  To build a strong foundation for the new enterprise, Jewelie enrolled in a six-week business planning program at Mercy Corps Northwest in Portland, Oregon.

As laid out in the business plan that she developed with the help of her Mercy Corps trainer, Jewelie plans to sell the bread frozen to both wholesale and retail customers. In the meantime, she has been diligently building her network and generating buzz around the product. With a commercial lease, licenses, and a strong network in place, Jewelie now needs funds to purchase equipment (e.g., mixer, freezers, etc.), packaging, and a computer. Because its loan fund was fully deployed, Mercy Corps referred Jewelie to ACCION USA, where she was approved for a $9,000 loan. 

We at ACCION USA look forward to watching her business grow (not to mention to sample her bread!).

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.




Important Information About This Loan
Kiva realizes that access to credit is a challenge for entrepreneurs everywhere. Kiva started out as a website focused on developing-world entrepreneurs. In June 2009, Kiva began experimenting with allowing entrepreneurs in the United States to raise money on its website. If this is something you support, please feel free to fund this loan. If you have questions, including how an entrepreneur in your neighborhood might get a loan, please visit our Help Center and click on "Loans in the United States."

loans.use: To purchase equipment, packaging, and a computer

loans.name: Imara Yaoska

texts.es: La señora Imara Yaoska tiene 26 años de edad, es ama de casa muy dedicada su familia, pero que también se dedica a un negocio que sabe que le reporta beneficios económicos para salir adelante con su familia. Su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, por eso dedica tiempo para todo lo que ama, su familia, su trabajo, su casa y para ella misma. tambien se dedica a la venta de cd, en su vivienda pues tiene que diversificar sus ingresos. Para ella el mayor sueño es seguir y seguir con su negocio, sabe que trabajando y esforzándose conseguirá lo que tanto ansia, confía en la Fundación, por eso no se rinde en el trabajo. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicita es con el fin de comprar materia prima y entregar los pedidos que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Señora Imara Yaoska is 26 years old, a homemaker and very dedicated to her family. But she is also dedicated to her business, which she knows yields the profits that allow her to improve her family's situation. Her business is selling clothing and cosmetics. She sets aside time for everything she loves, her family, her work, her home and for herself. She also sells CDs from here home to diversify her income. Imara's greatest hope to keep her business going. She knows that by working and putting forth the effort, she will get what she so longs for. She places her trust in Fundación, which is why she doesn't give up on her work. She is requesting the financing to purchase raw materials and to deliver the orders that she currently has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
En el barrio Francisco Reyes  de Somotillo La señora Norma Isabel C. D. se desempeña como Maestra de educación secundaria en el Instituto Alfonso Cortez De la Ciudad de Somotillo.
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado para la compra de  materiales de construcción cemento y bloques para la construcción de una pared divisoria en su casa de habitación.
Este es el tercer crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que el primeros créditos la beneficio para empezar a construir su casa de habitación y hoy ella la esta acondicionando.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel C. D. is a secondary school teacher at Alfonso Cortez Institute located in Somotillo’s Francisco Reyes neighborhood. She tells us that the loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies like cement and concrete blocks to build a dividing wall in her home. This is the 3rd loan she has requested from us and she tells us that she used the first loans to start building her house and now she is furnishing it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita B.'s main source of income comes from selling peanut butter. She is 43 years old, married and has one school age child. They are from the village of Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Angelita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In March 2007, Angelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her peanut butter business. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a single parent with three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two room house which has electricity and piped water.

Madina owns a retail shop selling all types of merchandise such as sugar, salt cooking oil, etc. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala, and uses public transportation to and from Kampala and her shop in Kisaasi. She rents her business premises at 70,000 UGX per month and her customers are people around the area. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last ten years. Her business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Madina has no additional income.

Madina wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, bags of maize flour and boxes of soap. She hopes to see her business grow big so she can earn enough profit and build her own house. Madina decided to work with MCDT in order to get additional capital for her business. She depends on this job for a living.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as sugar, salt, maize flour and soap

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar G. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 43 years old. Pilar is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Pilar has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Pilar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pilar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Pilar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Pilar from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: D. a ouvert  en 2007 sa propre boutique qu'elle appelle "EL SAHLOM", dans cette boutique, elle vend des fourniture de bureau et fait aussi le traitement de texte de même que la photocopie. elle a besoin de s'approvisionner en fournitures de bureau, c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour remplir sa boutique avec  10 cartons de Bics, 35 cartons de papiers A4, 15 blocs de chemises, 10 blocs d'enveloppes, 10 blocs de cahiers et divers. Elle est célibataire et habite le quartier AVEMARIA qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé.
texts.en:
D. opened her own shop in 2007, called 'El Sahlom', where she sells office supplies and also offers printing services, such as photocopying. She needs to replenish her stock of office supplies and is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 10 boxes of Bic pens, 35 packs of A4 paper, 15 packs of folders, 10 packs of envelopes, 10 packs of notepads, among other things. She is single and lives in the Ave Maria quarter, which is on the outskirts of the town of Lomé.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of office supplies

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl T. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old, widowed and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Cheryl owns and operates a specialized retail business buying and selling coconut shells, or copras, in the local community. Cheryl has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Cheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconut shells to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Fuente de Vida” está iniciando su primer ciclo con crédito. Esta conformada por ocho personas, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva esta constituida por la señora Claudina como presidenta, la señora Valentina como tesorera y la señora Lourdes como secretaria de actas.

La señora Lourdes tiene como tarea registrar lo que sucede en la asociación durante la reunión de pago, desde el día de desembolso, durante las reuniones de pago hasta el último días pago del ciclo, momento en el que podrá dejar el cargo o  ser reelegida. Si bien es joven, 23 años y no tiene mucha experiencia, esta dispuesta a aprender. Para este primer ciclo está solicitando Bs.500.- para la compra de dulces e iniciar un negocio propio. Piensa realizar la venta los días sábados y domingos de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche.

En la asociación también se encuentra socias con otros negocios: tienda de barrio, taller de mecánica chapista, ayudante de minibús, venta de comida y tejido de mantas.
texts.en:
The communal association "Fuente de Vida" (Fountain of Life) is beginning its first loan cycle. It is made up of 8 members, seven women and one man. The board of directors is made up of Mrs. Claudina as president, Mrs. Valentina as treasurer, and Lourdes as recording secretary.

Mrs. Lourdes registers what happens in the association during the payment meeting from the expenditure to the last payment of the loan cycle. At the moment she can either leave the position or be re-elected. In spite of being a young 23 year old and not having much experience, she is willing to learn. For this first loan cycle she requests 500 Bolivianos (Bolivian currency) to buy candies and begin a new business. She plans to sell Saturdays and Sundays from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.

In the association are other members with other businesses: a local store, a panel beater shop, a minibus helper, an individual who sells food, and and one who sews blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of candies.

loans.name: Matale Women's Group 1 - Lugazi

texts.en: M. Robinah belongs to the Matale Women’s group in Lugazi. This mother of eight has for the last 20 years operated a business with the help of her husband and her sister. She sells food items (mostly tomatoes), shoes, and clothes. She began this business with a PEARL micro-loan. Before she started her endeavor, she was a farmer. She now earns 70,000 shillings a week in profits. With this loan, Robinah says she wants to expand her business. This will be in the form of further purchases of more tomatoes as well as cassava and fresh beans, new pairs of shoes, and clothing items to offer for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more food items as well as new pairs of shoes and clothes to offer for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one child who attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food.

She has operated her hardware shop and timber sale business for over five years, selling retail and at the market. Mary faces a major challenge of transportation. She purchases timber from rural areas and transports it to her place of work hence incurring costs. She hopes to own a big hardware shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase a stock market timer machine, iron sheets for resale and pay for a business license. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock market timer machine, iron sheets for resale and a business license

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La Sra. Rita V. tiene 68 años de edad, esta en pareja y tienen un solo hijo de profesión periodista.
La Sra. Rita es propietaria de una microempresa hace más de 40 años, inicialmente administraba una despensa y  con la apertura de las grandes cadenas de supermercados se vio obligada a buscar otras mercaderías,  y luego cambio de ramo realizando solo la venta de bebidas y minutas en su domicilio.
Actualmente posee una clientela formada.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: gaseosas,vinos,cervezas y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs Rita V. is 68 years old.  She lives with her partner and they have one son who is a journalist.

Rita has owned her own small business for more than 40 years.  Initially, she ran a small grocery store but with the opening of the large supermarket chains she had to look for other merchandise and then she changed her business, selling only drinks and snacks in her home.

She currently has an existing customer base.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as soda, wine and beer, etc.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as soda, wine, beer, etc.

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es:
Adalberto trabaja como empleado operario de una máquina en una empresa donde elaboran té y chocolate, con cuyos ingresos  cubre la manutención de su familia. Está casado y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Vive en la zona Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito que solicita es para la refacción de la cocina de la casa donde vive para tener una mejor comodidad y mejores condiciones de salubridad al preparar sus alimentos.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO y  vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Adalberto works as a machine operator for a business where they make tea and chocolate. His earnings are used to take care of his family. He is married and has a three year old son. He lives in the Huayna Potosi area of the city of El Alto.

This loan he is requesting is to repair the kitchen of his home in order to be make it more comfortable and to have more healthy conditions in which to prepare food. 

This is his second loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To repair the kitchen of his home in order to have better health and hygiene.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en: Arsen S. lives with his wife, mother and two children. He is engaged in cattle farming, which is the only source of income for his household. As winter is aproaching it is vital for the family to sustain its little farm, which requires cattle feed, and with this purpose in mind he has applied to SEF for a loan.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Chidi Francis

texts.fr: Francis est âgé de 40 ans.  Il exerce la vente des pièces détachées. IL a demarré ses  activités en 1998 et s’approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé.  Ensuite, il redistribue les pièces dans un atelier à Attiégou à côté de L’hôtel la référence. IL demande un prêt pour acheter de nouvelles pièces détachées.
texts.en: Francis is 40 years old. He sells spare parts.  He got involved in this work in 1998 and he gets his supplies at the autonomous port of Lomé.  He then resells them in his shop in Attiégou next to L’Hôtel la Référence.  He is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Fanny Tatiana

texts.es:
Fanny de 27 años, es una joven emprendedora que hace un año atrás con ayuda de su esposo pudo tener su propia papelería. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana ha trabajado durante un año surtiendo he implementando nueva mercadería para su papelería. En la actualidad la mama le ayuda atender la tienda ya que tiene que atender a sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años ya que su esposo es electricista. Vende en su papelería juguetes, perfumes, papeles, cuadernos, plumas etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere surtir mas el negocio comprando juguetes y zapatillas. En el futuro quiere que su papelería este bien surtida y así tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Fanny is 27 years old.  She is an enterprising young woman who, with her husband's help, opened her own stationery store one year ago.  She lives in a peri-urban area and has worked for one year stocking her business with new merchandise.  Her mom currently helps her to serve in her store since she has to look after her two children, aged 7 and 2, because her husband is an electrician.  In her stationery store she sells toys, perfume, paper, exercise books, pens, etc.

Fanny will use this loan to better stock her business, buying toys and sneakers.  In the future, she would like to have a well-stocked business and thereby more income with which to help her family financially.

loans.use: To buy toys and sneakers

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua M. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high education. Efua sells powder and panties at Abura. She is a hairdresser as well, which she has been doing for three years. Her husband is a mason. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to expand her hairdressing business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to buy a dryer.

loans.use: To expand her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor T., 40, is a low-income person living in Kompong Tom province. He is a good farther who tries to feed his two single children. Sor T. earns a  daily revenue by fishing in the river around his community. His wife works next to him in the same business. This family currently generates an income of approximately $6.40 per day. In order to earn additional income to meet his daily expense, Sor T. wishes to buy a piece of land and fertilizer for growing watermelon. For this reason he has decided to look for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and fertilizer for growing watermelon

loans.name: Enriqueta Juana

texts.es:
Enriqueta es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas, tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo.
Enriqueta es feriante, viaja a las ferias de Andahuaylas, Seccelambras, Pampa Cangallo, entre otros pueblos.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como : ganchos, espejos, cosméticos, imperdibles.
Le gusta Finca Perú, por la accesibilidad a los créditos y los ahorros, con sus ahorros se pudo comprar un terreno.
Su sueño es poder tener una tienda distribuidora en Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls) communal bank.  She’s 46 years old and a single mother of a son.

Enriqueta is a “feriante” (a vendor at open air markets).  She travels to markets in Andahuaylas, Seccelambras, Pampa Cangallo and other towns.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise like: hooks, mirrors, cosmetics, safety pins.

She likes Finca Perú because of the accessibility of loans and savings.  She was able to buy a piece of land with her savings.  Her dream is to have a distributorship in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy hooks, mirrors, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Horizonte está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Adriana de 38 años propietaria de un taller de costura. En 1993 con una máquina de coser inicio su taller en el que solo realizaba camisas y chores en la actualidad junto a su marido quien es sastre se especializaron en pantalones, faldas y camisas, cuenta con 5 máquinas de coser y con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores.
Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 18, 17 y 15 años de los cuales los dos menores estudian. 
Los otros integrantes son María de 60 años quien tiene una pequeña venta y realiza nacatamales y José Marí de 58 años es agricultor y se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Horizone (New Horizon) group is comprised of three hard-working, dedicated, and enterprising people.  

Adriana is one of them.  She is the 38 year old owner of a seamstress shop.  She started her shop in 1993 with one sewing machine.  She only made shirts and shorts.  Now, she works with her husband who is a tailor.  They specialize in pants, skirts, and shirts.  They have five sewing machines, and their older children help them.  She has four children; ages 19, 18, 17, and 15.  The two youngest go to school.

Another member is María.  She is 60 years old, and she has a small business selling “nacatamales” (steamed meat and vegetable pastry, cooked in banana or maize leaves).  The other member is 58 year old José Marío.  He is a farmer, and he buys and sells fruits.

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells creams and panties at Abura, near Frami.  She also cooks rice to sell. Grace has been through senior high school. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She began cooking not long ago and she is requesting a loan to expand her rice selling business by buying more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale. She helps her husband to provide the general needs of her family. The additional capital she hopes to get from her business will be reinvested back into the food business. In this photograph, Grace has placed her two hand on the cooked rice.

loans.use: she is requesting a loan to expand her rice selling business by buying more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale.

loans.name: Oslan

texts.es: Oslan Chávez de 21 años tiene en Ciudad Bicentenario un taller de soldadura llamado los Hermanos Chávez, que genera ingresos para su familia; él Inicio su negocio desde que llegó a Cartagena procedente del Sur de Bolívar donde fue desplazado con su padres a quien tiene  su  cargo;  en la linda ciudad amurallada o Cartagena de Indias, Oslan ha logrado con el apoyo de organizaciones como la Fundación Santo Domingo volver a soñar;   allí se capacitaron todos en la familia  en el oficio de soldadura y crearon su negocio llamado los Hermanos Chávez, actividad de la cual se están generando los ingresos de su hogar. Su sueño es fortalecerla,  para que muchos familiares tengan ingresos y seguir fortaleciendo la empresa familiar. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materia prima para la elaboración de carretas, rejas, puertas y artículos relacionados con la herrería.  Su mayor desafío es lograr condicionar instalaciones locativas de mayor amplitud para seguir creciendo, pero para iniciar está dirigiendo todos sus esfuerzos en función de este propósito.
texts.en:
Oslan Chávez is 21 years old and has a welding shop called Hermanos Chávez in Ciudad Bicentenario.  He generates an income for his family through the business he set up when he arrived in Cartagena from Sur de Bolívar with his parents, who are dependent on him.  In the beautiful walled city of Cartagena de Indias, and with the help of the Santo Domingo Foundation, Oslan has been able to dream again of a future.  His entire family learned the welding trade and began business as Hermanos Chávez as a means of income to cover household expenses.

His dream is to expand the business to increase earnings and stengthen the family company.  This is his first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He plans to use it to buy raw materials to make carts, railing, doors and blacksmith-related items.

His biggest challenge is to have a large enough location in which to continue growing, but for now he is directing his efforts toward that goal for the future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make carts, railing, doors and blacksmith-related items

loans.name: Rosa Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Rosa del Calvario está el grupo de que se llama Rosa del cielo, se llaman así por el nombre que tiene su comunidad que se encuentra en las faldas de un cerro grandisimo lleno de puros arboles, la gente vive muy humildemente, la representante del grupo "Rosa del Cielo" se llama Maria Guadalupe, ella se dedica a la cria y engorda de borregos, llevo ya muchos años con ésta actividad, ella nos dice: "desde que me acuerdo siempre le ayudaba a mis papás con sus animales, los llevaba a comer al pasto, les daba agua y los cuidaba para que no les pasara nada." 

En ésta comunidad es muy común la cría de animales, además son pocas las personas que tienen otra actividad y los habitantes del pueblo generalmente van al centro del pueblo a comprar las cosas que necesitan. 

"Yo pienso que el prestamo me va ayudar mucho porque voy a tener un negocio y en todo negocio hay ganancias para la familia, deseo que mi negocio produzca y pueda comprar mas animales" dice Maria Guadalupe; ella espera diversificar su negocio comprando diferentes animales, con las ganancias ella compra los alimentos para su familia y espera reinvertir en el negocio.
Maria Guadalupe se casó hace 9 años y tiene dos hijas que estudian la primaria, la casa donde vive es prestada.
El grupo lo integran 7 personas, todos los integrantes se dedican a criar borregos para comprar y vender.
texts.en:
The Rosa del Cielo [Rose of Heaven] group, takes its name from that of their community, Rosa del Calvario [Rose of Calvary], which is located at the foot of a great hill covered with forests, where the people live very modestly. The representative of the Rosa del Cielo group is named Maria Guadalupe and works to raise and fatten lambs. She has been doing this for many years and tells us "For as long as I can remember, I always helped my parents with their animals. I took them to graze in the pasture, gave them water, and cared for them so nothing would happen to them."

In this community it's very common to raise animals, and there are few people who do anything else. Everybody goes to the main town to buy things. 

She says "I think the loan is going to help me a lot because I'm going to have a business, and businesses bring money for the family. I want my business to make money so I can buy more animals." She hopes to diversify her business by buying different animals, and use the profits to feed my family and also continue investing in the business.

Maria Guadalupe married her husband nine years ago, and they have two daughters who study in primary school. They live in a rented house. 

The group is made up of 7 people, all of whom raise lambs to buy and sell.

loans.use: to purchase lambs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro E. Pérez, tiene la edad de 57 años, está casado  y vive con su señora esposa y un nieto. El pretende con el préstamo la comprar  los insumos necesarios para la asistencia del maíz. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado de este cultivo y lo quiere asistir con los insumos necesarios para una mejor cosecha tanto en cantidad  como calidad. Sus metas son varias como llegar a generar ingresos para el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida de su familia y poder seguir ofreciéndole a su nieto el estudio para que llegue a ser un profesional algún día. Otra de sus aspiraciones es ser un gran agricultor de granos básicos de la zona y seguir creciendo en la zona para  impulsar a mas personas a sembrar para que mejoren su economía. 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Álvaro E. Pérez, 57, is married living with his wife and a grandson.  He intends to use the loan to buy needed farming supplies for his corn crops.  He has a field already planted with this crop and he wants to help it along with the necessary supplies that will produce a harvest that is better both in quality and quantity.

His goals are several: to generate income sufficient to improve his family’s quality of life and to continue providing his grandson with an education so that he will become a professional someday.  Another one of his hopes is to become a large farmer of basic grains in the zone and to continue growing in the zone to encourage others to plant so that they can improve their economies.

This is his first loan received from FUDECOSUR.  He hadn’t had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nouhou

texts.fr: Revendeur d’appareils électroniques, Nouhou est un jeune homme de 34 ans marié à une couturière et  père de 02 enfants. Commencé depuis 2004, il est à son troisième cycle de prêt dans notre institution. Ce dernier va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en portables, en télévision, puis en quelques accessoires électroniques (batterie,……) pour satisfaire les demandes des clients. il tient sa boutique dans un quartier de la capitale.
texts.en: Noubou is a young man, 34 years old, married to a dressmaker and a father of two children, who works selling secondhand electronics.  He is currently on his third loan cycle through our institution since he started in 2004.  This current loan will enable him to purchase stock – cell phones, televisions, and several electronics accessories (batteries, etc.) – to meet his clients’ needs.  His shop is located in a district within the capital city.

loans.use: to purchase electronics items

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 55 years old and married with three children. Wilson is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 35,000 per harvest. Wilson is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides in order to gain a better yield. Wilson raises crops. He has been primarily planting and harvesting rice for 19 years. In the future, Wilson hopes to generate more earnings in order to continuously send his children to school and assure them of a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Wilmer Jaime

texts.es:
Wilmer Jaime tiene 28 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, desde hace 10 años las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener un taller de agropecuria bien equipado para trabajar.

Le gusta rhacer mucho deporte por que le fasina en futbool.
texts.en:
Wilmer Jaime is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

This Communal Bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and located in the neighborhood of Recinto Cachely Grande, which is in the canton of Ventanas. The members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Wilmer is a farmer who has been growing corn, rice, and beans for 10 years. He buys his supplies at the Olivos Brothers Shopping Center each month and then sells his goods at the fair in the same location.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. One of his challenges is having to deal with crop diseases. His dream is to have an agribusiness that is well-equipped to perform his work.

Wilmer enjoys playing sports and is fascinated with soccer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Lorielyn

texts.en:
Lorielyn is 38 years of age.  She is married and is blessed with 1 child. She is engaged in a livestock business raising hogs.  Her net income every three months is 25,000 PHP. 

Lorielyn is asking a loan for 35,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for her hogs.   She would like to continue receiving loans of larger quantities in her next loan cycles to further assist in the growth and development of her business.

loans.use: buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, 28, is a married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling maize and beans for four years. Having started with 500,000 shillings, he now has 4,000,000 shillings in working capital. His faces a challenge in the price fluctuation of agricultural products. His vision is to own a food store, buy a lorry and to educate his children. Patrick needs the loan facility to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es: El Sr. Hipólito es  muy trabajador y se  preocupa  por el  bienestar de su  familia  ya  que  esta  representa  lo mas importante  en la  vida, día  con  día el lucha  por el  acondicionamiento  de su  vivienda   es  por ello  que  en esta  ocasión necesita  de  nuestra  ayuda para  realizar acabados  en la  barda  delantera  de  su  domicilio ya  que se preocupa de que  sus  pequeños  se  puedan  salir de su  domicilio ocasionando  un  accidente, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para la realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Sr. Hipólito is a hardworking gentleman who is concerned about the welfare of his family since they represent the most important thing in life. Every day he struggles to provide a comfortable home for them. On this occasion, he needs assistance with completing a security wall to the side of his house. He is worried that his small children will get out of the house and cause an accident.

He is grateful for the support that has been provided so that he can complete this project.

loans.use: to build a security wall.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, vive con sus hijos y su esposa, se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi, tiene casi 6 años de estar brindando este servicio, trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a 7:00pm, surgió por iniciativa propia y ya cuenta con clientes frecuentes.
El está solicitando un préstamo para dar mantenimiento al taxi, ya que debe llevarlo al mecánico a reparar el sistema eléctrico, luego el cambio de placas, que significa incurrir en gastos, este préstamo le ayudara para tener en buenas condiciones el vehículo y trabajar con mayores seguridad.
La aspiración de Rigoberto es que su familia tenga una vida estable en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives with his children and wife and devotes himself to providing taxi services. He has been providing this service for almost six years and works every day from 5 a.m. until 7 p.m. He started in the business by his own initiative and now has regular customers. 

He is seeking a loan to provide maintenance to the taxi, since he must take it to a mechanic to have the electrical system repaired, and then to have the plates changed which means more expense. This loan will help him keep his vehicle in good condition and so work more comfortably and safely. 

Robert's aspires to give his family a stable life in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic to repair the electrical system of his vehicle.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda, a 44-year-old mother of two children aged 15 and 7, is married to a farmer. A farmer herself, Melinda assists her husband in managing their rice farm situated in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She also manages their sari-sari store business, selling items including bath and detergent soap, shampoo, sugar and vinegar.

Melinda is requesting a loan to buy farm such as fertilizers and insecticides, and hopes the loan will help to increase their yield.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora  Aurora  es originaria de un lugar llamado  san Felipe y vive  en una colonia muy bonita en donde celebra la fiesta de la virgen de Guadalupe el doce de diciembre.

  Ella se dedica a su  hogar y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  materiales para la  fabricación de ropas y luego venderlo  en este trabajo lleva cinco años y le va bien.

   Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que  desde muy joven le gustaba practicarlo pero cuando se caso dejo de practicarlo y hace poco comenzó de nuevo y le está dando resultado.
 
    Su sueño es ver que sus hijos  tengan una buena  educación y apoyarlos a que termine una carrera  con el pequeño  trabajo que ella realiza.
texts.en:
Aurora is a native of a place called San Felipe, and she lives in a very pretty neighborhood where they celebrate the Festival of the Virgin of Guadalupe on the 12th of December.

Aurora is a housewife who is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make clothing that she will later sell.  She has been doing this type of work for 5 years, and it is going very well.

She was motivated to do this business because from the time that she was very young she enjoyed sewing, but after she got married she stopped.  More recently she started sewing again, and it is working out well.

Her dream is to see her children get a good education.  With her little business, she wants to support them so that they can finish their degrees.

loans.use: to buy materials that she will use to make clothing

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary (pictured with her young daughter), 36, is a weaver, while her husband, Kosal, 40, is a construction worker.
