They live in a village along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have two children-one son and one daughter. One child attends school and the other one is still too young for school. 

Nary is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last six years. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Annet generates additional income by selling fried popcorn. Her major challenge includes transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to make enough profit so that she can buy a delivery van and a plot of land. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married with three children. She is 25 years old and lives in Poblacion, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte.

Amalia buys and sells scrap metals to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Amalia going to the nearby villages to buy scrap metals. She buys metals, bottles, used electric wires and others and she sell it to her Junk Shop contract buyer Each month, she earns PHP 2,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000.00 to buy scrap metals.

Amalia has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Amalia wishes to have a motorcycle. So, she can have a ride and use for the delivery of her products.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Esterlita has a shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes, eggplants & cabbages using the multipurpose cab. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy a variety of vegetables.

Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. At the first, he started to work as a farmer for the past 30 years specialized in cultivating olives. Then, he decided to work as an employee in a water company in 2000. Some of his children are still attending school; and this is the reason why he was obliged to have two jobs in order to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, he is applying for a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a mini van to help him with his product distribution. In the future, he plans to diversify his business operation and start cultivating different types of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to purchase a mini van to help him with his product distribution

loans.name: Carmen Pastora

texts.es:
Carmen mujer trabajadora, tienes su propio negocio, con el préstamo anterior abasteció su venta con mayores cantidades y variedad de productos así también le realizo mejoras al cuarto colocándole cerámica. Los planes a corto plazo es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Se le presento dificultares ya que su hijo se enfermo teniendo que invertir en la compra de médicos.
Con el préstamo que solicitad lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción: Cemento, arena, piedrines, estribus, alambre de amarre, hierro, bloques, tablones de madera, clavos entre otros materiales para la construcción del muro trasero de su casa.  Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida ya que obtendrá mayor comodidad y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is an industrious woman who has her own business. She used her previous loan to increase her sales with a greater number and variety of products. She also made improvements to the room by putting in tile. 

Her short-term plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house. She encountered some problems in doing this because her child got sick and she had to use her money to pay for doctors' expenses. She will use the requested loan to buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, supports, tie wire, iron, cinder blocks, wooden boards, nails and other materials needed for the construction of the wall in the back of her house. 

She is thankful to this finance institution for providing consistent support for her to improve her quality of life, as this loan will help her with providing her family with increased comfort and security.

loans.use: to build a wall for her house.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un señor de 75 años de edad, quien vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi-montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería.
 Desde hace unos meses que Guillermo es trabajador de esta ECC. Se lleva muy bien con los vecinos de la zona, los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos con el servicio que se les ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. Guillermo considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, el y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y ha logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad. Actualmente Guillermo desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para comprar un equipo de cómputo para la empresa. El deseo es sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. Guillermo forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será octavo crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 75 years old and lives with his family in a rural community of Costa Rica called San Gabriel, located in Yolillal, Upala in the province of Alajuela. It’s a relatively large rural community with a mountainous landscape in Costa Rica, Central America. His main business activities are grain agriculture and to a lesser degree livestock. 

For a few months Guillermo has been a worker with ECC. He gets along very well with his neighbors who are very happy with the service he provides. In his particular case, Guillermo believes that thanks to the progress of this project, he and his family have improved their living conditions little by little and he has become influential in the development of his community. 

Now Guillermo would like to get a micro-loan of ¢400.000 to buy computer equipment for his business. He would like to continue improving his family’s living conditions which motivates him to keep working with great vigor. 

Guillermo is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabrielm, one of the 150 EDESA organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his 8th loan, and he says with it he hopes he can continue growing as a small business owner and continue moving his business forward. He also says that thanks to this type of organization and methods of facilitated lending, he can dedicate more time to productive business activities.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment for his business.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
51-year-old Sergia is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has two children aged 23 and 21.

Sergia and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice crops and vegetables to sell. According to Sergia, they earn 5000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Sergia has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Sergia hopes for their business to grow. She also hopes for her children to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Paula Jaymee

texts.en:
Paula Jaymee is a 26 year old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has a four year old child. Paula Jaymee sells rice cakes, bananas, and camote (sweet potato) cue in her community. She started this business a year ago. Paula Jaymee also provides hair-rebonding services to the people in her community. She is able to support her family through her ventures.

Paula Jaymee has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients and hair rebonding materials. Paula Jaymee hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and hair rebonding materials.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 34 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos quienes aún son menores y depende de ella y su pareja para poder tener una buena educación y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Viven en una casa propia como una familia muy unida y trabajadora. El trabajo de Mónica, consiste en la venta de golosinas. Su puesto está ubicado en su propia casa, negocio que es muy concurrido por sus clientes. Recuerda cuando se inicio y cuales fueron los motivos que le llevaron a entrar a este negocio, ya que necesita ser independiente en algunos gastos, además de tener que aportar a la economía del hogar. Con el tiempo se decidió y ahora vende bien y esta muy contenta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender bajo los fuertes rayos solares de la mañana, le encantaría tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender con más comodidad y ofrecer otros tipos de productos a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Además esta muy comprometido una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son responsables y muy buenos entre ellos. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas productos de golosinas para ofrecer a sus clientes, además con la venta de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Monica, 34 years old, is a good and friendly woman. She lives with her partner, with whom she has three children who are all still young and dependent on her and her partner for a good education and a better quality of life. They live in their own house as a very united and hardworking family. Monica works selling candy from her own home, which is a very popular business. She remembers that when she started, her motives for beginning the business were that she needed to be independent with some expenses, and she also wanted to be able to support her household's finances. With time, she decided on this business, and now her candy is selling well, and she is very happy. 

What Monica likes best about her work is talking with her customers and making them laugh. She has been doing this work for three years, and she thinks the most difficult part is having to sell under the strong sun in the morning. She would love to have a candy shop where she could sell her products with more comfort, and offer other types of products to her clients. 

This will her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, because with this support she feels safe to expand her business. In addition, she is very committed to complete her repayments on time, as she has done in the past, and she happy to belong to her community bank, because all the members are very responsible and good to each other. With the amount requested of 1000 soles, she will buy more candy to offer to her clients, as well as some essential food items to sell.

loans.use: to buy necessary food products and candy.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 24 years old and married with two children. For the past five years, he has been a carpenter in Kilifi and is doing great. 

He is requesting his second loan from KADET ltd  to purchase new hammers, nails, and chisels for his carpentry workshop. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and repay his loan. 

His hopes are to gradually expand his business and be able to support his family with ease.

loans.use: to purchase hammers, nails, and chisels

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Milagroso Group

texts.es:
La socia Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal "SEÑOR DE HUANCA MILAGROSO"; El banco se encuentra ubicado enel distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente al departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 22 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia es abogada de profesión y actualmnete trabaja en el poder judicial, ella paralelamente a este trabjao se dedica  ala venta de ropa para damas en especial; la socia viaja cada 2 meses y trae ropa para damas y las reparte a sus diferentes amigas y amistades, La socia en esta ocasión solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropa.
Los otros socios  trabajan en diferentes negocios como atencion de la tienda de abarrotes, venta de productos de belleza por catalogos, venta de comidas, secretarias, venta de ropa entre otros.


La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Gloria belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha Asunta de Calca," located in the province of Calca belonging to the department of Cusco, one hour from the city of Cusco. 

The member is 22 years old and is married with 2 children. She is a lawyer and works in the judiciary. She also sells special women's clothes. She travels every 2 months and brings clothing for women and then distributes them among her different friends and acquaintances. She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of clothing. The other members work in various other occupations, such as small grocery stores, beauty products via catalog, food sales, secretaries, and clothing sales. 
The member appreciates the loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 44 years old.  She is a widow and lives in a small village of the Dusheti District with her family, which is comprised of her son, Vladimer, her daughter-in-law and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner.  

Vladimer works in construction and receives a service fee for the work he completes.  Mzia is busy with farming.  She has a plot of land where she grows maize and tomatoes.  She works hard on her plot to ensure a good harvest and sells the harvested products on the local open market.  In addition, to her agricultural business, Mzia and her daughter-in-law are busy with trading.  They sell secondhand clothes in nearby villages.  The family’s total average monthly income is 900 Lari.

Mzia has requested a loan to start a new business.  She plans to open beer bar.  With the loan, she will purchase the necessary equipment for the bar, mainly furniture and refrigerator.  She thinks that a lot of beer will be sold in the hot summer months, enabling the family to earn additional income.  With the increased income, Mzia will be able to invest in the family agricultural business, expanding it and making it more profitable.  As a result, the family’s living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase all the necessary equipment for a beer bar.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta is a baker. She graduated from ‘A’ level. She bakes bread with a locally made oven. She supplies it to retailers both near and far, as well as individuals around her locality that is Abura, Cape Coast. She has been involved in this business for quite some time. Henrietta is a widow with three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her pay her children’s school fees. 

She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her bread. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for the bakery. With the new profits from her expanded business, Henrietta wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to education to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for the bakery.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Hawa. She is married and has one 2-year-old child. 

In 2012, Hawa established her boutique men's and women's wear, shoes, and creamer spray business. She began her business because she wanted to get a source of income to help her husband and improve her living standard. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa requires a loan in order to expand the business through the purchasing of more men's shirts, shoes, coats and women's shoes and coats. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits, which will help her to improve her business. 

In the future, she plans to establish a big shop and to send her child to school. This business is helping her to raise her child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more men's shirts, shoes and coats.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en: Irum  is 23 years old, single woman. She is shown in the photo with her brother. She has been successfully running a small general store with her brother at the corner of her house. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet their family expenses. Currently, she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy more chicks and expand theirthe poultry house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of a tea leaf business

loans.name: Mahammadali

texts.en:
Mahammadali H. is a 56-year-old married man who has two milk cows and a calf. He lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar town. Mahammadali is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar in 1993 during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. He has been raising animals since 1997.

The first loan Mahammadali applied for was US$ 600. With that amount, he purchased his first milk cow and started to sell milk and yoghurt to the local people. These products are in very high demand in the small towns and villages of Azerbaijan. Later on, with the money he earned from his milk and yoghurt sales, he purchased a calf.

Mahammadali has a big family, a wife and 4 grown-up children, two daughters and two sons. The youngest son helps him to tend the animals, but to cover all the needs of their big family they have to expand their micro-business, so they have applied for this $1,200 loan to purchase one more cow and a calf.

loans.use: purchase one milk cow and a calf

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Sokhom has been married since 1985 and has 3 daughters. She has been doing farming since 2000. She plants different kinds of vegetables and flowers and sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband assists her in planting vegetables and flowers.

Mrs. U. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use the US$300 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable farming

loans.name: Myrian

texts.en:
Myrian P. is 38 years old, and married with five children. Her oldest child is now out of school and works as a domestic servant. She helps the family with household expenses.

Myrian works in horticulture. She grows tomatoes, carrots and lettuce. She learned this trade from her parents who were also farmers.

With dedication, Myrian and her family have been able to move forward. Over the years they have built their own house and she has been able to pay for the education of her children.

Myrian has asked for a loan to buy cloth to be used to protect her crops from the extreme summer sun in Paraguay. In the future she also wishes to buy a horse and cart with which to distribute her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy cloth to be used to protect her crops from the sun

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Magdalena belongs to the Comunal Bank of Valiant Women, she lives in the San Martin region, Huallaga province, Saposoa district. Her business is located at 304 Humberto Torres and it is a clothing store. Thanks to the support of her spouse, three children and her own effort, she was able to increase her sales y expand her business. Now she has more customers and orders. With the loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy clothing for women, men and children in a variety of sizes, styles and for a variety of occasions and fill all her orders. Mrs. Maria Magdalena is 37 years old; she lives with her spouse and her three children; she works daily, demonstrating that she can grow as a businesswoman and reach her goals, to which there are no limits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Drejet, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Magdalena pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, vive en la región San Martín, provincia Huallaga, distrito Saposoa. Su negocio está ubicado en el Pasaje Humberto Torres No. 304 y se dedica a la venta de ropa. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus tres hijos y de su propio esfuerzo sus ventas se incrementaron y su negocio creció. Actualmente tiene mayor cantidad de clientes y pedidos. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará ropa para damas, caballeros y niños en variedad de tallas, modelos y para diversas ocasiones y de esa manera cumplir con todos sus pedidos. La señora María Magdalena tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera que ella puede crecer como empresaria y cumplir sus metas y que para ello no hay límites.

loans.use: Buy clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco V. is a very capable and industrious gentleman. He has worked in the sale of groceries and basic grains in the Estación market of León. Since he found himself in a difficult economic situation 20 years ago with no employment to be found anywhere, he decided to invest his few savings in the purchase of grocery products and basic grains to sell them.

His activity is very stressful, since one must consider that he lives in León and his business is very far away from his home. Because of this he must leave at 6:30 AM every day to take a bus that carries him to the market where he has his business and arrives at this point at 7:30 AM (An hour of transportation). Similarly it happens in the end of the day which concludes at 5:00 or 6:00 PM. All these efforts he carries out for the sole purpose of maintaining his family, since he is a husband and father of three small children.

For 3 years he has been a faithful client of Ceprodel, completing 19 loans that he has utilized to supply more products and in this manner to be able to maintain his nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco V. es un C. muy esforzado y trabajador. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes y granos básicos en el mercado la Estación en León. Desde hace 20 años por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de abarrotes y granos básicos para venderlos.

Su actividad es muy agitada ya que a pesar que vive en León, su negocio está muy alejado de su hogar por lo que desde las 6:30 a.m todos los días espera un bus que lo lleve al mercado donde tiene su negocio y llega a este punto a las 7: 30 a.m (Una hora de transporte). De igual manera sucede al final del día el cual concluye a las 5:00 o 6:00 pm. Todos estos esfuerzos los realiza con el único propósito de mantener a su familia ya que es esposo y padre de tres pequeños hijos.

Desde hace 3 años ha sido un fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando 19 créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir mas sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Magamaga Central E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret A.. She is currently in the local brewing business and is requesting a loan to buy a brewing machine. Margret is 49 years old and is divorced. She has 5 children ranging from age 15 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Nmonica N., Justine N., and Sarah K.. Nmonica N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to expand business. Justine N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. Sarah K. operates a beauty parlor business and wants to buy more cosmetics and add to the business.

loans.use: To add to brewing business

loans.name: Cheok

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheok S., 41, is a widow with one child, and works making Khmer food (a roll made of hashed meat - usually pork) wrapped and cooked in banana leaves. On average, she makes about $3 a day.

The loan from Kiva will be used to purchase rice and banana leaves. She hopes the business will give her family more income. (Mrs. Cheok S. is pictured with her daughter)

loans.use: To purchase rice and banana leaves.

loans.name: Massah

texts.fr:
Madame Massah E. is 41 years old, married and the mother of 5. In Ewe, the name Massah means she is the third girl of the family (if she had been the third son, she would be named Mensah). She and her large family live in the town of Adéta, located about 150 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. To be able to feed, clothe and pay for school expenses of her children, Massah sells food along the road going to Adéta. She specializes in Akpan, a traditional and refreshing food made from cornmeal that one must wet and mix with ice and sugar. This is Massah's first loan and she awaits the opportunity to purchase more corn and sugar to continue to make iced Akpan. She would also like to purchase flour and bread with this loan so as to diversify her production and to attract more customers. This will allow her to respond to the needs of her family and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame Massah E. est agée de 41 ans, mariée de 5 enfants. En Ewe, le nom Massah indique qu’elle est la troisième fille de sa famille (si elle était le troisième fils, il s’appelerait Mensah) Elle et sa grande famille habitent dans la ville d’Adéta, une ville situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomè, la capitale du Togo. Pour provisionner la nourriture, les vêtements et les frais scolaires pour tous ses enfants, Massah prépare et vend la nourriture au bord d’une route occupé d’Adéta. Elle est spécialisée en Akpan Glacé, un repas traditionnel et rafraîchissant (voir la photo) de la farine du maïs qui devient molle et mélangée avec de la glace et du sucre. Ce crédit est la première pour Massah et elle attend l’opportunité d’acheter plus du maïs et du sucre pour la préparation d’Akpan Glacé. Aussi, elle désire avec ce crédit d’acheter du blé et du pain pour diversifier son produit et d’attirer plus de clients. Ce qui lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de sa famille et d’augmenter la qualité de leur vie.

loans.use: To purchase more corn and sugar to make iced Akpan.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget O. is 30 years old and married with 4 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. This is a business she learned for 6 months from friends; she needs the loan to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She says, “Thank you.”

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi P., 28 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2005. Despite her young age, she is very enthusiastic in business. Seeing that investing in food service in her area is of great advantage, she and her husband decided to open a local restaurant. At first, because of small amount of fund, she didn’t have a profound menu and as a result, she did not have too many customers. After joining the Fund, she used the borrowed money to invest in her restaurant, enriching her menu, and satisfying her customers. Her business is growing very well. She has 2 children, one of whom is going to school. This time she wants to borrow 500 USD to invest more in her restaurant. Her average income is approximately 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương 28 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2005, mặc dù tuổi đời còn rất trẻ nhưng trong làm ăn chị rất mạnh giạn, nhân thấy việc kinh doanh ăn uống tại địa phương là sẽ thuận lợi, chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Hoàng Lai mở của hàng ăn uống tại đia phương, lúc đầu khi mở cửa hàng do vốn của gia đình chị còn ít nên một số hàng ăn của gia đình chị chưa phong phú nên số khách hàng đến quán của gia đình chị vẫn còn ít, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã vay vốn đầu tư thêm vào các mặt hàng tại quán, các vòng vốn tiếp theo cũng vậy gia đình chị vẫn tiếp tục đầu tư vào quán ăn, với việc có vốn các mặt hàng ăn tại quán của chị đã đa dạng và phong phú hơn, đáp ứng được nhu cầu khách hàng. Khách hàng đến quán của gia đình chị ngày càng đông, việc kinh doanh hàng ăn của gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, chị có 2 con, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 8.000.000đ đầu tư vào quán ăn. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Restaurant business

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Mr. Saroeurn P. and his wife are farmers in Svay Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. They have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while three others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Saroeurn P. does not have enough cows to plow his field, thus, therefore he has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more cows. On his plantation, Mr. Saroeurn P. has had to deal with a drought in the past few years that has reduced his crop size. Previously, Mr. Saroeurn P. obtained a loan to buy zinc to cover his house roof. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow the rice field

loans.name: Radjabgul

texts.ru: Юсупова Раджабгул жительница района Вахдат.Возраст 50 лет, замужем,имеет 12 детей. Клиентка  больше 20 лет занимается куплей продажей ткани.Она скупает у оптовых поставщиков ткань и реализует ее в розницу. Ведет торговлю из дома.Этот вид  бизнеса позволяет ей содержать свою большую семью .Так как  муж клиентки инвалид и не может работать. В данный момень Раджабгул хочет закупить  ткань ,на что ей нужны деньги.Она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Radjabgul U. lives in the Vahdat area. She is 50 years old, married with 12 children. She has been in the fabric sales business for over 20 years. Radjabgul buys fabrics from established suppliers and then re-sells them. She runs the business from her home. The business has helped support her large family as her husband is an invalid, unable to work. Radjabgul would like a loan to buy additional fabrics to increase her inventory and variety. She plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To incease inventory & variety

loans.name: Sineat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sineat E. , 46, and her husband, Mr. Song Soy, 50, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Two of the children are silk weavers and the youngest one studies in the local school.

Mrs. Sineat has been a silk weaver since she was seventeen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a chef. He cooks for weddings and other ceremonies in his village and near-by villages.

Sineat is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur la señora Maria Gutierrez se dedica desde hace 20 años a la actividad económica de la agricultura. Es importante destacar que ella es una madre de dos hijos los cuales tiene que mantener y por se esfuerza día a día en su actividad económica.

Actualmente el motivo por el cual ella acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de insumos para la agricultura. Por esta razón es que ella espera que se le otorgue y así mantener su actividad económica. Es importante destacar que ella se ha destacado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel y por esta razón ha solicitado el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra Maria Gutierrez has worked for 20 years in the agricultural sector of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. It’s also important to note that she is the mother of two children whom she works hard to support. She has approached Ceprodel for a loan to enable her to buy agricultural supplies. She hopes to be given financial assistance so she can continue her work. Maria has been a long-term and outstanding client of Ceprodel, and for this reason she has asked for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies

loans.name: Afeafa

texts.fr: Afeafa G. est revendeuse des bananes plantains à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 garçons, elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et cela consiste à acheter les bananes auprès des agriculteurs pour les revendre dans la capitale. Elle est passionnée par ce commerce et désire par ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité
texts.en:
Afeafa G., 35, sells plantains in Womé, a village situated about 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is married and the mother of 2 sons, and she has been working at this business for 5 years. She buys the plantains from the growers to re-sell in the capital. She is passionate about this business and wants this loan to grow the capacity of her undertaking.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying plantains for re-sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia Igbinomwahia is 51 years old and is married with six children. Felicia owns a store where she sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Felicia needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell. Felicia is happy because she will make additional profits during this festive season. She would like to thank everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maryam Dani El Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji is a 56-year-old married lady and resides in a place called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She completed her education up to 8th standard but couldn’t study further because of lack of financial resources from her parents. Her husband's name is D. E. and he has an animal-selling business. He buys animals from animal markets and sells specifically goats to butcher shops. He has 20 years' experience in this business.

Maryam baji has two sons. Her elder son has a vegetable-selling business, and her younger son has a brick-selling business. Maryam baji keeps herself busy making embroidered dresses and doing knitting. She knits table covers and bed sheets and sells them in the market at a profit. She invests her income in a committee. She intends to marry off her elder son when she collects her committee amount. She is a regular member of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). She has successfully repaid five loans and now she is requesting her 6th loan to buy goats to expand her husband's animal-selling business.

Maryam baji is the group leader for some more women. Sakina baji and another lady called Sakina baji each want a loan to buy buffaloes for their milk-selling businesses. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rehana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to carry loads.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to re-sell

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.en:
Abdugaffor A. is 27 years old. He is married and has three kids. Abdugaffor is a very diligent and hard-working man. With his car he provides taxi services inside the city of Dushanbe. For the last 2 years, the current business had provided their main income, allowing Abdugaffor to improve living conditions for his large family. Besides his wife and children, he is also supporting his parents.

As any business generating income, the business of Abdugaffor also requires some investment from time to time. Thus, now his car needs some fixing and also Abdugaffor wants to buy winter tires. For this purpose Abdugaffor is requesting 2500 Somoni for a term of 12 months. Abdugaffor promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Thorough fixing of his vehicle used for providing taxi services

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Né le 1er janvier 1966 à Aklakou, Monsieur M. Komla s’est spécialisé dans le transport en commun depuis plus de quinze (15) ans. Grâce à son salaire mensuel, il a réalisé un minimum d’économie. Aujourd’hui, il cherche un complément d’argent pour s’acheter une voiture de transport pour être autonome et dégager une importante marge bénéficiaire. Ceci lui permettra d’assurer de meilleures conditions de vie à son futur ménage et de créer une entreprise de transport en commun.
texts.en:
Born on January 1, 1966 in Aklakou, Mr. Komla M. has been specializing in public transportation for fifteen years. Due to his monthly salary, he has minimal savings. Today, he is looking for additional money to buy a vehicle, so as to be autonomous and to make a good profit margin. This will enable him to ensure the best living conditions for his future family and home, as well as to establish a public transport enterprise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle for providing public transportation

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин уже несколько лет занимается частным предпринимательством. Направление его бизнеса – это продажа электротоваров: электропровода, розетки, лампочки, предохранители и тп. Для него это является основным источником дохода в его семейном бюджете. Фахриддину исполнилось 30 лет, он женат и имеет уже троих детей. Фахриддин планирует развивать свой бизнес и далее, для этого необходимо дополнительные средства. Полученный займ собирается потратить на приобретение оптовой партии электропроводов.
texts.en:
Fahriddin A. has been a private entrepreneur for several years. His area of business is electronics sales: electric cords, outlets, light bulbs, fuses, etc. It provides the primary source of income for his family. Fahriddin is 30 years old, married, and already has three children. He plans to further develop his business, and will need additional funds. The loan will be spent on the wholesale purchase of electronics goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of electronics

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh F. est un éleveur qui élève des moutons et les revend au marché hebdomadaire.  Il sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des moutons et leur nourriture pour qu’ils soient en bonne sante.  Monsieur F. habite à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale à 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Avec les revenus de son agriculture, il paye les dépenses de la maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh F. is a livestock farmer who raises sheep and resells them at the weekly market. He's requesting his first loan to buy sheep and fodder, so that they may be healthy. He lives in Diourbel, a small rural city located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. With the revenues from his farming, he pays the expenses of the house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and fodder

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
K. julienne est née le 05/02/1981 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. julienne est mariée et mère de deux enfants: Armelle âgé de huit (08) ans en troisième année du cours primaire et Fidélia âgée de cinq (05) en première année du cours primaire. Avant de connaître ALIDé, julienne servait dans un restaurant. Mais depuis qu'elle a eu de crédit à ALIDé, julienne s'est mise à son propre compte. julienne vend la pâte de maïs et du poisson frit devant son domicile. julienne a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu'elle a eu de ALIDé et avec lequel elle a commencé son activité de restauration populaire. julienne étant à ses débuts a toujours besoin de l'appui financier de ALIDé en crédit. julienne demande un deuxième prêt à ALIDé pour développer son activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Julienne was born on February 5, 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of two children: Armelle, age 8, in the 3rd grade; and Fidélia, age 5, in the 1st grade. Before finding out about Alidé, she used to work in a restaurant. But since she has had loans with Alidé, she started off on her own. Julienne sells cornmeal mash and fried fish in front of her home. She has indeed repaid the first loan she had with Alidé. The loan was used to start her popular restaurant business. Being new at it, she still needs financial support from Alidé and is asking for a second loan to develop her business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of fish and sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new goods

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna es madre de 2 hijos por quienes trata de trabajar para brindarles lo mejor, y gracias al trabajo de su esposo tienen una casa donde vivir y establecerse. Cuando se casó empezó a preocuparse por su económica, ya que sus necesidades crecían y su pareja no podía solventar solo los gastos que demandaban sus hijos, por esta necesidad se inició en el comercio ambulante. Hace 3 años empezó a vender ropa y utensilios de cocina de casa en casa, pero al obtener la experiencia necesaria, desde hace 1 año comenzó a trabajar a pedidos que le solicitan cada fin de mes, y solo vende en las calles los fines de semana en los mercados. Ahora, gracias al apoyo de su pareja está terminando de construir su casa, donde piensa invertir sus ahorros de varios años de trabajo para instalar una tienda de comestibles. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, lo que le está abriendo las puertas para progresar, y entablar nuevas relaciones con las señoras que integran su banco comunal. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará mercadería, ya que sus pedidos han aumentado y no contaba con el capital necesario para cubrir la inversión, más ahora tendrá la posibilidad de distribuir sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Digna is the mother of two children, and she works to offer them the best. Thanks to the work of her husband, they have a house to live and settle in. When she married, she began to worry about their finances, since their needs grew, and her partner couldn’t afford the costs that their children demanded. For this reason she began to work as a traveling salesperson. Three years ago, she began to sell clothes and kitchen utensils from door to door to obtain necessary experience. Since one year ago, she began to work in orders at the end of every month, and she only sold in the streets on weekends at the markets. Now, thanks to the support of her partner, she is finishing the construction of her home where she hopes to invest various years of savings to install a grocery store. This is her first loan with MFP. It is opening the doors to progress and establishing new relationships with the women in her community bank. With the 1000 soles, she will buy merchandise, since her orders have grown, and she doesn’t have the necessary capital to cover the investment. Now she will be able to distribute her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 
Усмонова Шоира женщина . которая торгует на рынке Худжанда детской одеждой. Она привозит товар из Истаравшана и Бишкека. Для завоза летних детских футболок и шорт она решила получить повторный кредит. Она за время кредитования ни разу не подводила организацию.
texts.en:
Shoira U. is a woman who sells children's clothing on the market of Khujand. She brings the merchandise from Istaravshan and Bishkek. She decided to get a new loan to bring in children's summer t-shirts and shorts. During her credit history she has never let our organization down.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand.” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand retail business of children's clothing

loans.name: Ekiya

texts.en:
Ekiya M. sells green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and Irish potatoes to sell.  Ekiya is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. They have two children, both of whom are in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy beans and irish potatoes

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials. She started her own shop ten years ago. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

Doris is 38 years old. She is married to U., who works as a security person. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: ibrahima S. est membre de la caisse de bayelaye guediawaye depuis 2007.il capitalise sept ans d'experience dans son activite.il gere une quincaillerie dans sa zone d'habitation.il est marie et pere de famille .donc avec l'augmentation de ses revenus a travers l'accroissement de sa marge beneficiaire il souhaite ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ibrahima S. has been a member of the bank of Bayelaye Guediawaye since 2007. He capitalizes on seven years of experience in his business. He manages a hardware store in the area where he lives. He is married and a family man. Thus, with the increase in his revenues by growing his profit margin, he wishes to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital for commerce

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. sells 'banku'. 'Banku' is a local dish, made by soaking corn and cassava to soften it and then milling it into a soft form before mixing it with water and stirring it on fire to get banku. Mary has no educational background. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Mary has been selling 'banku' at Elmina since 2006. She contributes to the upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and cassava to prepare her 'banku'. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more maize and cassava to prepare her banku

loans.name: Ivan Vicente

texts.es:
Iván C. vive en alquiler con su familia en la c/Julián Apaza la zona Villa Pabon en la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como chofer asalariado durante el día y por la noches estudia, el crédito que solicita es para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad y de esta manera terminar la carrera y poder conseguir un empleo mejor que le permita dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.

No es cliente de Impro pero por el carácter social puede obtener un credito.

loans.use: ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIOS

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. She trades in fish and vegetables. Comfort sells on a table top in the market square and supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from nearby towns. Comfort has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy cartons of fish and vegetables in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y persistente, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila. Su salón de belleza es uno de los más visitados de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella tiene un talento natural para cortar el cabello a sus clientes, pero su fama principal y el motivo por el cual la buscan sus clientes, es por los novedoso cambios de look que realiza y es que tiene un muy buen ojo para sacar la belleza de la gente a relucir.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuáles son los estilos que están de moda, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el fuerte olor que despiden los químicos con los que trabaja, aun así espera sacar adelante su salón de belleza y convertirlo en el mejor de la ciudad.
Este es el quinto préstamo de Nelly con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos de belleza para realizar un mejor trabajo en sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de productos de belleza

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria sells sarongs of various colours and shapes and she also sells shoes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is 28 years old and married with two children. Her husband repairs computers. All her children are in school and she is determined to give them quality education. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell

loans.name: San Placido Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Placido” esta representado por la señora Nelva y conformada por 12 miembros que cuenta con experiencia D. trabajo en grupo ya que van cursando ya su tercer ciclo demostrando en todo momento puntualidad y responsabilidad en los pagos. Cabe recalcar que  las diferentes actividades que emprenD. los miembros del grupo permite el cumplimiento D. las cuotas establecidas por la institución y el cumplimiento con cada uno D. sus hogares sacrificándose día a día por salir adelante en sus negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, costurera, peluquerías, almacenes D. comestibles, tiendas D. ropa D. vestir y cosméticos por catálogos. Si bien existe bastante competencia en todos los rubros que desarrollan las socias, estas tienen buenos ingresos a pesar D. todo. El objetivo del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para sus el bien estar D. sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya habían trabajado bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidarios por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento D. la forma D. trabajo pero se encuentran agradecidas por el apoyo económico y la confianza que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The “San Placido” group, represented by Nelva, consists of 12 members who have experience working in a group since they are in their third lending cycle having demonstrated always punctuality and responsibility in repayments. It's worthy of mention that the various activities the members engage in proviD. enough profits to allow the group to make their repayments in the manner specified by the institution and that their daily sacrifices to get ahead in the sales of groceries, as seamstresses, barbers, food stores, clothing sales, and cosmetic catalogue sales also allows them to meet their household expenses. Despite heavy competition in all the areas the members engage in, they make good earnings. The objective of the funding is to buy merchandise, raw materials and work tools to generate better income for their families' wellbeing. These members have already worked with communal banks so they have experience in the work methodologies involved and are grateful for the economic support and trust placed in them by fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en: Senia S. M. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Auala 2. She is married and has three school-aged children. Senia S. owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200 WST a month. In 2009, Senia S. joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella E. is from the village of Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $110 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo (Wilder), de 32 años, y con sus dos inquietos hijos: Wilder de 8 y Abel de 4 años. Todos ellos viven en una acogedora casa, que es propia, ubicada en un tranquilo pueblo de la sierra del Perú.

Todas las mañanas Mery empieza su jornada desde la madrugada, ya que tiene muchas labores  por realizar durante el día; empieza atendiendo a sus pequeños para que asistan a la escuela a tiempo; luego debe cocinar para que cuando sus hijos regresen se alimenten bien, y después se dirige hacia sus tierras donde siembra papa. Toda esta labor la hace sola, pues su esposo se dedica al pastoreo durante todo el día; aunque la labor que cumple ella es muy cansada, la realiza sin ningún problema porque siempre piensa en el  futuro de sus hijos y que no les falte nada, ya que quiere que estudien y lleguen a tener una profesión.
Ella sabe que todo lo que se propone se puede lograr, es por eso que trabaja sin descanso en el cultivo de sus tierras y siempre obtiene una cosecha segura, la cual vende a sus clientes mayoristas del mercado de su localidad.

Esta es la sexta vez que Mery tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura de ser responsable como siempre lo ha sido, además de puntual, ya que sabe que solo así logrará todo lo que se ha propuesto en la vida. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar sacos de abono y fertilizantes para cuidar bien sus tierras ante cualquier problema que se pueda presentar.
texts.en:
Mery is 27 years old and lives with her husband, Wilder, who is 32. They have two lively sons: Wilder, who is 8, and Abel, who is 4. They all live in a cozy house, which they own, located in a quiet town in the Peruvian mountains. Every morning Mery begins her day at dawn, because she has many jobs to do during the day. She begins by taking care of her little ones, so that they can get to school on time. Later she needs to cook so that when her sons come home they will have good food to eat. After that she heads to her fields, where she grows potatoes. She does all this alone, as her husband works as a shepherd all day long. Although the work she does is very tiring, she does it with no problems because she is always thinking of her children’s future and doesn’t want them to lack for anything. She wants them to study and eventually pursue their own careers. She knows that she can achieve whatever she puts her mind to, and for this reason she works tirelessly in the cultivation of her lands. She always obtains a good harvest, which she sells to her wholesale customers in the town. This is the sixth time that Mery has gotten a loan with MFP. She is sure that she will be as responsible as always, and on time with payments, because she knows that this is the only way to achieve what she has planned in life, With the money she is asking for, she plans to buy bags of manure and fertilizers in order to take good care of her lands in case any problems might arise.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future.

Florence needs a loan of NGN 40,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She hopes to experience an increase in her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva.

Florence is a Bini by tribe and she lives in Benin City. She is 34 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Florence is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 44 years old. He is married and has 6 children, ages 4 to 18. He lives with his family in the Northern Province of Rwanda. His village is called Burera, and it is where his food businessis located. This business is profitable for him because it is two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. This is his fifth successful business. His shop is open from 6:00 AM to 16:00 PM every day except Sunday.

Jean Pierre is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more food, such as beans, sorghum, and Irish potatoes. With this loan, he hopes to earn more profits, which will help him to save money and pay his children's school fees. When Jean Pierre finishes his business each day, he comes home early so he can care for his domestic animals.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Sheloh

texts.en:
Sheloh D. S., from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental, is 24 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Sheloh owns and operates a specialized retail store whose income derives primarily from the sale of seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Sheloh has been engaged in her business for over three years, earning approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Sheloh joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheloh is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, her first from HSPFI, to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the store to continue to improve the business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda L. is from the village of Medallo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years-old and married with five adult children.She owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector. She has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years. Her main source of income comes  from her daughter in Germany in the amount of 10,000.00 monthly. Currently she's availing her 12th cycle loan in the amount of 35,000.00 which will be used for housing materials.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing material.

loans.name: Nancy Gladys

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Nancy es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene una Botica llamada Unión Gómez en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos.
El sueño de Nancy es tener una cadena de farmacias.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Solucion community bank. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. Nancy has a drugstore called Union Gomez in a rented space. She works there every day with the help of her son. Nancy needs a loan of PEN 1050 that will be invested in the purchase of medicine. Nancy’s dream is to have a pharmacy chain.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is a single parent living with her four children. She has received no formal education. Ekua goes to the nearby villages to buy yam in large quantities to sell at Jukwa market. Ekua uses her income to take care of her children. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more yams so that she can meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more yams to meet customer demand

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Nancy tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos de carro, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de Nancy son tener un local propio y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank Virgen Maria. She lives with her common law husband, is 25 years old and has one child. She has a shop in a rented space where she sells car parts daily. She needs a loan of 3000 soles which she will used to purchase parts. He dreams are to have her own shop and to help her son get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase car parts

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio’s rice field needs additional capital to be successful. Bonifacio is a 47-year-old entrepreneur from Agusan Del Sur. He does rice farming to support his family. He’s a widower and has three children.

Bonifacio partners with Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it has a low interest rate on the loan. He requested a loan of 11,000 Php. The loan will be helpful for him to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 53 años, es separado desde hace 12 años, pero de aquella relación tiene 3 hijos, de las cuales dos de ellos están en Lima en búsqueda de un futuro mejor, mientras que la menor vive con él en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años trabaja como maestro de obras y construcción, trabajo que es muy importante para él, ya que depende de su experiencia para otros trabajos futuros. En esta labor no cuenta con el apoyo de su familia. Lo que más le agrada de su oficio es terminar la obra sin contratiempo, pues muchas veces paso malos ratos por algún retraso y eso le perjudico mucho en el pago de sus honorarios. Por eso hace las coordinaciones respectivas en los términos de contrato. La construcción es su principal fuente de ingresos, puesto que le ha generado buenas utilidades que le ayudaron a  mantener a sus hijos. Ahora espera asociarse con una de sus hijas con quien venderá ropa en un puesto dentro del mercado de su ciudad, además con el tiempo anhela instalar un negocio de venta de plásticos dentro de su vivienda, ya que lo considera muy rentable. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y está contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal, donde todos los miembros son unidos como una familia y eso lo motiva a laborar de manera activa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varios fardos de ropa principalmente polos y blusas.
texts.en:
Juan, age 53, has been separated for 12 years. He has three children from that relationship. Two of them are in Lima looking for a better future. The youngest one lives with him in his own house. For over ten years he has worked as a master builder. This work is very important to him as his future work depends upon his experience. His family does not help him with this work. What pleases him the most about his work is finishing the job without mishap. He has often experienced some bad moments due to some delay. This penalized him a lot in his fees. That is why he makes arrangements regarding the terms of the contract. Construction is his main source of income as it has generated good profits, which have helped him support his children. He now hopes to team up with one of his daughters. He will sell clothes with her at a stand inside the market in the city. In time he also wants to set up a business selling plastics in his house. He considers this to be very profitable. This is his third loan with MFP. He is happy to be working with his communal bank. All of the members are united like a family. This motivates him to work in an active manner. He will use the 2,000 PEN he is requesting to buy various bundles of clothes, which will mainly be polo shirts and blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of clothes including polo shirts and blouses

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Reside en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, ubicada en la selva cusqueña peruana, donde tienen su casa propia. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, por falta recursos económicos no pudo terminar de estudiar, pese a ello no se desanimo, así que emprendió a trabajar en el cultivo de cacao, pero no lo iba de la mejor manera, hasta que se tuvo que cambiar de trabajo. Ahora la venta de productos en general es lo que se dedica, por ello agradece a su esposo por el apoyo que le dio. Este negocio le está brindando buenas ganancias económicas, además ya tiene una buena cantidad de fieles compradores. En tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero usualmente trabaja sola. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma casa, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio en otras localidades para que así diversifique su mercado. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus cuotas de pago, además agradece a su grupo comunal por la seriedad que tiene cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías, para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Dolores is 44 and married with four school-aged children. She lives in the Sirenachayocc community, located in Cusco's Peruvian rainforest, where they have their own home. Despite not having completed elementary school (due to lack of economic resources, not for lack of encouragement), she learned to cultivate cocoa; but she did not do it the best way, so she had to change jobs. She now sells general products, and she thanks her husband for the support he has given her. This business is providing her with good earnings, and she already has a good number of loyal customers. During holidays, her children help her, but she usually works alone. She sells out of her house, from 5 am to 9 pm. Her greatest wish is to expand her business into different areas in order to diversify her market. This is her second loan with MFP, which ensures that she will meet repayment quotas faithfully. She also thanks her community group for the reliability each member displays. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise, in order to stock her store with general grocery items.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Reyna V.  es soltera vive en el barrio San Agustín junto a su familia tiene una hija fuera del país su negocio es venta de tortillas, ubicado en su casa de habitación   tiene dos personas empleadas, dice sentirse muy bien por qué ayuda a dos familias indirectamente brindándoles empleo en su negocio. 
Doña Isabel V. tiene más de cuatro años de trabajar con créditos de los cuales ha  cancelado veintitrés demostrando ser una persona responsables. Todos los créditos anteriores han sido muy importantes para el desarrollo de mi negocio y la estabilidad económica de mi familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel Reyna V. is single and lives in the neighborhood of San Agustín with her family. She has one daughter who lives outside of the country. Isabel sells tortillas from her home and has two employees. She says she feels very good because she has indirectly helped two families by providing employment through her business.

Doña Isabel V. has worked with loans for more than four years and has repaid 23 of them, thereby demonstrating that she is a responsible person. All of her previous loans have been very important in developing her business and stabilizing her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Jorja

texts.en:
Jorja T. is from the village of Canicapan in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Jorja is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Jorja owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jorja has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jorja joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jorja has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jorja is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be Jorja's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school.  She resides in and rents a house with two rooms, and she takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food and rent.

She owns a stall in Nalukolongo selling charcoal and raw food. She has been in this business for four years.
