She works from her home in Nalukolongo and so she doesn’t have to pay rent for her business. She sells to all categories of people but focuses on retail and receives an average of 25 customers a day.  Betty works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal from Mityana villages to her stall in Nalukolongo Kampala district.

Betty wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal, as well as to buy bags of raw food like sweet potatoes and cassava.   She aspires to see her business make enough profits to buy her delivery van and also to build her own house.

She decided to work with MCDT because they were charging low interest compared to other MFIs.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal and bags of raw foods like sweet potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Ana Lucila

texts.en:
Ana Lucila B. is from the village of Western Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 47 and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Ana Lucila owns a mini-restaurant serving a variety of different dishes. Ana Lucila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ana Lucila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant and is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ana Lucila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Monja Blanca Group

texts.es: Doña Dolores es casada, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, pero gracias a un programa D. alfabetización donD. ella asistió, aprendió a escribir , tiene cuatro hijos, dos casados y dos solteros, el esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares, se dedica al comercio (Venta D. ropa y telas) en la plaza D. San Francisco el Alto, cuenta con 8 años D. experiencia en ésta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. algunas vecinas y compañeras D. negocio, organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MONJA BLANCA, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza D. animales y venta D. artículos D. consumo diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. mercadería, y D. esta forma así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Dolores is married. She didn't have the opportunity to attend school, but thanks to a literacy program that she attended, she learned to write. She has four children, two married and two single. Her husband works in agriculture, and she helps with some of the family expenses. She has a business selling clothing and fabric in the plaza of San Francisco el Alto. She has eight years of experience in this business. She relates with enthusiasm that she wanted to aim higher, so with the help of some neighbor women and fellow business women, they organized a group so that they could apply for a loan. Their community bank was named Monja Blanca, a name chosen by all the members. The group members are 11 women who work in a variety of activities; among them, we can mention raising animals and selling household products and traditional clothing. Doña Dolores will use the loan to buy merchandise and in this way generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shahnaz Bano's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz bano lives in a small city in Pakistan called Borewala.  
She is a house wife as well as a working woman who runs a sewing business. She operates her business from her home. She takes orders from nearby areas and completes the orders on time to earn profit. 
Her husband name is M. S. who has a business of selling fruits. He gets up early in the morning and puts the fruits on his cart and leaves his home for selling. He visits different streets in the community and sells fruits by announcing his products in a loud voice. Shahnaz also helps her husband by cleaning the fruits with water and arranging them on the cart. 
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy seasonal fruits in large quantity.  
She hopes that this investment will prove successful for her husband’s business and he will be able to increase his income. 
Note: “In the picture, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah passbook) in her hand is Shahnaz bano”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for fruit selling business

loans.name: Searle

texts.es:
Es muy usual en el Barrio Chino de Cartagena  el dinamismo diario que se  produce por el sinnúmero de pequeños negocios y comerciantes que transitan alrededor del mercado de Cartagena, que circunda a esta zona  donde vive  Searle, una mujer emprendedora y madre de dos hijos de 18 y 20 anos, quien inició su negocio de confecciones, hace mas de 15 anos con una sola maquina, después de haber trabajado de empleada de un taller. Su clientela inicial fue su propia familia, amigos y vecinos cercanos, con los que se esmero por fabricarle los mejores vestidos y responderle con mucha puntualidad,  para poder conservarlos  como  hasta hoy lo ha hecho y lograr el crecimiento de su negocio,   que ahora es reconocida por  instituciones y empresas con las que esta realizando contrataciones. 
Searle ha recibido 22  créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado durante 14 anos, durante los cuales ha fortalecido su capital de trabajo y ha logrado tener su propia vivienda.  En la actualidad esta aplicando a su credikiva para comprar telas e insumos y responder a un contrato de uniformes que tiene con una entidad estatal.
Su sueño se concentra ahora,  en el montaje de una cacharrería donde pueda vender insumos de confecciones como hilos, correderas, pellones y adornos, ampliar su mercado y lograr rotar rápidamente el efectivo mediante un nuevo negocio  que venda de contado y fortalezca  también al crecimiento de su confección .
texts.en:
In the China town district of Cartagena it is very common to sense the energy produced by the countless businesses and vendors that sell in the market of Cartagena. Searle lives in this region. She is an enterprising woman and a mother of two children, aged 18 and 20. She started out sewing clothes more than 15 years ago with one sewing machine, after having been employed in a tailor's shop. Initially her client base was her own family, her friend, and her nearest neighbors. She worked hard to make high quality clothes and to have her projects completed on time. She wishes to keep her clients and that has been a measure of her success. She has made her business grow and now she is well known by companies and shops, some of which she has established contract agreements. Searle has accessed 22 past loans from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner), an organization that has support her for the past 14 years. During that time she has strengthened her working capital funds and she has managed to have her own home where to live. Currently she requests a new loan to purchase fabrics and other materials to fill a contract to make school uniforms, a contract with a provincial institution. Her dream is to set up a stand from where to sell products such as threads, zippers, lining and decorations. She wishes to expand her client base and to this end she wants to start this new business. It will also help in supporting the growth of her tailoring shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other materials to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora P. is 41 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the town of Lopez Jaena within Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Nora operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Nora has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007 Nora joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Nora successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nora is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, her fourth from PMPC, that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old divorced man living alone. He has owned a metal shop for the past fifteen years. He makes aluminum designs, motors, and other metal-related work. Over the years, he has built a good business reputation, and he works closely with some metal companies. He took advantage of a first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client and paid on his scheduled date.

Today he is requesting a loan of 1200 USD from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform maintenance on his metalworking machine to continue his work properly. He is looking to expand his business further in the coming year, and he is optimistic about the future.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his metalworking machine

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 57 años de edad de estado civil casada, con cuatro hijos y con grado de instrucción de segundo de primaria.
Martina viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de golosinas y refresco de cebada.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 400.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería de su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son los ahorros que generan las ganancias, plazo de trabajo  y los regalos.
texts.en:
Martina is a member of the Communal Bank “Santiago Apóstol”, which is located in the District of Paucarcolla, Province and Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married, and has four children. Martina has a secondary grade education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for eight years. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which was used to increase her business capital for selling candy and barley soda.

Martina is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 400 PEN so that she can increase her inventory of merchandise for her business. Her dream is to move forward with her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings that generate income, the working terms, and the gifts.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of candy

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José Raúl, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene un taller de mecánica de automotores, vive con su esposa y su único hijo de nombre Cesar, José tiene 35 años de edad, su negocio es el taller y se dedica a él desde hace 10 años; por el momento quiere arreglar una herramienta que le sirve para soldar y también una motocicleta para hacerlo solicita un préstamo por una cantidad que le ajuste a pagar los repuestos y la mano de obra. Con esta ayuda el solventara esta situación y podrá tener en perfectas condiciones la herramienta y su motocicleta.
Su objetivo es mejorar la calidad de servicio a los automotores, y de esta manera ganarse la confianza de ellos para contar con los trabajos que necesiten, así estará asegurando ingresos para su hogar para que mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José Raúl lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  He owns a mechanic shop.  He lives with his wife and his only son Cesar.  José is 35 years old.  His business is his mechanic shop and he has been working there for 10 years.  Right now he would like to fix a piece of equipment which he uses for welding and also a motorcycle.  In order to do this he needs to take a loan for a quantity that will allow him to pay for the spare parts and labor.  This loan will help him resolve his situation and he will be able to have his piece of equipment and motorcycle in perfect condition.

José Raúl's goal is to improve the quality of service which he provides to drivers and thereby gain their trust.  In this way he will guarantee his household income so that he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To repair a piece of equipment and a motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Recorriendo las calles de su distrito, Rosa vende cosméticos las marcas muy reconocidas en el mercado. Es así que luego de sus labores domésticas, visita a sus familiares, amigas y vecinas de su barrio, a quienes vende éstos productos de belleza, aprovechando las ofertas que se presentan. Lleva más de 10 años trabajando de esta manera y por tal se siente muy satisfecha por las buenas utilidades que le deja y; mas aún cuando sus clientes le pagan a tiempo.  En adelante,  piensa instalar un bazar en un mercado de su distrito ó de lo contrario en su casa, para mejorar diversificar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, ya que su fin es darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Este es su 17avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy centrada en sus opiniones y como tal la respetan. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más productos de belleza, para cumplir pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old.  She is a very hard-working mother who lives in her own home with her husband and 2 children.  Rosa sells very well-known brands of cosmetics throughout the streets of her district.  After finishing her housework, she visits her family members, friends and neighbors to whom she sells these beauty products, taking advantage of offers.  She has been working in this way for more than 10 years and she feels very satisfied with the good profits that she makes.  She feels even more satisfied when her customers pay on time.

In the future Rosa plans to set up a stall in a market in her district or in her home so that she can improve and diversify her sales and increase her profits since her goal is to provide her children with a better quality of life.

This is Rosa's 17th loan from MFP.  She knows that she has to make her repayments on time and she is ready to do this.  In her community bank, she is a member who is very balanced in her opinions and, as such, her fellow members respect her.  She will use her loan to buy more beauty products to fill some orders which she has outstanding.

loans.use: To acquire more beauty products so that she can fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a married man with two children, who are both attending school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

He has been operating a retail shop for the past six years.  His local neighbours and town dwellers are his potential customers. In addition, he also operates a motorcycle business to contribute to his income. Thomas faces a major challenge in seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate the business. He hopes to purchase a public-vehicle van in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair motorcycle

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Esta persona se llama Emilia Martínez M. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Tenextepango, municipio de CD. Ayala del estado de Morelos, México. La Sra. Emilia estudio dos años de universidad. El préstamo de Fundación Realidad lo solicito principalmente para la compra de insumos para su negocio como son: harina, pavos, carnes frías, chiles, jamón salchichas, almendras, frutas secas y piña.
La señora Emilia tiene un negocio de panadería en su localidad en el cual vende: pan de dulce, teleras, bolillos, pan blanco, etc. ella tiene un año con su negocio, ella aprendió a elaborar pan porque su papa le enseño desde pequeña ya después también le enseño a su esposo a hacer el pan y actualmente su esposo hace el pan y ella lo vende, este negocio le a ayudado en todos los gastos, en la alimentación y para la escuela de su hijos.
El predio donde esta ubicado su negocio se lo heredo su papa y aunque tiene su negocio bien establecido también sale a vender su producto a Ahuehueyo en el mercado esta a 5 minutos de su casa se va en camioneta. Su negocio es importante porque es de ahí es donde mantiene a su familia, también nos comenta que le gusta la elaboración de pan y que su trabajo le da muchas satisfacciones como por ejemplo que la gente le diga que su pan esta sabroso. Comenta que en promedio atiende entre 50 y 80 personas al día, ella ofrece a sus clientes el navidad y año nuevo pavos horneados, piernas horneadas, Algunas de los desafíos que ha enfrentado en su negocio es el alza de los precios de sus materias primas como el azúcar, la harina, y también el aumento de la competencia.
Ella generalmente sus ganancias las reinvierte en su negocio y de esa manera va generando más ingresos y tiene planeado en un futuro ampliar su negocio poner otra panaderia.
La señora Emilia es casada y tiene dos hijos Ámbar de 8 años y estudia la primaria y Yael de 2 años. Su esposo le ayuda a la elaboración del pan y esta orgullosa de seguir la tradición de su papa que fue panadero. Ella piensa que en el futuro su negocio va  a crecer quiere tener otra panadería, con un ingreso mayor va a poder sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios. La señora Emilia quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por el préstamo pero yo esperaba que me prestaran mayor monto del préstamo”
texts.en:
This person is called Emilia Martínez M..  She is 34 years old and lives in Tenextepango, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, in Mexico.  Emilia studied for two years at university.  She is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad mainly to buy supplies for her business such as flour, turkey, cold meats, chilis, ham, sausages, almonds, nuts and pineapple.

Emilia has a bakery business in her neighborhood where she sells: sweet bread, 'teleras' (Mexican flat bread), bread rolls, white bread, etc.  She has been in her business for a year.  She learned to make bread because her dad taught her when she was a young girl.  She later taught her husband to make bread and he now makes the bread and she sells it.  This business has helped her with all her expenses, in paying for food and in paying for her children's schooling.  She inherited the premises where her business is located from her dad and although her business is well established, she also goes out to sell her products in Ahuehueyo, in the market.  It is 5 minutes from her home.  She travels there in a truck.  Emilia's business is important because it is how she supports her family.  She tells us that she likes making bread and that the work is very satisfying, for example when people tell her that her bread is very tasty.  She says that she serves on average 50 - 80 people a day.  She offers her customers baked turkeys and legs of meat at Christmas and New Year.  Some of the challenges that she has faced in her business have been the rise in prices for her raw materials such as sugar and flour and also the rise in competition.

Emilia generally re-invests her profits in her business which makes more profits.  In the future, she is planning to expand her business, setting up another bakery.

Emilia is married and has two children: 8 year-old Ámbar who is in elementary school and 2 year-old Yael.  Her husband helps her make her bread and she is proud to be following her dad's tradition as he was a baker.  She is planning to grow her business in the future and she would like to set up another bakery.  This will make her more income and she will be able to get her children ahead in their studies.  Emilia would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "thank you for the loan but I expected that you would lend me a larger loan amount".

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, eggs, salt, turkeys, cold meats, ham, sausages, almonds, nuts, pineapple and cherries

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es: LA Alcancía Comunal “Mi banquito” es un grupo conformado por 8 personas que residen en una zona rural, son arduos trabajadores, cada uno dedicado a distintas actividades. Ciceli tiene 33 años de edad y dos hijos dependientes de ella,   ejerce el cargo de presidenta del grupo, se dedica a  la producción y venta de Alfalfa y Flores  desde hace 12 años, es una persona de trato amable, su negocio es familiar. Venden flores en diferentes mercados de Lima, poseen chacras en un anexo de Huarochiri, se dedican al trabajo desde las 4:00 am diariamente  además de sembrar, cosechan Alfalfa. Ciceli nos manifiesta que al obtener más capital lo invertiría en los abonos y requerimientos de su negocio. Esta muy agradecida por los préstamos para sus negocios. En la fotografía Podemos apreciar a la alcancía Comunal “Mi banquito” contentos en su reciente reunión de desembolso, en casa de una de  las  socias.
texts.en:
The Mi Banquito ["My Little Bank"] Communal Bank is a group made up of 8 people who live in a rural zone. They are hard-workers and each one has a different job.
Ciceli is 33 and has 2 dependent children. She is the group president and has produced and sold alfalfa and flowers for 12 years. She is a person who provides good servce, and her business is a family business. They sell flowers in the various markets in Lima, and have farms in an annex of Huarochiri. They start working at 4:00 am every day, sowing and harvesting alfalfa. Ciceli told us that when she gets this loan she will invest in manure and other needs for her business. She is very grateful for these loans for her businesses. 
In the photo, we can see the happy Mi Banquito Communal Bank members at their recent payment meeting in the home of one of the members.

loans.use: to purchase manure for her farm where she grows flowers and alfalfa

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Juan se dedica al transporte publico como taxista libre actividad con la que mantiene a su familia d que esta compuesta por  dos hijos pequeños y la esposa quien le ayuda trabajando como maestra de un jardín de niños,  Se pudo comprobar con los vecinos de la zona  donde vive que el sr. Juan es muy trabajador y honesto ya que lleva bastantes años en esta actividad, viven en casa familiar pero uno de sus deseos es el de comprase un terreno y poder hacer construir su casita y así poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, su movilidad por el momento esta presentando algunas fallas por este motivo solicito el crédito para poder comprar repuestos para su movilidad y también para hacerle una chapería completa, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Juan works in public transport as a freelance taxi driver, supporting his family with this activity. His family is composed of two small children and his wife, who helps him by working as a teacher in a preschool. One can verify with the neighbors in the zone where Sr. Juan lives that he is very hard-working and honest, since he has spent many years in this activity. They live in the family home, but one of his desires is to buy a plot of land and be able to construct his own little house and thus offer greater comfort to his family. His vehicle at the moment has some faults, and for this reason he is applying for the loan, so that he can buy parts for his vehicle and also give the body a complete finishing. He is grateful to this institution (Emprender) for the support that they offer.

loans.use: Buy parts and have body work done.

loans.name: 30 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El grupo 30 de Mayo lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Reyna Isabel M. M. de 29 años quien vende ropa y cosa de horno. Ella a la edad de 8 ocho años empezó vendiendo elotes, cosa de horno y yoltamal para ayudar a su madre a los 21 invirtió en ropa ya con un negocio propio.
M. trabaja arduamente para que sus hijos tengan lo que ella no tuvo una infancia y estudios y su mayor sueño es que lleguen a la Universidad. Ella invertirá el crédito en ropa y cosa de horno.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Juana Mercedes M.  quien hace 24 años inicio vendiendo cosa de horno, elotes, yoltamal, cremas y desodorantes etc. y Elizabeth M. desde hace 5 años vende ropa y productos Avon.
texts.en:
The “30 de Mayo” group is composed of three hard working women.  One of them is Reyna Isabel M. M., 29, who sells clothes and baked goods.  She started out at the age of 8 selling corn on the cob, “cosa de horno” (an assortment of three or four typical baked pastries) and “yoltamal” (typical Nicaraguan corn and cheese tamal) to help her mother and at the age of 21 invested in clothes as a business of her own.

She works hard so that her children will have what she did not have, a childhood and an education.  Her greatest dream is that they get to the university.  She will use the loan to buy clothes and “cosa de horno.”

The other group members are Juana Mercedes M. who started selling “cosa de horno,” corn on the cob, “yoltamales,” creams, deodorants, etc. 24 years ago and Elizabeth M. who has sold clothes and Avon products for the past five years.

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Always Good Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Always Good” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 3,800,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariama J. is the leader of this group. A native of Waterloo, Mariama is married and has 5 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. For the past 6 years, Mariama has been selling charcoal and fire-wood. With her share of this loan, she will buy charcoal and fire-wood in large quantities to add to her current stock. 
 
(Also included on the left of the photo, is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers)

loans.use: To Buy charcoal and fire-wood in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is a married woman who lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling used clothing. Her husband Miguel, who is 58 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 24 to 30 years old. Lucena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lucena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 30,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000 to purchase more used clothing stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs, buy home appliances, and save up to increase her revolving capital. Lucena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Luis Espinal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUIS ESPINAL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de V. Adela.  Está compuesta por catorce integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Luisa.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: inicio de peluquería, venta de carne de cordero, tejido de mantas, macramé y mantas, costura, venta de calzados, costura de chamarras, tejido en cola de rata, venta de lanas, venta de carne de res, venta de medicamentos.

La señora Luisa, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que participa en Pro Mujer y que ingresar a la institución le invitaron los jóvenes de promoción de la institución

En la actualidad la señora Luisa tiene un negocio de venta de medicamentos (TIENS), nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga que le esta enseñando a trabajar con estos productos medicinales. El crédito que sacará ahora es para  comprar estos medicamentos, que los comprará de la oficina de (TIENS) del El Alto, luego, para venderlos, ella ambulara, porque ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, porque ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la atención.

En la foto podemos observar que tres personas no se las puede ver, ellas son la señora Ana, Máxima y Silvia, ya que no pudieron ubicarse adecuadamente.
texts.en:
The 'Luis Espinal' community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the V. Adela regional office.  This group has 14 members and its president is Luisa.  The businesses that the bank's members are engaged in are varied and include: setting up a hairdressing salon, selling lamb, knitting blankets, macramé and blankets, sewing, selling footwear, sewing jackets, weaving with satin cord, selling wool, selling beef and selling medicines.

Luisa, the bank's president, tells us that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She was invited to join by the institution's young promoters.

Luisa currently has a business selling Tiens-brand medicines.  She tells us that she learned the business from a friend who is teaching her to work with these medicinal products.  Luisa will use her loan to buy medicines from the Tiens office in El Alto.  She will then sell them as an itinerant street vendor because she doesn't have a fixed sales location.

This work allows Luisa to make money to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When we asked Luisa what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the services.

In the photo, we can see that three people are missing: Ana, Maxima and Silvia.  This is because they couldn't fit in properly.

loans.use: to buy Tiens-brand medicines

loans.name: Norberta Veronica

texts.es: Norberta Veronica es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde hace varios años tuvo que quedarse sola ya que  su esposo tuvo que emigrar a los Estados Unidos para traer mayores ingresos a su familia. A Norberta se le esta presenta una oportunidad la cual no quiere desaprovechar, en la colonia donde ella vive la mayoría de la gente no ha escriturado su casa por que los papeleos salen muy caros, lo cual una oficina de la localidad esta ofreciendo mejores precios para que estas familias tengan todo en regla. La señora Norberta necesita capital para pagar las escrituras de su casa ya que es su único patrimonio que les ofrecerá a sus tres pequeños hijos.
texts.en: Norberta Veronica is a very hard-working woman.  For several years, she has been living alone as her husband had to emigrate to the United States so that he could make more money for their family.  Norberta currently has an opportunity that she doesn't want to miss out on.  In the residential development where she lives, most people haven't registered their houses because the paperwork is really expensive.  A local office is offering better prices so that these families can have everything in order.  Norberta needs capital to pay to have her house formally registered since it is her only asset which she has to offer her three young children.

loans.use: to pay to formally register her house

loans.name: Olga Lydia

texts.es:
Olga, vive con sus padres, una hermana y es madre soltera de un niño de 10 años de edad, ella trabaja en la agricultura con la ayuda de sus padres, cultivan maíz, trabaja en tierras propias y no tiene un horario establecido.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo le ayudara para tener los recursos necesarios y poder desarrollar la siembra de este año.
Ella espera tener una buena cosecha y ayudar a su familia a mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga is a single mother of a 10 year-old boy and she lives with her parents and a sister.  With the help of her parents, she works in agriculture growing corn, working their own land and has an ever-changing work schedule.

She needs the loan to buy compost and fertilizer. This loan will help to provide the necessary resources and to sow the fields for this year.

She hopes to have a good harvest and help her family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek is 62 years old and lives in Tsakhkunk village in the Sevan area with his wife.  Aghabek’s children are married and live separately from their parents. For a long time, Aghabek worked at a state-owned cattle farm as a farm worker.

Aghabek and his wife have been farming for over 18 years and they say they like that occupation very much. On their own farm they breed cows and sheep. Thanks to his farming Aghabek was able to buy a truck, which he uses to deliver fodder for his farm animals. 

Aghabek is asking from Kiva lenders a loan for 500,000 AMD, which he will use to buy 8 or 10 calves. That will allow him to expand his farm and increase his family's income in the near future.

loans.use: To buy calves for his cattle farm

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 21 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has no children. Justine has a clothing sales business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Justine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more skills, such as how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: San Miguel De Pando Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel D. Pando trabaja con EDAPROSPO desD. hace 8 meses, tiene como integrantes a 8 socios emprendedores y muy carismáticos.
Marcelino es un joven microempresario, natural D. la ciudad D. Huánuco, a la edad 18 años decidió llegar a Lima, buscando un mejor futuro, actualmente vive con su padre, el cual se encuentra muy enfermo, Marcelino trabajó 2 años como ayudante D. carpintería y es ahí donD. deciD. independizarse y emprender su negocio D. producción D. muebles D. madera (camas, roperos, reposteros, mesas, sillas, etc.), además realiza ventas D. productos D. Omnilife, su mayor sueño es tener un local propio donD. pueda realizar la producción D. sus muebles y comprar una casa para darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
El préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra D. maderas e insumos para la fabricación D. muebles.
texts.en:
The 'San Miguel D. Pando' group has been working with EDAPROSPO for eight months.  The group's eight members are all entrepreneurial and very charismatic.

Marcelino is a young man and small businessman who is from the city of Huánuco.  At the age of 18 he decided to come to Lima in search of a better future.  He currently lives with his father who is very sick.

Marcelino worked for two years as a carpenter's assistant.  He decided to start working for himself and set up his own business making wooden furniture (beds, wardrobes, kitchen cupboards, tables, chairs, etc.)  He also sells Omnilife products.  Marcelino's biggest dream is to own his own premises where he can make his furniture and to buy a house so that he can proviD. his family with a better quality of life.

Marcelino will invest his money in buying wood and supplies for making furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood and supplies for making furniture

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma  is 31 years old.  She has 3 children and is separated from her husband.

Alma has a shop that sells snacks and basic items such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, and more.  She has had this business for 1 year.  Alma has requested a loan for 5,000.00 to buy additional goods to sell.

Alma has been a member of HSPFI since this year.  In the future,  she hopes to  improve her  store and make it bigger so she can accommodate  the needs of her village customers.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Zibambele Group

texts.en:
Nokuthula is 26 years old, single and has four children between the ages of one and nine, three of whom attend school. Nokuthula runs a livestock business in Kwa Zulu Nata in Mandini, South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.
Nokuthula has been in this business for two years and sells livestock chickens from her home. She also receives income from the goverment's child support grant. Nokuthula has requested this loan to buy livestock chickens through WDB and Kiva. She says that the extra income from the loan will help her improve her life. In the future she would like to own a wholesale business.
Nokuthula thanks WDB and Kiva for helping her, because she is not working.

loans.use: to buy livestock chickens.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoraida; la socia tiene 28 años; la socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 2 hijos y ella se dedica a la administración y atención de su tienda de abarrotes y depósito de cervezas, la socia trabaja con su conyugue él es ganadero y siempre que puede la apoya; La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad; la socia desea comprar arroz, fideos, aceites, leche harina. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 28, is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and two children.  She runs her grocery and beer warehouse.  She works with her spouse who raises livestock and helps her out whenever he’s able.  She wants to use the loan to buy some basic need items.  She wants to buy rice, noodles, oil, milk and flour.  She is requesting the loan to buy basic need items.

She is satisfied with and grateful for the support she’s gotten through this means and commits to repay her debt in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jose Concepcion

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, es casado, vendedor rutero, dicho negocio comenzó como ayudante ahora tiene su propio negocio, trabaja de lunes a domingo y no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
El, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de sodas, jugos, dulces, galletas y más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, dicha compra le ayudara incrementar la mercadería y mejorar sus ventas.
Su mayor sueño es mantener siempre su negocio, mejorarlo para tener una mejor vida y ofrecérsela a su familia.
texts.en:
José is married, and he lives with his wife and two children.  He is a salesman with an established route.  He started as a helper, but he now has his own business.  He works Monday to Sunday.  He does not have a fixed schedule to attend to his customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy sodas, juices, sweets, cookies, and more merchandise to offer his customers.  This purchase will help him increase his merchandise and improve his sales.

His biggest dream is to always keep his business and to improve it in order to have a better life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, sweets, and cookies for his business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 30, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Luciben, her business partner.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a rolling store. Her rolling store is basically a small housewares store which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails plastic flowers or basins to the local neighborhood. Her husband drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. Evelyn earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plastic ware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and rags to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of product items needed in her business.

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es:
Carlos, vive en compañía con su familia, administra un ciber donde ofrece servicio de computación, venta de CD, DVD, recargas celulares, chip de celulares, lleva ocho años aproximadamente.
Él necesita invertir en el Ciber, por esto a través del préstamo espera reparar y dar mantenimiento a 5 computadoras, que le ayuden a mejorar el servicio a los clientes, con esto será más competente y sus clientes estarán más satisfechos. Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, incrementar sus aumentos y manejar correctamente los prestamos ya que por medio de estos crecerá en el mercado.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his family and runs an Internet cafe where he offers computer services and sells CDs, DVDs, cell phone minutes and cell phone chips.  He has been in this business for approximately eight years.

Carlos needs to invest in his Internet cafe.  He hopes to use his loan to repair and service five computers.  This will help him to improve his customer service which will make his customers happier.  His goal is to improve his business, increase his profits and correctly manage his loans as the loans will enable him to grow his business.

loans.use: to have five computers serviced

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children. Three of his children are still attending school. He has been working in his town’s municipality as a police officer since 2010. He cooperates financially with his wife who works as a tailor to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his children’s school registration fees. He says that the school year is about to begin and he must pay the required amount to the school management as soon as possible so that the children can pursue their education without having any financial problems.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school registration fees

loans.name: Getrida

texts.en: Getrida is a thirty-two year old married woman with four children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling soda and salted fish for five years. Her vision is to finish constructing her house plus educating her children. Getrida needs the loan to buy fish and soda for sale

loans.use: to buy fish and soda for sale

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old, widowed, and has twelve children. 

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like seasonings, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store.

She has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for eleven years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Emelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo debido a la necesidad de comprar especias para el negocio, este préstamo le servirá muchísimo para tener una mejor variedad y poder atender la demanda de los clientes, su compra será en achiote, cominos, pimientas, hojas secas de laurel, estos materiales son demandados por las amas de casa, para la comida, por lo que esta inversión será muy provechosa.
Él está agradecido porque la inversión anterior, ya que estos aportes le permite crecer en el negocio y ahora cuenta con un medio de transporte, para poder ofrecer a diferentes zonas sus productos, todo lo ha logrado a traves de los prestamos.
texts.en:
Luis is once again requesting a loan because he needs to buy spices for his business.  This loan will be of great help for him to have a wider variety available to meet customer demand.  He will buy annatto, cumin, pepper and dry bay leaves, supplies that are in demand by housewives for their cooking; this is why this investment will be so profitable.  

He’s grateful for the previous investment because it helped his business to grow and he now has a means of transportation to go sell his wares in different zones.  He’s accomplished all this thanks to the loans.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos dos quais um bebé e o outro frequenta a Escola. Fez a 12ª classe e frequentou a formação de professores. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais um sobrinho que vive com ela. 

É professora na Escola Primaria Fishe ha mais de 6 anos e tem um salario de 7.395.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimo noutros bancos (BIM) no valor de 20.000.00mt e concluiu o pagamento sem dificuldades. Conheceu  a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa (blocos, cimento, pedra, areia, barrotes, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children - one of them is a baby and the other one attends school. She completed 12th grade and studied to become a teacher. She lives with her family in a house she owns and she also supports a nephew who lives with her.
She has been a teacher at Fishe Primary School for over six years and earns a salary of 7.395mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan in another bank before and finished repaying it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution.
This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (cinder blocks, cement, stone, sand, rafters, etc.). She promises to repay according to the schedule. 
n the future, she intends to finish building and furnishing her house, and for that purpose she plans to request other loans to Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cinder blocks, cement, stone, sand, rafters, etc.).

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 31-years-old. She is married with 2 children. 

Amor has a shop that sells clothing like shirts & blouses & also curtains & bed sheets or covers. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy clothing, curtains & bed sheets to sell.

Amor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, curtains & bed sheets for selling.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 41 años es un hombre casado. Él y Yolanda, su esposa, tienen 2 hijos de 17 y 10 años. Todos ellos viven en cuartos alquilados en la ciudad de Tarma. Por brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, Juan salió de su comunidad natal hacia la ciudad de Tarma. Ahí aprendió a desenvolverse en otras actividades. 
En su comunidad de Ricrican cuenta con terrenos propios de cultivos de papas. Sus padres y hermanos se encargan de cuidar los sembríos, pero viaja constantemente para ir a cerciorarse de su crecimiento y necesidades.
En la ciudad de Tarma ha instalado un puesto de venta en el mercado, donde su esposa expende sus papas, y también otras variedades que compra del mercado mayorista. Por su parte, realiza servicio de transporte de productos en el mismo mercado, para ello utiliza su propio triciclo. Ambas actividades son complementarias. De esa manera pueden pagar sus deudas y educar como se debe a sus hijos. “Me gustaría ver a mis hijos cursar estudios superiores o profesionales, esa sería mi mayor recompensa”, menciona. Por tal razón continuará con los sembríos de papas en mayor cantidad. Sería el préstamo número 15 que obtendría de MFP, se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Además comenta, que el agrada el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal, por compartir los mismos intereses. 
Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de 5 bolsas de abonos y con lo restante comprará semillas de papas.
texts.en:
Juan is 41 years old he is married and with Yolanda, his wife, they have 2 children of 17 and 10 years of age. They all live in rented rooms in the city of Tarma. To give a better education to his children, Juan left his native community for the city of Tarma, where he learned new jobs.

In Juan’s community, Ricrican, he has his own land and cultivates potatoes. His parents and brothers take care of the crops, but Juan travels frequently to make sure of his crops' growth and necessities.

In the city of Tarma Juan started his own stall in the market; his wife sells the potatoes and other varieties that he buys in the wholesaler market. Juan works transporting products to the same market, he uses his three wheeled vehicle to do so, and both of his jobs complement each other. It is through his work that he is able to pay his debts and educate his children the best way possible. “I would like to see my children get a higher education or be professionals, that would be my greatest reward,” Juan remarks. It is for this reason that he will continue to grow potatoes in greater quantities. This will be his fifteenth loan with MFP and is committed to paying his quotas punctually. Juan notes that he enjoys the work in his communal bank since they share the same interests.

Juan will use the loan to buy 5 bags of manure and with what’s left he will buy more potatoes.

loans.use: buy 5 bags of organic manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 32 years and has one child aged two. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. She owns a general store which she has run for one year. Angelique would like a loan to buy rice, sugar, and other foodstuffs. The profits will be used to make savings for her future. She has a vision of one day owning a warehouse and selling things wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 24 years old and lives in Buchanan; she is single and has a 2 year-old child. 

For six  years now, Naomi has been operating a salon where she plaits and dresses hair.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more material (artificial hair) for her business.  She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase artificial hair for her business

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 50 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy trabajadora, esta casada con Jorge quien tiene 52 años y tienen dos hijos de 16 y 9 años, ellos comparten sus días y la alegría de educar a sus hijas, viven en una casa propia desde donde trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Zoila trabaja en un sector muy concurrido, tiene una negocio muy bueno y que le brinda muchas posibilidades, su negocio funciona en su propia casa, tiene un puesto de comida donde vende sus deliciosos platillos, el aroma que sale de sus ricos potajes es suficiente para atraer a los clientes, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general vende mucho durante toda la noche, tiene 32 años en este negocio, el cual le a dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijas y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner un restaurante, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos y así mejorar su ingresos económicos, se superó mucho desde que comenzó y sabe que trabajando poco a poco se puede lograr grandes cosas. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil atender a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este será el octavo préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará ingredientes para continuar con la preparación de sus platos, además de algunos utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta para poder continuar con su labor.
texts.en:
Zoila, 50, is a cheerful, kind, very hardworking woman.  She’s married to Jorge, 52, and they have two children who are 16 and 9 years old.  They share their days and the joy of educating their daughters.  They live in their own house where she works hard to provide a better quality of life for her family.

Zoila works in a very busy sector.  She has a very good business that provides many possibilities.  Her business operates in her home.  She has a food stand where she sells her delicious meals.  The aroma from her delicious stews is enough to attract customers.  Her stand is very popular and in general she sells much during the night.  She’s been in this business for 32 years and it’s given her money to feed her daughters and pay for their schooling.  But, she feels that later on she’ll have more expenses and money will be insufficient.  This is why she wants to open a restaurant to sell her delicious dishes more comfortably and thus improve her income.  She’s improved quite a bit since she started and she knows that by working it’s possible to gradually reach great things.

She enjoys chatting with her customers; she enjoys it very much but it’s difficult to tend to all the people who come to her stand but even so she does not falter in her eagerness to get ahead and is willing to work hard to accomplish it.

This will be her 8th MFP loan so she’s hoping for your collaboration to continue with her objectives; she commits once again to make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible and very supportive people.  She will use the requested 3000 soles to buy ingredients to continue making her delicious meals and will also buy some kitchen utensils she needs to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Pasikazia

texts.en: Pasikazia is 56 years old, a widow with one child who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her child. She has been a trader in fresh foods for the last four years. The major business hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. However, she would like to diversify her business to include livestock farming. The purpose of this loan is to buy fresh foods for resale.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for resale.

loans.name: Rosario De Lourdes

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer de 45 años, se considera una persona emprendedora, luchadora y decidida a cumplir sus objetivos. rosario es casada y tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en Otavalo provincia de Imbabura.

Rosario trabaja sola en la producción y venta de artesanías como manillas, collares, pulseras, figuras de madera, etc. Rosario trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2002, el actual crédito va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para la producción de artesanías como: hilo nylon, mullos, hilo de varios colores, madera, pintura entre otros y también comprará una batidora para la panadería en la cual trabaja su cónyugue. Esta inversión ayudará a Rosario y su familia mejorar la calidad de vida y seguir dandoles el estudio a sus hijos.

El sueño de Rosario es poder incrementar sus negocios y así poder generar empleo, en lo familiar desea que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 45-year-old woman who considers herself to be an enterprising and hardworking person determined to reach her goals. Rosario is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Otavalo province in Imbabura.

Rosario works on her own producing and selling handicrafts such as wristbands, necklaces, bracelets, wooden figurines, etc. Rosario has been working with Fodemi since 2002. She will invest this loan in purchasing the raw materials she needs to produce her handicrafts, materials like nylon thread, beads, thread in assorted colors, wood, paint, and other supplies. She will also purchase a mixer for the bakery in which her husband works. This investment will help Rosario and her family improve their quality of life, and she will be able to continue providing her children with an education.

Rosario's dream is to increase her business, thus allowing her to generate employment opportunities. Her family goal is for her children to grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nylon thread, beads, thread in assorted colors, wood, paint, and other supplies so that she can increase her production of handicrafts.

loans.name: Benkadi Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du BENKADI VI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Madoudiarrabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIA, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,75 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250 000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Geisel

texts.es: Geisel es una mujer con 38 años de edad, madre de un niño y es jefa de hogar. Vive con su hijo, el cual cursa la primaria y dos hermanas que ella mantiene desde el momento en que su madre falleció. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, esforzada y con muchos deseos de salir adelante. Tiene visión empresarial. Su actividad a través de los años ha presentado altibajos, sin embargo se considera que le va bien, debido a que ha podido enfrentar las obligaciones y responsabilidades adquiridas. Su negocio es una librería y bazar. Está ubicado en su casa, ella acondicionó un cuarto en frente de su casa para mostrar su mercadería, en una comunidad aledaña al centro de Limón. Cuenta con una cartera sana de clientes, gracias al buen trato y forma de pago que les brinda, los cuales son familiares, vecinos, escolares y trabajadores de diferentes comercios e instituciones de la comunidad limonense. Ella va al centro de Limón a ofrecer su mercadería. Ha obtenido varios créditos con la Fundación y siempre ha mostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad. Ahora solicita otro financiamiento para reforzar su negocio comprando cortinas, colchas, ropa de mujer y hombre para su bazar, asi aumentar su patrimonio para satisfacer al cliente; generar mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en: Geisel is a 38-year-old woman, the mother of a child and the head of household. She lives with her son who is in primary school and her two sisters who she has supported since the time their mother died. She is a very hard-working and earnest woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. She has an entrepreneurial vision. Her work through the years has had ups and downs, however she thinks it has gone well for her since she has been able to face the obligations and responsibilities she acquired. Her business is a bookstore and miscellany shop. It is located in her house, she set up a room at the front of the house to show her merchandise in a neighboring community to the center of Limón. She has a healthy customer base, thanks to the good treatment and the payment terms she offers them, who are family members, neighbors, students and workers at different businesses and institutions in the community of Limón. She goes to the center of Limón to sell her merchandise. She has gotten various loans from the foundation and has always showed punctuality and responsibility. Now she asks for another loan to strengthen her business purchasing curtains, quilts, women's and men's clothing for her miscellany shop, so to increase her legacy to satisfy the customers, generate more income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Hello, lenders! The above picture presents Rosemary, a mother of 11 who has been practicing agriculture for the last 5 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives together with her children in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is known for maize farming. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Generating an income through selling harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of labour is a major challenge for Rosemary. She also keeps a dairy cow. Before joining Juhudi, Rosemary could not access loans from banks since she is a woman and also a smallholder farmer. She joined Juhudi Kilimo and learnt about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva. Rosemary is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. With your loan, Rosemary will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. Rosemary waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en:
Married to a primary school teacher for ten years, Kossiwa F. has three children and also takes care of her mother. Her husband lost his salary 18 months ago, and she feels compelled to cover all family expenses with her income from selling various manufactured goods. Her primary-school education gives her insight into management, and she exhibits a dynamism in her activities. She embodies trust and deserves financial support.

She is requesting a loan of $550 to augment her purchasing power towards selling manufactured products, such as shoes and sandals. Her goal is to increase her income and to better provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à un enseignant du primaire depuis 10 ans, Madame F. Kossiwa a trois (03) enfants et sa mère en charge. Son mari est sans salaire il y a 18 mois et elle se voit dans l’obligation de prendre toutes les charges familiales avec les revenus de la vente des divers produits manufacturés. Son niveau d’instruction primaire lui confère une clairvoyance dans sa gestion et un dynamisme dans ses activités. Elle nourrit confiance et mérite d’être appuyée financièrement.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $550 dans le but d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et de vente des produits manufacturés afin d’accroître ses revenus et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell shoes and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy would like to start a small business of selling beauty items, lessos, sandals, blouses and tops.

loans.name: Iskander

texts.en: Iskander is an IDP from the Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has two children. He started his business in 2002 and applied to Normicro Baku branch to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To buy some equipment

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim S. is a 53-year-old married man who has three children. He is a farmer in Varkhankend Village near Imishli town, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1999, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. He has made very good profit by selling milk products such as yoghurt, sour-cream, and milk. These products are in high demand in his area.

Over the years, life in Azerbaijan has gotten harder and harder and to cover family needs, one cow is not enough. In 2006 Ibrahim borrowed US$ 500 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2007, prices have doubled and Ibrahim has applied for a loan of $800 from Aqroinvest CU to purchase two calves for meat production. The estimated cost for one calf is $400.

loans.use: purchase two calves to expand his micro-business into meat production

loans.name: Alberto Alfredo

texts.es:
Alberto is a young livestock farmer who sells meat to people who live in and visit his locale. His work in this area permits him to maintain his wife and their young daughter. He is 22 years old and carries an immense responsibility on his shoulders. He knows that he cannot give himself the luxury of rest because each moment counts toward increasing his productivity. In spite of leading a young family with lots of enthusiasm, he understands that in order to grow and better his products he needs a sum of money as investment capital. For this reason he is asking our help in raising $150 dollars in order to invest in his farmland and the purchase of small animals which over time will increase his capital and quality of life. If you are able to help Alberto please do so. He needs people like you.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto es un joven ganadero que vende carne a las personas que viven y visitan su localidad. Su desempeño en esta actividad le permite mantener a su esposa y a su pequeña niña. Tiene 22 años y una inmensa responsabilidad a cuestas, sabe que no puede darse el lujo de descansar porque cada momento cuenta para aumentar su productividad y a pesar de ser una familia joven con mucho entusiasmo comprende que para crecer y mejorar sus productos necesita de una suma de dinero como capital de inversión; motivo por el cual solicita nuestra ayuda con la monto de 150 dólares para invertirlos en sus terrenos de cultivo y en la compra de animalitos pequeños que con el transcurrir del tiempo incrementarán su capital y calidad de vida.Si usted tiene la posibilidad de ayudar a Alberto no deje de hacerlo, él necesita de personas como usted.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for his farmland and small animals for his modest farm.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria Maria is a loving mother and dedicated wife. Her life revolves around her family. She is also a business owner. She has 5 sons. Together with her husband they've made sure that their sons are well-provided. Four of them are college educated.

About 1 1/2 year ago, Gloria had to make a choice between staying at home and working at the local market in the city of Managua. She started with $1,000 usd which 1/2 was from savings and the other half was from a loan.

Her business locale is now very spacious and in better conditions. For the past 8 months, CEPRODEL has been part of this success story in the life of Gloria Maria.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria Maria es ama de casa, madre incondicional y esposa dedicada. Su vida gira en torno del bienestar de su familia, sin embargo ella tambien es propietaria y trabajadora de su negocio. Su familia esta conformada por cinco hijos fruto de su matrimonio a los que en conjunto con su esposo han tratado de sacar adelante. Cuatro de ellos son becados universitarios.

Hace 1½ año Gloria tuvo que abandonar la vida únicamente de ama de casa e iniciar su negocio en el mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de managua, el cual inicio con un capital de U$1,000.00 los cuales eran una parte ahorro y la otra parte prestamo. El local cuando inicio solo constaba de madera y zinc.

Actualmente su negocio es amplio y las condiciones del mismo son muy buenas. CEPRODEL ha sido parte de este avance en la vida de Gloria Maria durante 8 meses.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Zacarías

texts.en:
Zacarías is a relatively young businesswoman, and she and her partner have a very big family: ten children, seven of them girls. Just two of the children work while the others attend school.

Zacarías has been selling men´s clothing for two years. She runs her business in the morning, and in the evening she works in a lottery bank. Biweekly, she leaves her neighborhood to collect clothing from Santo Domingo, the capital. She also occasionally buys garments from a frontier city in Haiti.

With her loan, she plans to purchase used clothing in bulk to resell in her community. Given the loan, Zacarías will be in a better condition to improve her very needy family´s living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of used clothing in bulk to resell in her town

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is a forty-two year-old businesswoman who lives in Chácaro, in the community of Yamasá. She is married, with four children (two boys and two girls) who all attend school.

Gabriela has been running a grocery store for the past two years. Now, she wants to expand and add fried vegetables to her business so that she can increase her income. The grocery is the principal source of income of the family. Gabriela hopes she will get the loan soon so that she can start her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy new products in order to expand a small general store.

loans.name: Ahmadali

texts.ru:
Ahmadali R. Mirzoevich lives in the region of Shahrinau. He is 33 years old, married and has one child. He has secondary education. He is in the animal husbandry business and breeding of livestock. He plans to use the loan to buy sheep and goat to increase his livestock. He has four years of experience in this field. It's the main source of income for Ahmadali and his family. Also, the development of this business allows his clients to buy fresh meat at reasonable prices. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджабов Ахмадали Мирзоевич проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 33 года, женат,имеет1 ребенка. Образование среднее. Занимается разведением и торговлей мелко-рогатого скота. Кредит планирует использовать для покупки овец и коз для увеличения поголовья скота.Опыт в данном бизнесе клиент имеет уже 4 года. Эта деятельность является основным источником дохода егосемьи.Также развитие данного сектора позволяет покупать клиентам свежее мясо и по доступным ценам.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village C(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet S.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to buy a weighing scale. Harriet is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a commercial motorcyclist for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 3 to 12 and most of her children go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 75000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Betty B.. Betty B. has a business selling charcoal and wants to expand and become a supplier.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 30 years old and is married woman with two children, ages 10 and 6. Rehema owns a small telephone shop, which she started in 2006. She works from 7am to 10pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Rehema has taken out a previous successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more telephone parts.

loans.use: To buy more telephone parts for her phone shop.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua B. is a fishmonger. She is married and has four children. She buys fresh fish from fishermen, brings it home for processing and then later sells the fish to local costumers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To purchase fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Unry

texts.en: A. Unry was born in 1958 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Mrs. A. does not have higher education; however, she has good business skills. Therefore, she has been able to earn income running her own business for the past 18 years. Mrs. A. sells livestock in the local bazaar. She is very polite and has had no problems with the repayment of previous loans. Currently, Mrs. A. needs a loan of US$625 for business turnover increase. She plans to repay the loan in four months.

loans.use: Business turnover increase

loans.name: Thi Xoa

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Xoa, 38 years old, has 2 school-going children. She owns a general store and an eatery. Her business goes well due to her husband's tremendous help. Everyday her husband purchases the foods and goods for her to sell. With reasonable price and friendly atmosphere, her stores always attract many customers, thus her monthly income always reaches 3,000,000VND (about 190USD). This time, she would like to borrow 8,000,000VND (500USD) to purchase more foods and goods for her business so that she can increase her family's income.
 Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.
Chị T. Thị Xoa năm nay 38 tuổi. Gia đình chị  có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang có cửa hàng kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá và bán hàng ăn. Công việc kinh doanh của chị có nhiều thuận lợi do chị nhận được sự hỗ trợ rất đắc lực từ chồng. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy hàng về chế biến cho chị bán cho khách hàng. Với thái độ niềm nở, giá cả hợp lý nên cửa hàng nhà anh chị lúc nào cũng đông khách vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000đ  đầu tư mua thêm đồ dùng và thực phẩm để phục cụ cho công việc kinh doanh tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: Invest in eatery and general store

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., age 58, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1985, she and her husband Norng Song, age 62, have worked growing rice to earn a living and are able to earn around $2.50 per day. So far, they have dug a pond to raise fish for extra profit. This couple has seven children, three of whom are married and no longer live at home.

Mrs. S. would like to request a loan of $800 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase more fish to raise and feed for the fish.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to raise and feed for the fish, as well.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou H. est coiffeur depuis 3 ans à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 25 ans, Kokou est célibataire sans enfants. Il souhaite, par ce crédit acheter des tondeuses et aussi aménager son atelier. Ce faisant il gagnera la confiance de la clientèle et augmentera son chiffre d’affaire pour le remboursement de son crédit et aussi la survie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou H. has worked as a barber for the last three years in Adeta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Kokou is 25 years old, single, with no children. With this loan, he wants to buy some clippers and also make improvements to his salon.
